title: Systemutvecklare Kustbevakningens verksamhetssystem
description:
Kustbevakningen är en civil statlig beredskapsmyndighet som ansvarar för sjöövervakning och räddningstjänst till sjöss på uppdrag av regering och riksdag. Med vår maritima förmåga är Kustbevakningen också en viktig myndighet i Sveriges totalförsvar. En viktig del i sjöövervakningsuppdraget är att tillse säkerhet i Sveriges maritima zoner. Detta sker bland annat genom brottsbekämpning, övervakning och ordningshållande verksamhet. Kustbevakningens räddningstjänstuppdrag innefattar ett brett spektrum av olika räddningsinsatser. Bland annat miljöräddningsinsatser vid olyckor eller utsläpp och räddningsinsatser vid haverier eller nödsituationer. Kustbevakningen är ett maritimt nav som ska tillse en civil sjölägesbild för Sverige samt att andra myndigheter får tillgång till den maritima förmåga de behöver för sitt uppdrag. En viktig del i Kustbevakningens uppdrag är att stödja andra delar av samhället utifrån den expertkunskap som myndigheten förfogar över. Kustbevakningen är en arbetsplats som präglas av samarbete och engagemang över områdesgränserna. Här finns engagerade medarbetare med varierande kompetenser vilket skapar en dynamisk arbetsplats med ständiga möjligheter att lära nytt. Kustbevakningen arbetar med och har stort fokus på medarbetarskap och ledarskap och det är därför viktigt att din värdegrund stämmer överens med Kustbevakningens – helhetssyn, välvilja och engagemang. Kustbevakningen erbjuder en attraktiv arbetsplats som utmärks av strävan att vara fri från diskriminering och ge lika möjligheter och rättigheter till alla.

**Beskrivning**


Kustbevakningens IT-avdelning finns i Karlskrona, Stockholm, Malmö och Göteborg. Avdelningen har ansvar för utveckling och drift av system som används av alla delar i Kustbevakningen, både som stöd till den operativa- såväl som den administrativa verksamheten. IT avdelningen strävar efter att kontinuerligt utvecklas för att kunna möta en omvärld i snabb förändring. Det sker i en komplex IT-miljö med stora krav på säkerhet och hög tillgänglighet.


IT-avdelningen är indelad i fyra enheter; en för klient & support, en för IT-infrastruktur, en för IT-säkerhet och en för applikationsutveckling & IT-stöd. Inom enheten för applikationsutveckling & IT-stöd söker vi nu en .NET systemutvecklare.

**Arbetsuppgifter**  

  

Rollen som systemutvecklare innebär att vidareutveckla och förvalta ett av Kustbevakningens mest centrala och viktiga verksamhetssystem, KIBS (Kustbevakningens Informations- och Beslutsstöd System).


Systemet används inom den operativa verksamheten vid exempelvis genomförande av olika typer av inspektioner och miljöoperationer samt är ett stöd för Kustbevakningens ledningscentral.


Som systemutvecklare kommer du att arbeta med utveckling av hela eller delar av systemet, frontend respektive backend. Du ingår i ett agilt förvaltnings- och utvecklingsteam tillsammans med andra systemutvecklare, teknisk systemägare och funktionell systemägare som hanterar behovsanalys, krav och lösningsförslag, genomförande, test och leverans. Rollen kan även innebära att leda utveckling av specifika utvecklingsområden inom teamet.


Vi har ett nära samarbete med kravställare och slutanvändare av systemet från Kustbevakningens operativa verksamhet. Det ger snabbt resultat och återkoppling av den nya funktionalitetens användbarhet.

**Kvalifikationer**

  

För rollen ser vi att du har:

* akademisk utbildning inom datateknik, systemvetenskap, mjukvaruutveckling alternativt annan utbildning i kombination med arbetslivserfarenhet som av arbetsgivaren bedöms likvärdig.
* goda kunskaper i tal och skrift inom både svenska och engelska.


Du har även kunskap och erfarenhet av:

* Microsoft Visual Studio (C#, Javascript)
* Entity Framework (HTML5, CSS3)
* SQL och SQL-databaser
* Systemgränssnitt (REST API)
* utveckling av användargränssnitt (GUI)


Vi ser det som meriterande om du utöver ovan har:

* aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av att de senaste åren arbetat som fullstacks utvecklare med webutveckling och webapplikationsutveckling i .NET-miljö.
* kompetens och erfarenhet av mobila lösningar, PWA (Progressive Web Application) och samt Blazor och Blazor Web Assembly.


Du behöver ha helhetssyn med god förståelse för IT´s roll i en verksamhet från både ett tekniskt synsätt och ur ett användarperspektiv. Som systemutvecklare på Kustbevakningen kan du växla mellan att arbeta självständigt och i nära samarbete med andra och är skicklig på att kommunicera, även med de som har annan bakgrund. Utöver det så är du lösningsfokuserad och organiserad.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och förmågor.

**Villkor**


Anställningen är tillsvidare med 6 månaders provanställning och tillträde sker efter överenskommelse. Tjänsten är placerad på plats i Karlskrona, det kommer inte att finnas möjlighet att arbeta helt på distans.


För anställning krävs svenskt medborgarskap, körkort för personbil, godkänt drogtest samt  

säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen. Kustbevakningen medverkar i utlandsuppdrag och internationella insatser. I anställningen ingår därför en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands i de fall det krävs för verksamheten.


Vid tillsvidareanställning medföljer även en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.


Övrigt För att kvalitetssäkra och effektivisera rekryteringsarbetet använder vi ett elektroniskt ansökningsformulär i samarbete med Varbi för samtliga lediga jobb. Fyll i din ansökan så omsorgsfullt som möjligt för att ge en rättvisande bild av dig själv. Kustbevakningen är en statlig myndighet och det innebär att uppgifterna som du lämnar till oss kan komma att lämnas ut enligt offentlighetsprincipen. Normalt gäller ingen sekretess för de uppgifter som behandlas i databasen. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ska du kontakta den kontaktperson som finns angiven i annonsen. Inför rekryteringsarbetet har Kustbevakningen tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför bestämt kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.


Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Karlskrona | Län: Blekinge län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2026/14 | Kontakt: Anna Brunell 0708-723914, | Facklig företrädare: SACO/SRAT, TULL-KUST och Seko kontaktas via Kustbevakningens växel 0776-707000, | Publicerat: 2026-02-09 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2026-03-02

title: Systemutvecklare DevSecOps
description:
*Vi tror att framsteg och möjligheter skapas bäst tillsammans. Välkommen till en plats där samarbete gör skillnad.*


Är du positiv, engagerad och intresserad av att jobba med systemutveckling? Vill du vara en del i ett nytt team där ledorden är nyfikenhet, samarbete och värdeskapande?


Vi utvecklar, testar och driftar kontinuerligt och söker flera personer med olika kompetenser att bilda ett drivet och diversifierat team.


Din roll:


Vi söker flera personer som vill ingå ett drivande team där man får vara kreativ och tänka utanför boxen, har ett brinnande intresse för mjukvaruutveckling, relevant utbildning och/eller erfarenhet av att arbeta inom DevOps metodiken och har ett starkt intresse för säkerhetspraxis i linje med DevSecOps. Det är även till fördel ifall du som person är självgående och proaktiv i dina teknikval.


I den här rollen får du möjlighet att arbeta i hela utvecklingskedjan - från kravställning till utveckling och test. Du får vara med och forma lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Vi söker dig smo har en stark teknisk kompetens samtidigt som du har en stor kommunikativ förmåga då krav ständigt bollas med kund såväl som inom teamet. Du ska trivas i en samarbetande miljö där idéer och expertis delas för att nå gemensamma mål och ha en god kommunikationsförmåga på både svenska och engelska.


Din profil:


Du besitter idag en bred kompetens inom flera områden, vilket gör dig väl lämpad för denna roll. Vi lägger stor vikt på vem du är som person, lagspelare, engagerad i arbetsuppgifterna och har ambitionen att kontinuerligt lära sig.  

För att trivas och lyckas i denna position ser vi att du har erfarenhet från någon eller flera av följande områden:

* Programmering och utveckling:  

Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med programmeringsspråk som C#/.Net, Python och Java. Du har också kunskap om REST-API:er och har utvecklat webbapplikationer samt arbetat med både back-end och front-end utveckling.
* Databashantering:  

Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med databaser såsom MS SQL och Postgres, och har kunskap om applikationsutveckling och verktygsutveckling.
* DevOps och CI/CD:  

Du har kunskap om DevSecOps metodik och har erfarenhet av att arbeta med CI/CD-pipelines. Du är bekant med verktyg som Artifactory, Bitbucket och Git.
* Konfigurationshantering och automatisering:  

Du har förståelse för Version Control Systems (CM)/konfigurationshantering och har erfarenhet av att arbeta med Puppet och Bash. Du har också kunskap om Product Data Management systems (PDM).
* IT-infrastruktur:  

Du har en god förståelse för IT-infrastruktur, inklusive nätverk, virtuella maskiner och operativsystem som Linux och Windows
* Kravstruktur/kravhantering  

Förståelse för komplexa krav kopplat till myndigheters regelverk och dess efterlevnad samt regulatoriska krav för utveckling av Configuration Management system.


Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap


Vad blir du en del av:


Upptäck oändliga möjligheter. Anta utmaningar, skapa smarta innovationer och uppgradera dina förmågor. Det här är en plats för kluriga tänkare, modiga pionjärer och alla däremellan. Tillsammans uppnår vi det extraordinära, var och en tar med sitt unika perspektiv. Varje bidrag räknas.


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 26,100 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Summerworker - BI developer
description:
**Looking for a hands-on summer job where you can turn data into insights that actually matter?**
**We’re looking for a motivated Power BI Report Developer to join our Business Intelligence team over the summer.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


This role is perfect for a student or early-career professional who enjoys working with data, building dashboards, and learning in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. Y


ou’ll work with modern tools like Power BI and Snowflake, support real business needs, and gain valuable experience to strengthen your BI or analytics career.

**What You’ll Do**

* Design, develop, and improve Power BI dashboards and reports
* Query, model, and prepare data using Snowflake
* Support ad-hoc reporting requests from the business
* Ensure reports are accurate, consistent, and reliable
* Collaborate with analysts, stakeholders, and the wider BI team
* Follow BI best practices, standards, and documentation
* Be an active, helpful team member who contributes to a positive BI culture

**What We’re Looking For**

* Hands-on experience with Power BI (data modeling, DAX, report design)
* Basic to intermediate SQL skills
* Experience working with datasets and transforming data
* Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
* Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
* Fluent English, written and spoken


You are curious and eager to learn, with a positive and approachable attitude. You enjoy collaborating with others, take responsibility for your work, and care about delivering high-quality results. You feel comfortable working in a dynamic, friendly team environment and are motivated to contribute and grow.

**What We Offer**


We offer a great opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a modern BI environment using Power BI and Snowflake, supported by an experienced and collaborative BI team. You’ll work on real business challenges, gain exposure to stakeholders, and be part of an open and welcoming culture where your contributions are valued. This role is also an excellent chance to build your portfolio and strengthen your CV.

**Are you interested in becoming part of Verisure? Apply today!**

Verisure is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from diverse backgrounds. We are an international company with offices and colleagues in multiple countries.


We are excited to hear from you. If you are interested, please apply through our application system. This will ensure a fair process for everyone.


If you have questions regarding this position reach out to our Global Talent Acquisition Specialist, Elvira Torres Benavente, elvira.torres.benavente@verisure.com

**About us:**


Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.


With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services, which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.


Our success depends on our people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry-leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit. www.verisure.com
company_description: Verisure, a fast growing company full of career opportunities. Verisure Belgium is part of a global organisation active in 14 countries.

title: Embedded Linux Developer
description:
**About** **Munters**


Munters is a global leader in energy-efficient solutions for industrial environments. With our innovative technologies, we create sustainable climate solutions that optimize performance, safety, and reliability in demanding industrial processes. Our products are used worldwide across a wide range of sectors, from manufacturing and data centers to agricultural applications. At Munters, we combine technical expertise with a strong focus on quality, innovation, and sustainability.

 **About** **the Role**


Are you ready to take on a key technical role in the development of advanced networking solutions for embedded systems? We are looking for an **Embedded Linux Software Developer** to join our team and work on OpenWrt-based systems.


In this role, you will play a critical part in ensuring high-quality delivery from our development team in Sweden, with a strong focus on embedded Linux development. You will collaborate closely with colleagues, contribute to technical implementation, and support test automation. You will also be a strong advocate for quality and security throughout the development lifecycle, driving the implementation of OpenWrt and other embedded Linux systems.

 **Key****Responsibilities**

* Develop and maintain software components for OpenWrt-based systems
* Customize and extend OpenWrt packages to meet product requirements
* Implement and integrate MQTT and Modbus protocols for IoT and industrial connectivity
* Collaborate with hardware and firmware teams to ensure seamless integration
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to embedded Linux systems
 **Requirements**

* 7+ years of experience with OpenWrt and embedded Linux development
* 7+ years in C/C++ and scripting languages (e.g., Shell, Python)
* Good understanding of network protocols (TCP/IP, DHCP, VPN, VLAN)
* Hands-on experience with MQTT and Modbus communication protocols
* Familiarity with Linux kernel, device drivers, and cross-compilation
* Experience with Git and modern DevOps tools
* Ability to work with REST or GraphQL APIs for integration
* Familiarity with security hardening for embedded systems
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English
**Nice** **to** **Have**

* Experience with containerization (Docker) and CI/CD pipelines
* Knowledge of wireless technologies (Wi-Fi, LTE)
**Soft Skills**

* Strong team player with a collaborative mindset — you value alignment and shared ways of working
* Comfortable working in a dynamic environment where processes are evolving
* High level of initiative and strong problem-solving ability — able to take ownership and move tasks forward independently as well as in a team
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills — essential for working in a distributed global development environment
* Experience in an international company with a Western/European work culture, where transparency, proactivity, and personal responsibility are expected
* Proactive and solution-oriented, with a drive to improve and streamline development practices
* Enjoys sharing knowledge and working closely with colleagues to achieve common goals
 **What** **We Offer**

* A key role in a growing, strategically important team
* An international and innovative work environment
* Competitive salary and benefits package
* Opportunities for personal and professional development
* Company culture that values precision, ownership, and collaboration
 **Ready** **to****shape** **the** **future** **of** **embedded** **Linux** **solutions** **at Munters?**  

Don’t wait—submit your application today, and you might soon be joining our team!


Do you have any questions or would you like more information?  

Feel free to contact **Yannick Voet, Talent Acquisition Specialist**:


yannick.voet@munters.com  

+32 (4)86 93 89 11
company_description: Munters is a global leader in climate control solutions for mission-critical processes.

title: Lead Developer – Team & Delivery
description:
Vi är WGR e-handel!
  
Vi är WGR e-handel, eller Wikinggruppen som vi är kända som i Hudiksvall. Vi är en etablerad och innovativ plattformsleverantör inom e-handel som kombinerar lång erfarenhet med en stark vilja att ständigt utvecklas.
  
Sedan starten 2005 har WGR varit en av Sveriges ledande e-handelsplattformar, med affärsidén att erbjuda prisvärda och flexibla lösningar som kan anpassas efter varje nätbutiks unika behov. Under 2025 hanterade vår plattform över 4 miljoner ordrar, med en total omsättning på 4 miljarder kronor genom våra kunders e-handel.
  
Hos oss präglas vardagen av framåtanda, engagemang och samarbete. Vi erbjuder en flexibel arbetsmiljö där du får verklig möjlighet att påverka, ta ansvar och vara med och forma vår fortsatta resa. Självklart erbjuder vi även konkurrenskraftiga villkor, kollektivavtal och attraktiva förmåner. Till vårt kontor i Hudiksvall söker vi nu en Lead Developer - Team & delivery
  
Din framtida roll
  
Är du en erfaren utvecklare som vill ta nästa steg i karriären och komma närmare affären? Trivs du i en roll där du får kombinera teknisk kompetens med ansvar, kommunikation och teamsamarbete? Då kan detta vara rollen för dig!
  
Vi söker nu en driven och proaktiv utvecklare som vill ta ett större helhetsgrepp både externt och internt. Du arbetar med våra kundprojekt och bidrar till både teknisk kvalitet och affärsnytta, samtidigt som du tar en teamledande roll i vardagen. Du jobbar nära både kunder och team, parallellt med att du själv kodar och plockar tickets från kön, med fokus på att säkerställa att våra leveranser håller hög kvalitet och skapar verkligt värde.
  
Du blir en viktig del i genomförandet av våra kunduppdrag och bidrar aktivt till att projekt drivs framåt på ett strukturerat och effektivt sätt. Det innebär att du samarbetar tätt med kollegor, deltar i dialoger med kund, fångar behov och omsätter dem till tekniska lösningar. Du förväntas ta ansvar, vara kommunikativ och bidra till ett gott samarbetsklimat i teamet.
  
Rollen ger möjlighet att successivt ta ett större ansvar – exempelvis i form av ökat tekniskt ledarskap, mentorskap, personalansvar eller ett tydligare affärsfokus – beroende på intresse och ambition. Du är med och påverkar hur vi arbetar, hur vi utvecklar våra leveranser och hur vi bygger långsiktiga kundrelationer.
  
Vem söker vi?
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Är en erfaren utvecklare och trygg i din tekniska kompetens
  
  

Vill ta nästa steg i karriären och komma närmare kund och affär
  
  

Är driven, proaktiv och kommunikativ
  
  

Trivs med att arbeta i och tillsammans med team, och gärna har erfarenhet av teamarbete eller mentorskap
  
  

Har ett ansvarstagande mindset och ser helheten i projekt och leverans
  
  

Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift
  
  

Har du dessutom erfarenhet av konsultrollen eller att arbeta kundnära ser vi det som meriterande.
  
Hos oss
  
Hos oss blir du en del av ett engagerat och kompetent team i en dynamisk miljö där du får möjlighet att påverka – både tekniskt och affärsmässigt. Vi erbjuder goda utvecklingsmöjligheter, frihet under ansvar och en kultur där samarbete, kvalitet och trivsel står i fokus.
  
Vill du växa, ta mer ansvar och göra skillnad – både i teamet och hos kund? Då ser vi fram emot din ansökan.
  
**Omfattning:** 100 % Start: Enligt ök Placering: Hudiksvall (på plats)
  
Ansökan och kontakt
  
Du söker tjänsten genom att bifoga CV alternativt en länk till din LinkedIn-profil. I denna process tillämpar vi löpande urval och intervjuer, vänta därför inte med din ansökan. Vid frågor om rollen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta: CEO Albin Jansson på albin.jansson@wikinggruppen.se.
  
Vi har redan gjort våra val av annonskanaler. Vi undanber oss därför samtal från rekryteringsföretag och annonsförsäljare.

title: Business Developer Prototal
description:
Business Developer – Prototal | Jönköping / eller västkusten (Sverige) / Hybrid
  
Vi söker dig som vill vara med och driva tillväxt i framkant av svensk industriell produktion. Som Business Developer på Prototal får du en nyckelroll i att utveckla vår affär inom serieproduktion – med fokus på 3D-print och formsprutning.
  
  

Om oss
  
Prototal är Europas största leverantör av industriell 3D-print, formsprutning och vakuumgjutning. Som leverantör, rör vi oss helt sömlöst från prototyptillverkning till fullskalig produktion. Vi följer kundernas produkts livscykel från början till slut, för att sedan börja om från början med nästa generation av din produkt. Vårt mål är att vara den mest flexibla och kompetenta partnern inom tillverkning av polymera produkter.
  
  

**Ditt uppdrag:**  

Du ansvarar för att etablera nya kundrelationer och utveckla befintliga tillväxtkunder inom svensk industri. Rollen innebär ett högt kundfokus där du genom proaktivt arbete och nära samarbete guidar kunder rätt inom vårt erbjudande – från tidig idé till serieproduktion.
  
**Du har helhetsansvar för försäljningsprocessen:** från identifiering av behov och nätverkande till offertarbete, värdebaserad prissättning och uppföljning. Rollen är självständig, men du jobbar tätt med interna team inom projektledning, teknik och försäljning.
  
  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**  

Identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter inom 3D-print och formsprutning
  
Bygga starka nätverk och långsiktiga kundrelationer
  
Genomföra kundbesök 3–4 dagar per vecka
  
Utveckla kommersiella strategier per kund tillsammans med säljledning
  
Agera rådgivande partner kring teknikval och tillverkningsstrategi
  
Föreslå prissättning enligt "value based pricing"
  
Initiera aktiviteter som Tech Days, mässor, kundevents m.m.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som har:**  

Flerårig erfarenhet av nykundsbearbetning och affärsutveckling
  
Förmåga att skapa förtroende och bygga starka relationer
  
Teknisk förståelse och intresse för produktion och innovation
  
Förhandlingsvana och erfarenhet av värdebaserad försäljning
  
God kommunikationsförmåga på både svenska och engelska
  
Ett strukturerat arbetssätt och vana att jobba självständigt
  
  

**Vi erbjuder:**  

En spännande roll i ett tillväxtbolag med stark position i Norden
  
Möjlighet att påverka kunders produktionsval och strategier
  
Flexibilitet – utgångspunkt i Jönköping, men möjlighet till hemarbete
  
Tjänstebil, mobil och möjlighet till stor påverkan på din roll
  
  

Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i gränslandet mellan teknik, innovation och affär – i en framtidsbransch där du gör verklig skillnad.
  
  

Tjänsten är på heltid.
  
Vi intervjuar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan snarast!
  
Låter det intressant? Hör av dig direkt eller ansök till Thomas Bengtsson, thomas.bengtsson@prototal.se

title: Software Engineer – Developer Tools
description:
**Job Description**  

We are looking for a talented and driven Software Engineer to join our Developer Tools Team. As a member of the Platform Application area, you will play a crucial role in our company’s transformation by accelerating the developer journey from start to production-ready services. Some of your responsibilities will include:

* Develop, maintain, and improve our tools and services used in the development process, focusing on GitHub. integrated development environments (IDEs), automated build tools, testing frameworks, and deployment tools.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of the developer experience by identifying pain points, streamlining processes, and implementing innovative solutions.
* Use CI/CD pipelines to automate processes and tools like GitHub CI/CD, GitHub Actions
* Maintaining and develop our own internal developed solutions.
* Ensure that development and testing environments are stable, reliable and accurately reflect the production environment.
* Manage and provision infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform
* Optimize the development process by reducing build times, improving automated testing and ensuring deployments are fast and reliable.
* Diagnose and fix issues arising in the development process.
* Collaborate closely with other software engineers, architects, and stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver high-quality solutions.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Proficiency in software development, preferably in Typescript, JavaScript or .NET
* Experience with TDD (Test Driven Development)
* Experience with GitHub Actions
* Experience with GitHub Copilot
* Strong foundation in API-First Development
* Proficiency in CLIs and Linux
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and analytically.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with team members and stakeholders.


It's good if you have familiarity with CI/CD tools

 **Additional Information** ***Please note***: As our culture and teamwork are very important to us, four days (80%) per week of in-office presence in our office are required.


This is a full-time position with placement in **Stockholm**.

 **WHO WE ARE:**  

Shaping the future of fashion with people, data, and tech. The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.

 **WHAT WE OFFER!**  

You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, flexible work life, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits etc. There are endless opportunities to experiment and grow in any direction that you want, and when you grow, we grow. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: utvecklare - Backend (Java/.NET C#) eller Frontend (Angular/React)
description:
**Befattning:**  

utvecklare - Backend (Java/.NET C#) eller Frontend (Angular/React)
  
  

**Jobbsammanfattning:**  

Som utvecklar på RedRiver får du möjlighet att arbeta med spännande och utmanande projekt för våra kunder. Vi är öppna för både front-end och back-end utvecklare som är skickliga inom sina respektive områden.Som en medlem av vårt team kommer du att samarbeta med andra skickliga utvecklarlare och bidra till ett framgångsrikt genomförande av kundprojekt.
  
  

**Huvudansvar:**  

Samarbeta med kunder och interna team för att samla in projektkrav och föreslå optimala tekniska lösningar.
  
**För frontendutvecklare:** Skapa responsiva och engagerande användargränssnitt genom frontendutveckling med Angular eller React.
  
**För backend-utvecklare:** Designa och utveckla robusta backend-system med Java eller .NET C# för att möta klienternas behov av prestanda, säkerhet och skalbarhet.
  
Implementera bästa praxis för kodkvalitet, testning och dokumentation för att säkerställa högkvalitativa leveranser.
  
Håll dig uppdaterad med branschtrender och framsteg för att kontinuerligt förbättra din kompetens och bidra till företagets tillväxt.
  
Delta aktivt i SCRUM-möten och ge värdefulla insikter för att driva projektframt.
  
  

**Kvalifikationer och färdigheter:**  

Kandidatexamen i datavetenskap, mjukvaruteknik eller ett relaterat område som visar dina kunskaper inom mjukvaruutveckling.
  
**För frontendutvecklare:** Beprövad erfarenhet av frontendutveckling med Angular eller React.
  
**För backend-utvecklare:** Beprövad erfarenhet av backend-utveckling med Java eller .NET C#.
  
Fördjupad förståelse för mjukvaruutvecklingsprinciper, designmönster och bästa praxis.
  
Kännedom om SCRUM eller liknande agila utvecklingsmetoder.
  
Stark problemlösningsförmåga och ett detaljorienterat förhållningssätt till utvecklingsuppgifter.
  
Effektiv kommunikationsförmåga och förmåga att samarbeta i ett team.
  
Flytande både i tal och skrift i engelska eller svenska.
  
  

**Företaget:**  

RedRiver Consulting and Software AB, är ett ledande konsult- och produktföretag specialiserat på system- och webbutveckling. Med en meritlista av att leverera skräddarsydda IT-lösningar och ge löpande support till några av Sveriges största företag och offentliga myndigheter, är vi stolta över vårt engagemang för spetskompetens och innovation. Vår expertis ligger i Angular 2-11 och React för frontend-utveckling och .NET Core och C# för backend-lösningar.
  
**vår hem sida:** http://redcode.se/

title: Backend-/Fullstackutvecklare
description:
**Backend-/Fullstackutvecklare C# .NET till New Wave Group (B2B e-handel)**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------


Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens digitala upplevelse för New Wave Group, våra dotterbolag och kunder världen över?  

Vi växer och söker nu en backend-/fullstackutvecklare inom C# .NET till vårt team som jobbar med e-handelsintegrationer i hela koncernen.

### **Om New Wave Group**


New Wave Group är en global tillväxtkoncern som skapar, förvärvar och utvecklar varumärken och produkter inom både profil- och detaljhandelsmarknaden. Vi är en decentraliserad organisation med runt 70 bolag världen över – där entreprenörsanda kombineras med styrkan i en större koncern.


Hos oss jobbar du i en visionsstyrd och entreprenörsdriven miljö med smarta och drivna kollegor som brinner för att skapa de bästa systemen för våra dotterbolag och våra kunder.

### **Om rollen**


Du blir en del av ett utvecklingsteam på cirka 20 personer som har centralt ansvar för våra bolags gemensamma B2B e-handelsplattform samt integrationer mot slutkundsplattformar och marknadsplatser.


Den här tjänsten är primärt en backendroll, men om du kallar dig fullstack, har erfarenhet av frontend och gillar att arbeta med React JS, ser vi det som ett stort plus.


Vi söker nu specifikt en utvecklare som kommer att arbeta med våra förädlingsflöden.  

Vi ser ett ökande behov av att vidareutveckla våra förädlingsverktyg, inklusive kopplingar till produktionssystem och logistik, för att hantera mer avancerade flöden och leverera färdiga förädlade produkter från skärm till slutprodukt (ex. tryck och brodyr).

### **Vad du kommer göra**

* Utveckla backendlösningar med C# .NET och bidra i fullstackprojekt med React JS
* Bygga och underhålla API:er, GraphQL, REST API:er och web services
* Vidareutveckla tjänster för förädling och produktionsflöden, inklusive integrationer med PIM, ERP och logistiksystem
* Arbeta med databaser och sökfunktioner, inklusive Microsoft SQL och ElasticSearch
* Hantera eventdrivna flöden med Azure-teknologi
* Införliva generativ AI i våra flöden och system för att förbättra processer och användarupplevelse
* Delta i arkitektur- och teknikval samt säkerställa stabilitet, prestanda och skalbarhet

### **Du har**


Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet inom flera av följande områden, men du behöver inte kunna allt:

* C#/.NET och erfarenhet av frontendutveckling med React JS
* Erfarenhet av API:er, web services och databashantering (Microsoft SQL, ElasticSearch)
* Azure-teknologier, exempelvis Functions, Service Bus och Storage Accounts
* Erfarenhet av B2B e-handel och integrationer mot PIM, ERP eller logistiksystem

title: Lead Developer
description:
Your code ships. Your team respects you. You’re not scrolling job ads because you’re desperate, you’re scrolling because you’re curious.

### **The Role**


Trine’s technology has been built and run by its founder and CTO since day one. We’re now handing over responsibility for the platform to a new technical lead.  

  

You’ll step in as lead developer, inheriting a mature but evolving platform and taking responsibility for Trine’s technology going forward. We’re recruiting two engineers as part of this transition. You’ll be the technical lead, helping shape how the team and the platform evolve from here. There’s no tech manager above you; you report directly to the CEO.

**What you’ll own**
-------------------

* The full platform: backend, frontend, infrastructure, and data pipelines
* Technical architecture and tooling decisions – you choose how things are built
* Team decisions: hire locally in Gothenburg or expand the current Vietnamese dev team
* AI tooling strategy across the company (everyone already uses AI daily)

**Tech stack**
--------------

**Backend**


C# / .NET

**Frontend**


Aurelia (TypeScript, HTML, SCSS)

**Infrastructure**


Azure

**Data & Analytics**


Google BigQuery, Mixpanel

### **What makes it interesting**


From the outgoing developer:

**Full autonomy.**


You decide how to solve things, how and where to work. No layers of approval, no product managers writing tickets for you.  

  

**AI-native workflows.**


Support staff query BigQuery through Claude Code to investigate cases. Non-developers submit pull requests for bug fixes. You’d shape how all of this evolves.  

  

**Genuine complexity.**


Payment flows across multiple currencies and markets, repayment tracking across borrowers, regulatory compliance, investor-facing dashboards. Decisions matter here.  

  

**Real feedback loops.**


We run A/B tests and measure what ships. Recent feature launches have driven measurable increases in investments. You will see the direct impact of your work.

### **What We’re Looking For**

* Strong full-stack experience – you’re comfortable across backend, frontend, and infrastructure
* Experience with C# / .NET (or willingness to work in it)
* Comfort working independently and making architectural decisions without a team to lean on
* Interest in AI tooling and how it changes development workflows
* A pragmatic mindset: you care about shipping things that work, not chasing the newest framework


Nice to have: experience in fintech, payment systems, or regulated industries.

### **The Lifestyle**

* Office in central Gothenburg but flexible on where we work
* Twice-a-year full-company gatherings around the world
* A small, flat team where your input shapes the company – not just the code
company_addresses:
8695 W. Washington Blvd. Suite 206
Culver City, CA 90232
company_description: TRINE is a boutique experience agency that specializes in curating unique trips and events in the worlds of entertainment, arts and sports.

title: Software Engineer – Developer Tools
description:
**Job Description**

 We are looking for a talented and driven Software Engineer to join our Developer Tools Team. As a member of the Platform Application area, you will play a crucial role in our company’s transformation by accelerating the developer journey from start to production-ready services. Some of your responsibilities will include:
   

  




* Develop, maintain, and improve our tools and services used in the development process, focusing on GitHub. integrated development environments (IDEs), automated build tools, testing frameworks, and deployment tools.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of the developer experience by identifying pain points, streamlining processes, and implementing innovative solutions.
* Use CI/CD pipelines to automate processes and tools like GitHub CI/CD, GitHub Actions
* Maintaining and develop our own internal developed solutions.
* Ensure that development and testing environments are stable, reliable and accurately reflect the production environment.
* Manage and provision infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform
* Optimize the development process by reducing build times, improving automated testing and ensuring deployments are fast and reliable.
* Diagnose and fix issues arising in the development process.
* Collaborate closely with other software engineers, architects, and stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver high-quality solutions.


**Qualifications**
* Proficiency in software development, preferably in Typescript, JavaScript or .NET
* Experience with TDD (Test Driven Development)
* Experience with GitHub Actions
* Experience with GitHub Copilot
* Strong foundation in API-First Development
* Proficiency in CLIs and Linux
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and analytically.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with team members and stakeholders.



 It's good if you have familiarity with CI/CD tools
   

  

  

  




**Additional Information**

***Please note***
 : As our culture and teamwork are very important to us, four days (80%) per week of in-office presence in our office are required.
   

  





 This is a full-time position with placement in
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   

  





  

  





**WHO WE ARE:**
  

 Shaping the future of fashion with people, data, and tech. The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  





  

  





**WHAT WE OFFER!** 
  

  

 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, flexible work life, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits etc. There are endless opportunities to experiment and grow in any direction that you want, and when you grow, we grow. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.

title: Backend Software Engineer
description:
We at Umain are looking for
 **Senior Backend Engineers** 
 with a genuine enthusiasm for building robust solutions that power digital experiences — engineers ready to bring passion, creativity, and dedication with them.
   

  

 The role is broad but centered on backend technologies, offering the opportunity to work on a variety of projects for both Swedish and international companies.
   

  

 We work with many different tech stacks, but most of our projects are written in
 **Kotlin, Go, or TypeScript** 
 . Our approach is to use the tools best suited for each project, ensuring our teams are not locked into a single stack.
   

  

**We Have a Proven Track Record**
* 400M+ total app downloads
* 50M+ monthly active users
* Backends handling tens of thousands of requests per second
* Globally recognized, multi-market applications


 If working at scale with technology that truly makes an impact excites you, we believe you'll be a great fit at Umain.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on a range of diverse and unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a Senior Backend Developer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Building high-performance backend systems using modern languages like Go, NodeJS, Python, and Kotlin to power innovative experiences
* Using modern backend frameworks such as Fiber, Ktor, Express and FastAPI to create robust solutions.
* Designing and implementing cloud-native solutions across AWS, GCP and Azure, using Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) for resource management
* Building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines with containerized deployments and scaling strategies
* Developing robust data models and database architectures to support application requirements
* Participating in projects & teams alongside some of the largest and most forward-thinking brands on the planet


**Who You Are**
* You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.


 Why Umain?
   

  

**Career Framework**
 We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
   

  

**Work-Life Balance**
 At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
   

  

**Innovations And Learning**
 Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
   

  

**Skills Over Degrees**
 We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.
   

  

**Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?**
 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

***Background check***
*Umain conducts a background check for final candidates in accordance with our internal People Procedure (UIS‑007). The check is carried out only with your consent and is ordered by our CISO through our approved screening partner. The scope of the check depends on the role level. This step is performed late in the recruitment process and is used solely to support a secure and fact‑based hiring decision.*
 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Senior Frontend Developer (Angular)
description:
Company Overview: Join a mission-driven team dedicated to making a real difference in society. We develop digital solutions for the healthcare and social care sectors, simplifying and securing vital services for the public. With over 100 employees across the Nordics, we combine the agility of a close-knit team with the stability of a growing an international company. We value "freedom under responsibility," open collaboration, and continuous professional growth. 🦷💻🚀
   

  

 We are currently looking for a Senior Frontend Developer to join our team. We are in the midst of a major rewrite of our systems and need a lead-level developer to help shape the future of our digital dental care products.
   

  

 About the Role: In this senior position, you will play a pivotal role in our team. You will have significant autonomy to influence how we design solutions that meet high standards for performance, accessibility, security, and regulatory compliance.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Technical Leadership: Take a lead role in frontend development, including making key architectural and design decisions.
* System Rewrite: Drive the ongoing rewrite and further development of our Angular-based applications.
* Quality Assurance: Ensure high code quality through rigorous code reviews, automated testing, and the application of best development practices.
* Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with backend developers, UX/UI designers, and business stakeholders to ensure a cohesive product.
* Continuous Improvement: Contribute to the evolution of our workflows, technology stack, and the collective expertise of the team.
* Scalability & Maintenance: Build robust solutions designed for long-term sustainability and ease of maintenance.


 Required Skills and Experience:
   

  

* Extensive Angular Experience: Several years of professional frontend development with deep proficiency in Angular.
* Full-stack Perspective: Some experience with backend development, databases, and API design to understand the end-to-end system flow.
* Technical Ownership: Proven ability to take responsibility for technical decisions and lead a project from a frontend perspective.
* UX/UI Mindset: A strong eye for design and user experience is highly meritorious.
* Language Proficiency: Fluent English (written and verbal).
* Collaborative Spirit: You work structured and independently but thrive in a team culture characterized by knowledge sharing and professional support.


 What We Offer: 🌍🤝🏠
   

  

* Meaningful Work: The chance to build products that provide real societal value.
* Remote position: with opportunity to visit the team in Sweden.
* Professional Growth: Opportunities to work with various products across our Nordic portfolio and develop your leadership skills.
* Supportive Culture: A team environment where quality, cooperation, and "freedom under responsibility" are at the core.


 If you are ready to take a leading role in shaping the future of dental care technology, we would love to see your application!
   

  

 Are you interested in developing and helping the team thrive don't hesitate to apply!

title: Mobile Developer
description:
**Job Description**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO​**




 As a Mobile Developer, you'll ensure seamless and engaging experiences across smartphones, PCs, and other devices. Experience with multiple device types, payments, and iOS is highly valued. While Kotlin is the main language, JavaScript and TypeScript are also useful. Your work will cover POS sales, payments, back-office applications, mobile payments, self-checkout stations, and standout in-store payment solutions.
   

  





**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**




 At Store Lens, we work closely with Portfolio Brands and H&M Brand to design and provide technical solutions. We contribute to product development at every stage, from setting requirements to rollout and testing. From day one, we focus on improving by listening, building, and refining as we go. Even as we define requirements, we are already thinking ahead, using early designs, first developments, and new learnings to continuously make the product better.
   

  





 We are curious, active listeners and hands-on doers.
   

  





 Beyond your work with Store Lens, you will also be part of our Engineering community, where you will have access to a network of experts, resources, and opportunities to grow.
   

  





**WHO YOU ARE​**




 We are looking for people with…​
   

  




* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience), and at least 5-8 years of experience as a Software Engineer with mobile and front end focus.
* Proficiency in Android development in Kotlin.
* Proficiency in build secure applications with Microsoft Login and Single Sign-On capabilities.
* Experience in mobile development for multiple devices.
* Experience Integrate hardware and communicate effectively with Android applications.
* Experience to work with SDKs from external vendors.
* Experience in Consume web services (e.g., REST APIs).
* Collaborate with UX/UI designers and utilize Figma for design implementation.
* Experience of CI/ CD pipelines using Azure DevOps / GitHub Actions.
* Knowledge and apply basic Mobile Device Management (MDM) principles (e.g., Airwatch).
* Experience in POS, Payment and Checkout area is a plus.
* IOS development, experience is a plus.
* Apply basic web development skills is a plus.



*And people who have* 
 :
   

  




* Continuous learning mindset to stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in backend testing.
* Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and communicate technical concepts clearly.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Experience conducting code reviews, identifying areas of improvement, and provide constructive feedback to maintain code quality and consistency.
* Familiarity in backend testing with a focus on ensuring the reliability and performance of backend systems.
* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development methodologies.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Additional Information**

**WHO WE ARE** 
 ​
   

  





 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.​
   

  





 ​We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. ​
   

  





**​WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 
 ​
   

  





 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  





 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  





**JOIN US​** 
  

  





 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.​
   

  





 ​Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.​
   

  





 ​
 *\*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.​*

title: TEAM LEAD & BACKEND SOFTWARE DEVELOPER
description:
THE WOW
   


 As a Team Lead at Betsson Group, you will lead a team of talented people and take overall responsibility for team performance. As the Team Lead, you will take an active role in driving the delivery of your team and promoting a healthy team spirit and culture. You will also participate as a developer in designing and developing next generation Engagement products for the iGaming industry.  
 


  

 ABOUT THE JOB
   



 As part of this team, you will use cutting edge technology to develop highly scalable and resilient application. As a team lead you will also enable us to get these applications into the hands of our users safely, quickly, and sustainably. In Engagement Area, We develop products to boost customer engagement. Our goal is to provide the best customer experience on the market, and we do that through personalized communication, interesting and fun promotions, and gamification. We work closely with our commercial users to ensure we deliver the best CRM tools and products. All designed and developed by us and delivered safely, quickly and sustainably using best-if-bread technologies and processes. 
 



  

 As a Team Lead and Backend Developer, your day to day will look like
   

  
* People management, mentoring and coaching developers, taking part in recruiting and onboarding, performance reviews, personal development planning and 1-to-1’s.
  
* Close collaboration with Product Managers, Architects, and Stakeholders to understand and implement business requirements.
  
* Software development according to modern best practices and principles.
  
* Taking part in the decision-making process for design or improvement of application architecture, solution development, architecture, and code review
  


  

 WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
   

  
* Experience in software development for more than 5 years
  
* Experience of managing teams of software engineers
  
* Strong leadership and communication skills
  
* Agile mindset, business goals orientation
  
* Excellent knowledge and experience in C#, .NET Framework, and .NET Core
  


  

 WHAT DOES OUR TECH STACK LOOK LIKE?
   


 At Betsson, we pride ourselves on adaptability and keeping up with the latest technologies. Our current tech stack looks like this
 


  

  
* C#, .NET Framework, .NET Core,
  
* AWS, Kubernetes, Docker
  
* PostgreSQL, MSSQL, Redis, Couchbase
  
* Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ
  
* Prometheus, Loki, Grafana
  
* GitHub
  


  

 WHAT WE OFFER
   


 Life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1700 strong, spread across 7 offices with 900 based out of our Malta HQ alone! We recognize it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and adrenaline junkie, always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
 


  


 We offer numerous challenges where your skills will be put to good use! We encourage innovation, independence and celebrate success where you will be part of multi-cultural and diverse company, with people from all over the world.
 


  

 CHALLENGE ACCEPTED?
   


 If you are interested to learn more, please apply with your CV.
 


  


 Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our employees are talking about
 


  


 By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**Fullstack Developer – Traton Financial Services IT**
 Traton Financial Services IT is looking for a talented Fullstack Developer to join our dynamic team in Stockholm, Södertälje. We specialize in innovative cloud-based solutions, microservices and integrations. We are now expanding our team to meet the increasing demand of our services.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 As a Fullstack Developer, you will be pivotal in developing and maintaining cloud applications, working collaboratively with business and developers. In addition to creating customized applications to meet mission-critical business needs within Traton Financial Services, your responsibilities also include troubleshooting, debugging, and optimizing applications. As a Fullstack Developer we believe is important to stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in development, which we encourage.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are a team player but also love to work independently and take responsibility for your solutions. You like to bring your ideas to improve the design and features of things you are working with. We believe that you have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and pay attention to detail. It is important that you have strong communication skills to collaborate with other team members, designers, testers and business stakeholders.
   

  

**Your Profile**
 You have several years of experience as a fullstack developer or similar role, including:
   

  

  

* University degree in computer science / IT, or similar proven education.
* .NET, C#
* Angular
* Integration tests and Unit tests
* Design patterns and architecture patterns
* SQL and NoSQL databases (for example PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB)
* AWS and/or Azure components & services
* Kubernetes / AWS EKS, Argo CD
* Docker, GitLab and/or GitHub


 You are fluent in English and live Stockholm/Södertälje area or willing to relocate.
   

  

 Other merited skills are:
   

  

  

* ReactJS
* DevOps experience
* Swedish language
* Monitoring tools(for example Datadog, Graphana, OpenTelemetry


 or similar)
   

  

  

* Experience of MCP implementations / integrations
* Experience of the financial services domain


**TRATON Financial Services Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TFS supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible working hours, and the opportunity to lease a company car. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and residents in Stockholm have direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job Express buses, which you as an employee at TRATON Financial Services also have access to.
   

  

**Application**
*We look forward to receiving your application, consisting of your CV and kindly ask you not to share a cover letter to ensure an efficient and unbiased recruitment process for all parties.*
 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-03-02. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check is required for this role. If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Jonas Frank, Solution Development Manager,
   

  

 jonas.frank@tratonfs.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Javascript Developer
description:
**Ready to embark on our mission to deliver world-class apps and shape the future of mobile experiences?** 
 Look no further! NoA Ignite, a trailblazing force in web and mobile app development, is on the hunt for a talented React Native Developer to join our growing team!
 



 NoA Ignite is a leading design and technology company that seamlessly blends business insight with engineering craftsmanship to create innovative digital solutions. With a team of over 400 digital strategists, designers, technologists, and data experts across offices in the Nordics and Poland, we are dedicated to delivering meaningful and measurable results for our clients.
 



 Today, we're thrilled to offer a chance for you to be a pivotal part of our team as our new React Native Developer!
 



  





**The role** 




 As a React Native Developer at NoA Ignite, you'll collaborate with clients and coach fellow team members to create, maintain, and improve top-quality products. You and your team will work together to conduct product discovery, technical research, and workshops, as well as develop, test, and maintain code. You will get to know your clients and communicate with them throughout each project. In doing so, your team will create state-of-the-art apps and services, fitting your clients' needs.
 



  





**What we are looking for** 




 We prioritize finding individuals who share our values and are eager to learn and grow with us. This approach enables us to assemble a team that is not only talented and capable but also passionate and committed to our shared objectives. You love what you do and take pride in writing clean and testable code, experimenting with new technologies, and always trying to improve. You look forward to working with your talented colleagues to build and maintain our clients' products and to learn from their experiences. You possess excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, enabling you to convey ideas effectively and understand the perspectives of others. We also believe that you have a solid understanding of mobile app development processes and lifecycles.
 



  





**Ideally, you have:** 



* Expertise in React Native and Typescript
* Knowledge of iOS and Android platform conventions, differences, and APIs
* Knowledge in Objective C/Swift or Kotlin/Java native development
* Knowledge of Appstore Connect or Google Play console lifecycle
* Experience building and publishing NPM packages
* Experience with automated testing suites, like Jest and Detox
* Experience with setting up CI/CD pipelines for mobile applications
* Experience working with fastlane
* Experience working in a monorepo structure and building cross-platform apps using React Native Web



  





**Equal Opportunity** 




 NoA Ignite is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, or family situation. We value diversity, and we expect the same from you.
 



  





**Recruitment Process** 




 Ready to script a new chapter in your career with NoA Ignite? Reach out! We’re reviewing applications continuously. Forget the formal cover letter – just share your LinkedIn profile link, and let's embark on this journey together!

title: ETL Developer
description:
**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Analyse business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
* Re-engineer legacy ETL processes for cloud-native execution.
* Analyse current ODI mappings, packages, and procedures for ETL workflows.
* Build and optimize data integration pipelines using Informatica IDMC (Cloud Data Integration, Data Quality, Governance).
* Migrate and modernize ODI-based ETL processes into IDMC cloud solutions.
* Collaborate with data architects, analysts, and business stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver scalable solutions.
* Implement data quality, lineage, and governance frameworks across ODI and IDMC environments.
* Troubleshoot, monitor, and enhance performance of ETL jobs and workflows.
* Document technical designs, maintain version control, and support production deployments.
* Integrate IDMC with cloud platforms like Azure, and Snowflake and other data warehouses.
* Automate data flows, task scheduling, and workflows within the platform.
* Implement data cataloguing and metadata management for improved data discovery
* Monitor and optimize data pipelines for scalability, efficiency, and cost-effectiveness.
* Troubleshoot performance bottlenecks and implement tuning strategies.
* Ensure compliance with organizational data governance and security policies.
* Conduct data reconciliation between Teradata and Snowflake post-migration.
* Implement validation frameworks to ensure consistency and accuracy.
* Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies.
* Document migration processes, best practices, and technical solutions.



**Technical Skills:** 



* Strong expertise in Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) — mappings, packages, procedures, and performance tuning.
* Knowledge of Informatica IDMC (Cloud Data Integration, Data Quality, Governance).
* Proficiency in SQL, PL/SQL, and RDBMS (Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata, Snowflake, etc.).
* Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, ETL design patterns, and BI integration.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and hybrid architectures.
* Strong experience in ETL/ELT concepts, data modelling, and design and building data pipelines and transformation logic.
* Experience with metadata ingestion, data lineage, and classification.
* Knowledge of DevOps and CI/CD practices for data workflows and version control (Git, Jenkins).
* Basic scripting in Python, Shell, or PowerShell for automation tasks.
* Experience in different batch processing and data loading/transformation strategies.
* Understanding of data profiling, cleansing, and metadata management.
* Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
* Experience in banking and financial services will be preferred.

title: Software Test Engineer - V.I.E Contract (M/F)
description:
ALTEN is a leader in Engineering and Enterprise IT Services with 57,000 employees, 88% of whom are engineers. With operations in 30 countries, the Group supports its customers' development strategies in the areas of innovation, R&D and technological information systems.
 



  









 ALTEN is a major player in the recruitment of engineers at the international level.
 



 Why choose ALTEN?
 



  








* The opportunity to take part in the greatest technological challenges;
* Close support in a collaborative work environment;
* A real career gas pedal in France and internationally











  





***Your new role***








  








* As a Software Tester, you are responsible for the design, development and validation of test environments & tools (test bench, recording tools, simulated I/O …)
* For this you specify and design test plans and cases for the highly complex systems under laboratory conditions on the HiL/SiL and on test carriers
* In addition to building test automatic seals via C, Python, Perl and CAPL, you are responsible for recording and evaluating Traces via CANoe and CANalyzer
* Finally, you will analyze and document the results of the tests







  





***Who are we looking for?***




  








* **You fulfill the general V.I.E program requirements**
* You hold a Bachelor or a Master degree in electrical engineering, computer science or a comparable apprenticeship with relevant professional experience
* You are experienced in dealing with test equipment such as HiL (dSpace), CANoe and CANalyzer and in the application of simulation software (Matlab/Simulink, IPG Carmaker etc.)
* Ideally, you have already been able to gain knowledge of communication protocols of the automotive environment (e.g. CAN, LIN, Ethernet)
* Experience in C, C + +, Python, Perl and CAPL is also desirable
* Very good language skills in English











  





***What are the advantages of the V.I.E***




  




* Getting professional experience abroad with the back-up and support of Business France and ALTEN
* Finding the ideal environment for letting your atypical profile fully express itself
* Receiving a tax-free allowances for the assignment you carry out
* Discovering a new city and new cultures
* Boost your career on the international stage! (if you doubt this, take a look at this testimonial https://www.alten-germany.de/en/2021/02/19/working-at-alten-gmbh-employee-portrait-engineering-consultant/

title: Sr Software Engineer – Build the Future of Health with Apotea | Stockholm
description:
**Senior Software Engineer – Build the Future of Health with Apotea 🚀**
 At
 **Apotea** 
 , Sweden’s leading online pharmacy, we’re reshaping how healthcare reaches people — smarter, faster, and more sustainably. Every system we optimize and every line of code we write brings us closer to a society where better health is accessible for everyone.
   

  

 Now, we’re looking for a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 to take a leading role in developing and scaling the systems that power our entire operation — from seamless customer experiences to world-class logistics.
   

  

 This isn’t a role for someone who wants “just another dev job.” This is your chance to be part of a purpose-driven tech journey where your impact goes far beyond code.
   

  

**💡 Why this role matters**
 At Apotea, technology isn’t a support function — it’s our competitive edge. You’ll be joining the
 **core of Apoteas tech team** 
 , where uptime, performance, and innovation meet real-world impact. You’ll help us design and evolve the complex systems that keep millions of deliveries moving, pharmacies stocked, and customers cared for every single day.
   

  

 As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll lead by doing — combining deep technical skill with curiosity, initiative, and collaboration.
   

  

**👩‍💻 What You’ll Do**
**Design, build, and evolve** 
 high-performance systems that keep Apotea running at scale.
   

  

**Lead technical direction** 
 within projects and mentor other developers through complex problem-solving.
   

  

**Drive innovation** 
 through automation, modernization, and new integrations — from logistics partners to sister companies.
   

  

**Collaborate across teams** 
 to bridge business needs and technical execution.
   

  

**Strengthen reliability and scalability** 
 across our .NET ecosystem — keeping millions of transactions flowing seamlessly.
   

  

**Shape the future** 
 of Apotea’s tech landscape — your ideas will influence how we grow.
   

  

**🧠 Who You Are**
 You’re an experienced engineer who loves tackling complexity and turning it into clarity. You thrive in fast-paced environments where real impact is visible every day. You’re both hands-on and strategic — equally comfortable writing elegant .NET code as you are leading architectural discussions.
   

  

**You’ll Fit Right In If You**
* Write clean, maintainable C#/.NET code with a focus on performance and scalability.
* Understand system architecture, distributed systems, and data flow in complex environments.
* Have strong problem-solving and debugging skills — you stay calm under pressure and focused on solutions.
* Enjoy mentoring, sharing knowledge, and lifting others around you.
* Communicate effectively across technical and non-technical teams.


**🌟 Extra kudos if you bring**
 Experience in
 **logistics, e-commerce, or ERP/WMS systems** 
 .
   

  

 Familiarity with
 **cloud infrastructure** 
 ,
 **DevOps** 
 , or automation tools.
   

  

 A background in
 **integration projects** 
 or migration work.
   

  

 Swedish language skills — a plus, not a must.
   

  

**What Apotea Offers You**
 ✨ A role where your code impacts millions of people.
   

  

 ✨ The chance to work in Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company.
   

  

 ✨ An agile, flat organization where ideas matter more than titles.
   

  

 ✨ Growth opportunities: training, mentorship, and conferences.
   

  

 ✨ A collaborative, transparent culture where your voice counts.
   

  

 ✨ A meaningful mission – making healthcare more accessible while caring for the planet.
   

  

**❤️ About Apotea**
 Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and over 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Årsta, Lidingö, Morgongåva and Varberg.
   

  

 Follow us on social media to stay up to date on everything that's happening at Apotea
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

 Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.
   

  

**Recruitment process**
* Apply
* Screening interview
* Technical interview
* Culture fit interview
* Background check (mandatory in pharmacy industry)
* Offer 🎉


 📍 Location: Sveavägen 168, Stockholm
   

  

 🏢 Work model: We work on-site
   

  

 👤 Reports to: Head of IT Operations
   

  

**Ready to join the journey?**
 Don’t wait – interviews happen continuously, and the role may be filled quickly. Apply today and be part of building something bigger than just software.
   

  

*Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health, and your work creates real change.*
 Apotea är Sveriges största nätapotek med fokus på hållbarhet och snabba leveranser. Vår logistik är hjärtat i verksamheten, och vi har som mål att bli Nordens största apotek och Sveriges mest hållbara företag. Tillsammans med våra kunder har vi samlat in över 100 miljoner kronor till välgörenhet, och vi fortsätter att växa varje år – med våra medarbetare som den drivande kraften bakom framgången.

title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
description:
**Job Title:** 
 AI Azure Developer
 



**Location:** 
 Solna, Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid 3 days onsite / 2 days remote)
 



**Start Date:** 
 02 March 2026
 



**End Date:** 
 31 August 2026
 



**Assignment Type:** 
 Residential
 



**Work Schedule:** 
 8 hours per day, 5 days per week
 



  





**Overview** 



* An international energy organisation is seeking an experienced AI Azure Developer to deliver enterprise AI and cloud solutions.
* The role focuses on scalable AI applications, enterprise integrations, and automation of business and IT processes.



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




**AI Solution Development** 



* Build AI solutions using Azure AI services including prompt workflows, retrieval augmented generation (RAG), vector search, orchestration, and conversational interfaces.
* Develop AI agents with custom actions and integrations.



**Backend Development** 



* Develop Azure-based services using Functions, Logic Apps, App Services, Event Grid, Service Bus, Key Vault, Managed Identity, and API Management.



**Enterprise Integration** 



* Design and implement integrations with enterprise IT and business platforms.
* Develop custom connectors or adapters where required.



**Automation** 



* Implement automated workflows to support IT service processes, approvals, ticket lifecycles, and business operations.



**Data and Knowledge Solutions** 



* Develop RAG solutions using enterprise search services.
* Design indexing pipelines, metadata structures, embeddings, and controls to ensure accurate and secure responses from internal knowledge sources.



**Security and Governance** 



* Apply enterprise security standards including role-based access, secret management, monitoring, and responsible AI practices.



**Operations** 



* Implement monitoring, performance tracking, and cost optimisation.
* Produce documentation, runbooks, and support processes for production environments.



  





**Required Skills and Experience** 



* Strong Azure development experience including Functions, Logic Apps, App Services, Event Grid, Key Vault, Managed Identity, and API Management
* Experience with Azure AI services, OpenAI models, vector databases, embeddings, and prompt engineering
* Experience building AI agents or workflows using Microsoft Copilot technologies
* Strong understanding of RAG architecture and retrieval optimisation
* Experience integrating enterprise platforms using APIs, middleware, or custom connectors
* Proficiency in C# or Python and REST API development
* Experience with CI/CD using Azure DevOps or GitHub
* Familiarity with Microsoft Graph, SharePoint integration, and data governance principles
* Knowledge of ITSM processes such as incident, change, request, and knowledge management is beneficial



**Personal Attributes** 



* Strong communication skills
* Proactive and solution-focused mindset
* Ability to work in agile, cross-functional teams
* Interest in AI, automation, and cloud technologies



  





**Eligibility** 



* Candidates must have the legal right to work in Sweden.
* Visa sponsorship is not available.
