***Background check***
*Umain conducts a background check for final candidates in accordance with our internal People Procedure (UIS‑007). The check is carried out only with your consent and is ordered by our CISO through our approved screening partner. The scope of the check depends on the role level. This step is performed late in the recruitment process and is used solely to support a secure and fact‑based hiring decision.*
 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**Fullstack Developer – Traton Financial Services IT**
 Traton Financial Services IT is looking for a talented Fullstack Developer to join our dynamic team in Stockholm, Södertälje. We specialize in innovative cloud-based solutions, microservices and integrations. We are now expanding our team to meet the increasing demand of our services.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 As a Fullstack Developer, you will be pivotal in developing and maintaining cloud applications, working collaboratively with business and developers. In addition to creating customized applications to meet mission-critical business needs within Traton Financial Services, your responsibilities also include troubleshooting, debugging, and optimizing applications. As a Fullstack Developer we believe is important to stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in development, which we encourage.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are a team player but also love to work independently and take responsibility for your solutions. You like to bring your ideas to improve the design and features of things you are working with. We believe that you have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and pay attention to detail. It is important that you have strong communication skills to collaborate with other team members, designers, testers and business stakeholders.
   

  

**Your Profile**
 You have several years of experience as a fullstack developer or similar role, including:
   

  

  

* University degree in computer science / IT, or similar proven education.
* .NET, C#
* Angular
* Integration tests and Unit tests
* Design patterns and architecture patterns
* SQL and NoSQL databases (for example PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB)
* AWS and/or Azure components & services
* Kubernetes / AWS EKS, Argo CD
* Docker, GitLab and/or GitHub


 You are fluent in English and live Stockholm/Södertälje area or willing to relocate.
   

  

 Other merited skills are:
   

  

  

* ReactJS
* DevOps experience
* Swedish language
* Monitoring tools(for example Datadog, Graphana, OpenTelemetry


 or similar)
   

  

  

* Experience of MCP implementations / integrations
* Experience of the financial services domain


**TRATON Financial Services Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TFS supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible working hours, and the opportunity to lease a company car. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and residents in Stockholm have direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job Express buses, which you as an employee at TRATON Financial Services also have access to.
   

  

**Application**
*We look forward to receiving your application, consisting of your CV and kindly ask you not to share a cover letter to ensure an efficient and unbiased recruitment process for all parties.*
 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-03-02. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check is required for this role. If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Jonas Frank, Solution Development Manager,
   

  

 jonas.frank@tratonfs.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Erfaren IT-specialist inom Windows klientlösningar
description:
Vi söker en erfaren IT-specialist inom Windows klientlösningar som vill vara med och driva vårt arbete med klienttjänster framåt. Hos oss får du möjlighet att använda din kompetens där den verkligen gör skillnad. Tillsammans med ett erfaret team är du med och skapar lösningar som gör avtryck – både idag och i framtiden.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 I rollen som IT-specialist ansvarar du för drift, förvaltning och utveckling av de klienttjänster som används av hela FMV. Du arbetar både proaktivt med att vidareutveckla och förvalta tjänsterna och reaktivt med incidenthantering, beställningar och andra processer som säkerställer att systemen fungerar optimalt. Du deltar i framtagande och uppföljning av förvaltningsplaner, tar fram underlag för upphandlingar och samarbetar nära tjänsteansvarig för att säkerställa effektiva och väl fungerande informationssystem.
   

  

 Du blir en del av en engagerad organisation där alla tar ansvar för informationssystem, tjänster, processer och rutiner och vid behov bidrar du även i projekt inom Infrastrukturstaben. Hos oss får du möjlighet att använda och utveckla din kompetens, samtidigt som du påverkar och bidrar i en spännande förändringsresa. Vi som arbetar här tycker om att göra skillnad och värdesätter att alla tar aktiv del i att förbättra och utveckla våra tjänster.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm och tjänsteresor kan förekomma.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har en högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande kometens förvärvad på annat sätt som vi bedömer likvärdig. Du har flera års relevant och aktuell erfarenhet av drift och förvaltning av klientlösningar baserade på Windows, inklusive MSI-paketering, SCCM, GPO-hantering och användning av Powershell. Du behöver även ha erfarenhet av Windows 11 samt teknisk kompetens inom imagehantering och applikationspaketering.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med ServiceNow eller motsvarande ärendehanteringsverktyg. Likaså om du har erfarenhet av Active Directory. Har du dessutom kunskap om eller erfarenhet av ITIL och informationssäkerhetsarbete är det en fördel. Vi tror även att du har kortare uppstartsträcka om du har erfarenhet av att implementera klientlösningar i enterprisemiljöer.
   

  

 Du behöver även ha god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Personliga egenskaper är av stor vikt för oss. Vi välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter och söker dig som har en initiativförmåga och viljan och förmågan att lära och utvecklas. I grunden är du även strukturerad och stabil samtidigt som du har förmågan att se helheten. Vidare är du en utpräglad lagspelare och relaterar till andra på ett lyhört och smidigt sätt.
   

  

**FMV - Försvarets materielverk**
 På FMV är du med och bidrar till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare. Vi har i uppdrag att förse det svenska försvaret med den senaste tekniken och kunskapen så att de kan försvara vårt land och våra allierade. Tillsammans med kompetenta och engagerade kollegor får du vara med och utveckla och upphandla det som ibland inte existerar än. Du driver utvecklingen, hela vägen från behov till leverans. Från idé till verklighet.
   

  

 Infrastrukturstaben ansvarar för myndighetens IT-verksamhet, informationsförvaltning och fastighetsförvaltning.
   

  

 Hos FMV erbjuds du en trygg anställning med bra förmåner:
   

  

* Kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter
* Flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet till distansarbete i den mån arbetet tillåter
* Tjänstepension och friskvårdsbidrag


 Läs mer om FMV som arbetsgivare och om de förmåner vi erbjuder på vår hemsida: Arbeta på FMV.
   

  

 Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens försvar? Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2026-03-02
   

  

**Bra att veta**
* Du ansöker genom att bifoga ditt CV, betyg och intyg på svenska. I ditt CV beskriver du tydligt på vilket sätt du uppfyller efterfrågade kvalifikationer och meriter. För en mer inkluderande rekryteringsprocess tar vi inte emot några personliga brev.
* Vi rekryterar kompetensbaserat och bedömer kandidater utifrån rollens krav på erfarenhet, kompetens och personliga egenskaper.
* Våra fackliga företrädare är Stefan Hållander (SACO-S), Peter Andersson (SEKO), Lars Carlsson (OFR/O) och Madeleine Lithander (OFR/S). Alla nås på telefon 08-782 40 00 (FMV Växel).
* Vid frågor om tjänsten kan du kontakta rekryterande chef Peter Svahn via FMV:s växel: 08-782 4000. Kontakta Johanna Samuelson johanna.samuelson@fmv.se vid frågor om rekryteringsprocessen.


 /
   

  

 För att jobba hos oss behöver du vara svensk medborgare och genomgå en säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi tillämpar provanställning och som anställd kommer du att krigsplaceras utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Ansökningar till befattningen tas endast emot via FMV:s webbplats eller registratur. Vi har gjort vårt medieval och undanber oss därför försäljning av annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

title: System Developer - Core Team
description:
RaySearch develops a suite of cancer care software, and we are now looking to add more talented developers to our oncology information system RayCare, specifically to our Core team which is responsible for framework development.
   

  

**About RayCare**
 RayCare is a client-server application that runs on premises at many clinics all over the world. RayCare takes care of and helps clinical staff to coordinate their work at the clinic. For example, workflow management, patient chart details and treatment management. RayCare is an innovative oncology information system (OIS) designed to support the complex challenges of modern oncology clinics. It is developed to streamline workflows in cancer clinics to facilitate efficient care faster to more patients. RayCare is used by all staff at the clinic, e.g., physicians, physicists, treatment planners etc. and is used in all steps of patient care, from registration to radiation treatment at the treatment machine and for treatment follow-up. RayCare is integrated with RayStation and its treatment tools but also with external products and supports communication via HL7 as well as DICOM.
   

  

 In the Core team you will mainly work with developing and improving our mission-critical event sourcing and micro service framework as well as installation and security aspects for the RayCare product.
   

  

 As a part of the Core team, you have the possibility to work with a variety of interesting and challenging tasks together with talented colleagues and contribute to evolving the platform and ensuring that it meets the high requirements on patient safety, robustness, performance, and availability.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a core team developer, you will be part of designing and implementing a robust and modern software platform for our oncology information system. We believe you are a hands-on system developer with great problem-solving skills and a meticulous and structured approach. RayCare has high demands on sustainable software development ensuring excellent code quality and maintaining best practices. In your everyday work, you continuously contribute to good overall software design with the goal of achieving a highly structured large scale software product. You are always open to discuss overall design within and between teams, valuing collaboration and your colleagues input to find the best solution for the problem at hand.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You have excellent analytic skills and can identify different components of problems, see connections between them, and understand the impact of various proposed solutions. You take responsibility for your work, ensuring that nothing is overlooked when implementing new functionality. You value collaboration, share knowledge with you team, and take pride in delivering high-quality code that supports the teams’ and organization's goals.
   

  

**Requirements**
* M.Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering physics or equivalent academic degree
* Minimum five years of backend development experience with complex products
* Expertise in C#/.NET
* Proficient with SQL Server
* Experience with client-server based systems
* Knowledge of domain-driven design
* Knowledge of event-sourcing
* Knowledge of CQRS/CQS


**Meriting**
* Experience of working in an agile environment
* Experience from the MedTech-industry or other regulated industries
* Experience of framework development of mission critical systems
* Experience from microservice architectures
* High performance computing (multi-threaded/async software)
* Messaging systems such as RabbitMQ
* Experience with security technologies such as; OpenID Connect, certificates, OpenIddict


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization, where everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability to deliver exceptional results, pay close attention to detail, and consistently go the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in their field, driven by a relentless focus on solving problems - no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in leading the way in cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative solutions that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply to the position through the application form below. We do not accept applications by e-mail. Selection and interviews will be ongoing.

title: IT Architect – Energy Business
description:
Are you ready to take on the challenge of shaping the future of energy assets? As an IT Architect - at Vattenfall, you will play a pivotal role in driving our mission of achieving fossil free living within one generation. By optimizing and innovating our IT landscape, you will contribute to increasing efficiency and sustainably. Your expertise will contribute to a smarter, more resilient energy system, making a real impact on the environment.
   

  

**What will you do?**
 You will become part of a central and internationally operating IT hub of IT Architects, where each individual has a focus on a specific part of our energy business. You will play a crucial role in steering our strategic projects to successful execution through fit-for-purpose architecture. Your responsibilities will include consulting, supporting and educating the business on IT, integration, and data strategies. With your solid understanding of IT security, you will support our mission critical environment in the evolving and changing business we are operating in. You will build up business knowledge to become the go-to expert for advancing our IT landscape.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will**
* Guide strategic projects to successful execution with fit-for-purpose architecture
* Consult and educate the business on IT, integration, and data strategies
* Support in adopting secure IT practices
* Drive the adoption of data mesh in collaboration with the business
* Help grow our Enterprise thinking and establish standards and architecture principles
* Act as a trusted advisor, enabling operating models through technology, even if it requires radical change


 By fostering strong interactions with internal and external stakeholders, you will help shape the future of our IT landscape. Your ability to translate complex challenges into actionable insights will inspire your colleagues and drive the continuous improvement of our operations.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 Who are you
   

  

 You are an experienced professional with a strong background in IT architecture, ideally with a business focus on asset-intensive industries such as Energy, Water, Industry, or Automotive. With at least 10+ years of relevant experience, you bring a deep understanding of IT security, integration topics, and data strategies. Your academic degree in IT or a related field has equipped you with the theoretical knowledge, while your practical experience has honed your skills in implementing fit-for-purpose architectures.
   

  

 You have successfully navigated the complexities of international environments. Your ability to communicate effectively with both IT and non-IT colleagues at various levels within the organization sets you apart. You thrive in dynamic, ever-changing environments and are adept at translating complex problems into actionable insights for the Management Board.
   

  

**Key Qualifications We Are Looking For**
* Extensive experience as an Architect or Consultant
* Deep IT knowledge and experience with IT architecture and frameworks
* Comfortable communicating complex ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Ability to thrive in an ever-changing environment and direct complex problems into concise actions for leadership


 Your ability to build trust and drive change will be essential in this role, as you help shape the future of our business through innovative IT solutions.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

 Join us in Luleå or Stockholm and become part of a team dedicated to creating fossil-free energy within one generation. Enjoy a challenging, international work environment, a central office location with easy access to public transport, and a healthy work-life balance. Submit your application, including your CV, in English via our website. For more information, contact Folmer Koper via folmer1.koper@vattenfall.com. At Vattenfall, we value diversity and welcome all applicants.
   

  

**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 20 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We now want to make fossil-free living possible within one generation. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.

title: Senior Network & IT Architect
description:
Vi söker en Senior Network & IT Architect som vill bli en del av oss på Telia.
   

  

 Jag heter Daniel Dahlbom, Head of Infra Automation, och jag letar efter någon som vill växa tillsammans med oss. Vi är ett stöttande och framtidsinriktat team som fokuserar på att driva Telia Infras digitala utveckling genom säker, skalbar och automatiserad arkitektur för våra mest kritiska plattformar och system.
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra:**
 Som Senior Network & IT Architect arbetar du tvärfunktionellt över cirka 20 affärskritiska IT‑system och driver utvecklingen av moderna, säkra och högpresterande arkitekturlösningar. Du växlar mellan strategisk arkitektur och hands-on problemlösning i komplexa miljöer.
   

  

* Utveckla arkitektur för nätverks- och IT‑plattformar, inklusive Wildfly‑/JBoss‑miljöer och containeriserade drifter
* Skapa robusta designprinciper och lösningar som möter krav enligt GDPR, NIS2 och Telias interna säkerhetsramverk
* Konsultera utvecklings‑, säkerhets‑ och arkitekturteam kring bästa praxis och säker implementation
* Driva felsökning och tekniska utredningar i avancerade systemmiljöer


**För att lyckas i rollen:**
 Du är en analytisk och lösningsorienterad person som trivs med komplexa tekniska utmaningar och kan arbeta både självständigt och i nära samarbete med andra.
   

  

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av avancerad Wildfly/JBoss‑administration (datasource‑pooler, messaging‑köer, Elytron‑konfigurationer) samt säker systemdesign
* God kunskap om Linux‑administration, containerteknik (ex. Docker) och moderna utvecklingsramverk
* Förmåga att utforma och förbättra arkitektur i komplexa miljöer och omsätta säkerhetskrav i tekniska lösningar
* Flytande i svenska och engelska


**Var med och forma ett smartare liv för människor, företag och planeten**
 På Telia är vi ett team med 15 000 kollegor i Norden och Baltikum, passionerade kring teknik och uppkoppling. Som ledande telekomoperatör och klimatförebild driver vi förändring genom storskaliga, effektfulla projekt – samtidigt som vi bygger en hållbar och inkluderande värld. Här får du möjlighet att utveckla dina färdigheter, leda meningsfulla projekt och trivas i en stöttande och mångsidig miljö. Oavsett om du tar ditt första steg eller nästa, så är Telia en plats att växa, höra hemma och göra verklig skillnad.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 När du börjar hos oss får du ett omfattande förmånspaket anpassat efter din lokala marknad, möjlighet till hybridarbete och mer. Du har också chans att få bonus baserat på din prestation och Telias resultat.
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan senast
 **2026‑02‑17** 
 . Rollen kan komma att stängas tidigare.
   

  

 Om du går vidare kontaktas du av vår Talent Acquisition Partner. Bakgrunds‑ och referenskontroller ingår i processen.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer? Kontakta
 **Daniel Dahlbom, Head of Infra Automation** 
 , på
 **daniel.dahlbom@teliacompany.com** 
 .
   

  

**Lika möjligheter för alla**
 På Telia värderar vi kompetens och utvecklingspotential. Vi främjar mångfald och ser till att varje individs behov tillgodoses, oavsett funktionsvariation, kön, ålder, nationalitet, sexuell läggning eller social bakgrund. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsmiljö där din unikhet är vår styrka.
   

  

*Telia är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur och delar av vår verksamhet omfattas av lagstiftning om säkerhetsskydd. Innan anställning kan ske krävs godkänd säkerhetsprövning*
 Join us and let’s make better happen – together!

title: Front Office Specialist
description:
FactSet creates flexible, open data and software solutions for over 200,000 investment professionals worldwide, providing instant access to financial data and analytics that investors use to make crucial decisions.
   

  

 At FactSet, our values are the foundation of everything we do. They express how we act and operate, serve as a compass in our decision-making, and play a big role in how we treat each other, our clients, and our communities. We believe that the best ideas can come from anyone, anywhere, at any time, and that curiosity is the key to anticipating our clients’ needs and exceeding their expectations.
   

  

 FactSet’s Front Office Solutions Sales team empowers investment professionals with innovative solutions and industry expertise. Based in our Stockholm office, you’ll be part of a collaborative local team deeply engaged with clients and global colleagues, dedicated to driving value and delivering differentiated experiences. Our environment is dynamic, inclusive, and focused on professional development, making it a supportive space for high-impact client engagement and growth.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Front Office Solutions Sales Specialist located in Stockholm, you will be responsible for nurturing, expanding, and maximizing FactSet’s presence amongst our Nordics and DACH client base.
   

  

* Develop and maintain strong relationships with asset managers, asset owners, and other investment professionals throughout Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Austria and Switzerland.
* Leverage your expertise to provide insights into clients’ businesses and workflows, engaging in meaningful, two-way conversations to solve challenges and drive client differentiation.
* Tailor communication and proposals to align with client value drivers unique to the Nordic region.
* Own and guide complex sales cycles from initial engagement and product demonstration through negotiation and close, confidently discussing commercial terms.
* Collaborate locally and globally with sales enablement, product marketing, consulting, and business stakeholders to promote FactSet’s Front Office Solutions and identify new business opportunities.
* Become a trusted subject matter expert for FactSet in the Nordics, gathering market intelligence, positioning FactSet’s competitive strengths, and relaying actionable feedback to influence our product strategy.
* Record and analyze client interactions and sales activities in CRM; facilitate feedback between sales and the Buy-Side Front Office Product team.
* Be accountable for your book of business in the region, driving growth across products and workflows and ensuring excellent client satisfaction.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Proven success managing complex sales cycles, 10 years or relevant experience supporting clients in financial services or investment management within the Nordics.
* Academic Excellence: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Finance, Business, Economics, or related discipline.
* Excellent relationship-building and communication skills, with the ability to teach, tailor messaging, and negotiate with senior client stakeholders- Commercial acumen and confidence in driving conversations about value, pricing, and deal closure.
* Eager to become a local subject matter expert, understanding both client and competitor landscapes relevant to the Nordics and DACH markets.
* Strong collaborative approach, comfortable working with cross-functional teams in a global organization.
* Self-starter, highly organized, accountable for managing a regional book of business and reporting on progress.
* Fluency in English is required; fluency in a Nordic language is highly beneficial.
* Experience using CRM systems to track client engagement and sales activities.


**What's In It For You**
 At FactSet, our people are our greatest asset, and our culture is our biggest competitive advantage. Being a FactSetter means:
   

  

* The opportunity to join an S&P 500 company with over 45 years of sustainable growth powered by the entrepreneurial spirit of a start-up.
* Support for your total well-being. This includes health, life, and disability insurance, as well as retirement savings plans and a discounted employee stock purchase program, plus paid time off for holidays, family leave, and company-wide wellness days.
* Flexible work accommodations. We value work/life harmony and offer our employees a range of accommodations to help them achieve success both at work and in their personal lives.
* A global community dedicated to volunteerism and sustainability, where collaboration is always encouraged, and individuality drives solutions.
* Career progression planning with dedicated time each month for learning and development.
* Business Resource Groups open to all employees that serve as a catalyst for connection, growth, and belonging.


**Company Overview**
 Learn more about our benefits here.
   

  

 FactSet (NYSE:FDS | NASDAQ:FDS) helps the financial community to see more, think bigger, and work better. Our digital platform and enterprise solutions deliver financial data, analytics, and open technology to more than 8,200 global clients, including over 200,000 individual users. Clients across the buy-side and sell-side, as well as wealth managers, private equity firms, and corporations, achieve more every day with our comprehensive and connected content, flexible next-generation workflow solutions, and client-centric specialized support. As a member of the S&P 500, we are committed to sustainable growth and have been recognized among the Best Places to Work in 2023 by Glassdoor as a Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award winner. Learn more at www.factset.com and follow us on X and LinkedIn.
   

  

 At FactSet, we celebrate difference of thought, experience, and perspective. Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to characteristics protected by law.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about creating smooth, efficient development processes? Do you thrive in agile environments where collaboration, automation, and continuous improvement drive success? Would you like to be part of a team developing cutting-edge software that supports cancer care around the world? Then join us at RaySearch Laboratories as a DevOps Engineer and help shape the future of oncology information systems.
   

  

**About The Role**
 RaySearch is developing advanced software solutions to improve cancer treatment worldwide. As a DevOps Engineer at RaySearch, you’ll be part of a collaborative team driving automation, efficiency, and reliability across our development environments. You’ll work closely with developers and DevOps engineers across several products — including our oncology information system and treatment planning system — to optimize build pipelines, release processes, and development workflows. As our configuration teams grow, you’ll have great opportunities to shape routines and ways of working together. Your main tasks will be to:
   

  

* Strive to make the development iteration times short and efficient
* Manage build and release flows using pipelines
* Create and manage tools using the Azure DevOps API to input and output information
* Manage build and test servers and the related environments
* Administer, manage and provide support for Git version control


**Your profile**
**Required**
 We believe you are a collaborative and curious professional who enjoys working closely with others to make things run smoothly. You take initiative, share ideas, and look for ways to improve how things are done. We believe you are attentive to details and value quality in your work, while keeping a pragmatic mindset. You’re comfortable in a dynamic environment where teamwork and communication are key to success. Fluency in English is required, and Swedish proficiency is a plus. Further, we believe you have:
   

  

* A B.Sc. or M.Sc. in engineering or equivalent experience
* 5 years’ experience in software development and/or configuration managementExperience in programming using .NET (PowerShell/C#).
* Experience in continuous integration and deployment (using e.g. Azure DevOps pipelines, GitHub Actions, or similar).
* Experience in Infrastructure as Code (Terraform/Ansible).
* Experience in Windows Server administration/management.
* Excellent communication skills in English.


 Lastly, it is not a requirement but highly meritorious if you have experience in:
   

  

* Microsoft Visual Studio
* Git
* Automation and process management using Azure DevOps


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySearch is the driving force behind our organization
 **,** 
 where everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability to deliver exceptional results, pay close attention to detail, and consistently go the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in their field, driven by a relentless focus on solving problems - no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in leading the way in cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative solutions that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer** 

 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply for the position through the application form below. Selection and interviews will be ongoing. We do not accept applications by email.

title: GCP Solution Architect
description:
The Google Cloud Solution Architect is a key member of the Presales Solutions team responsible for providing business leadership and strategic technical direction for customers.
 



  





 · Relationship Management: Work to build and maintain broad relationships internally and externally within Google Cloud, coach and guide TEKsystems Global Services Sales, Practice & Delivery on strategy and Google Cloud solutions, and advise a team of extended partners throughout the sales process.
 



 · Solution Driver: Serve as the primary driver for identifying, scoping, and creating solutions/proposals that encompass technical approach, best practice, implementation, team structure, pricing, and contracts.
 



 · Advocacy: Work with appropriate TEKsystems Global Services and Google Cloud partners (Executives, Solution Architects, Business Development, Partners, Google Cloud Consulting) to support customer interests, balancing that with the business needs of TEKsystems.
 



 · Strategic Thinking: Demonstrate the ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of global businesses and their financial implications.
 



 · Modernization Focus: Apply deep understanding of digital transformation—converting complex legacy IT environments to new native digital environments—focusing on Data Modernisation and AI/ML to solve enterprise IT challenges.
 



 · Thought Leadership: Act as a subject matter expert (SME) and deliver technical webinars, speak at public events, and present internally with cross-functional teams.
 



  





 Qualifications and Experience
 



 Education & Professional Background
 



 · Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, or related field.
 



 · Experience: Minimum 8+ years’ experience in Information Technology and/or Professional Services required; 12+ years preferred.
 



 · Presales: 5+ years in client-facing Presales/Solution Architect role interfacing with business and technology executives.
 



 · Professional Services: Minimum 5+ years’ hands-on experience in a professional services organization.
 



  





 Technical Expertise
 



 · Cloud Platforms: Minimum 5+ years’ hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) and architecture models.
 



 · Data Architecture: Proven experience in designing and deploying data solutions and data architectures on Google Cloud, with hands-on expertise in services such as Compute Engine, Cloud Storage, Cloud SQL, BigQuery, Dataflow, Cloud Functions, and Pub/Sub.
 



 · AI & GenAI: Desirable experience with AI/Gen AI/ML services (e.g., Vertex AI, Gemini, Dialogflow CX, Natural Language API, Speech-to-Text).
 



 · Pipelines: Experience with architecting and implementing data pipelines, data lakes, and data warehousing solutions optimised for GenAI workloads.
 



 · Data Skills: Strong knowledge of data modelling, ETL processes, SQL, and scripting languages such as Python.
 



 · Big Data & Viz: Experience with Big Data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark/Dataproc) and data visualisation tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI).
 



 · Frameworks: Familiarity with AI/ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face, etc.).
 



 · Security & Governance: Experience in implementing security standards and data governance policies within Google Cloud environments, including encryption, IAM, and Cloud Monitoring.
 



 · DevOps: Understanding of MLOps and DevOps practices and infrastructure as code (e.g., Terraform, Google Cloud Deployment Manager).
 



 Certifications & Methodology
 



 · Certifications: Valid Google Cloud Certified Professional Cloud Architect or Professional Data Engineer certification preferred.
 



 · Technical Leadership: Guide development teams in adopting best practices for Google Cloud data architectures, ensuring solutions are robust, compliant, and cost-effective.
 



 · Documentation: Produce detailed architectural documentation, data flow diagrams, and operational guides for implemented solutions.
 



 · Migration: Demonstrated experience in developing Data Migration-Modernization Solutions and To-Be Architectures, usage of Google Cloud RaMP (Rapid Migration Program) for multiple clients and industry verticals (e.g., BFSI, HCLS, TMEG, Retail) using Google Cloud native services/tools and ISV tools.
 



 · Commercials: Experience developing effort/cost estimates, service pricing, writing statements of work, and reviewing/contributing to client contractual agreements.
 



 · Ecosystem: Proven experience with the Google Cloud Partner ecosystem and enabling collaboration with Google Cloud SAs for the benefit of our organisation and customers.
 



  





 Keys to Success
 



 · Communication: Must have outstanding presentation and writing skills with the ability to communicate at all levels within the client and TEKsystems Global Services organization.
 



 · Business Acumen: Must have strong business and information technology acumen with the ability to communicate capabilities, gather and assess client requirements, and communicate solution and value proposition to clients.
 



 · Collaboration: Must have an ability to work effectively in agile and cross-functional internal teams, including Google Cloud Partner Ecosystem collaboration and ability to support the GTM strategy in region.
 



 · Credibility: Must have strong technical understanding with the ability to build credibility with IT and Business Leadership.
 



 · Experience: Must have 2-3 years' experience in developing Google Cloud Data Migration-Modernization practice.
 



 · Travel: Occasional travel will be required.

title: Utbildare inom Fullstack .NET
description:
📍
 **Plats:** 
 Stockholm – Distansarbete
   

  

 📅
 **Start:** 
 Höstterminen 2026
   

  

 Teknikakademin söker en utbildare inom
 **Fullstack .NET‑utveckling** 
 . Rollen passar dig som har stark kompetens inom C#, .NET‑ramverket och moderna utvecklingsmetoder – och som vill utbilda framtidens systemutvecklare.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Du ansvarar för att planera, genomföra och utveckla undervisning inom C#, .NET, webbutveckling och systemutveckling. Undervisningen sker på distans och speglar hur utveckling bedrivs i branschen, med fokus på praktiska arbetsmetoder och verkliga affärsbehov.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Undervisa i C# och .NET‑ramverket
* Förmedla kunskaper i webbutveckling inom .NET‑miljöer
* Introducera design och utveckling av databaser
* Lära ut testning, felsökning och strukturerat utvecklingsarbete
* Undervisa i moderna utvecklingsverktyg och arbetsflöden
* Handleda projekt som genomförs enligt agila metoder
* Kvalitetssäkra och vidareutveckla kursmaterial


**Kvalifikationer**
* Mycket goda kunskaper i C# och .NET
* Erfarenhet av webbutveckling i .NET‑miljöer
* God förståelse för databaser och datamodellering
* Erfarenhet av testning, felsökning och moderna utvecklingsmetoder
* Relevant teknisk utbildning och/eller yrkeserfarenhet
* God pedagogisk förmåga


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av fullstackutveckling inom .NET
* Kunskap om molntjänster eller DevOps‑processer
* Erfarenhet som handledare/instruktör
* Erfarenhet av projektarbete eller ledning av mindre projekt


**Vi erbjuder**
* Konkurrenskraftig lön
* Möjlighet till distansarbete
* Reseersättning enligt överenskommelse
* En stimulerande och professionell utbildningsmiljö
* Möjlighet att bidra till framtidens IT‑kompetens


**Ansökan och kontakt**
**Roni Tosun**
 📧 roni.tosun@teknikakademin.se
   

  

 📞 076‑205 82 44
   

  

 Urval sker löpande – välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Product Operations Manager
description:
About Sinch
   

  


 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses-including Google, Uber, PayPal, Visa, Tinder, and many others-rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice and email. Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



 At Sinch we
 **"Dream Big"** 
 ,
 **"Win Together"** 
 ,
 **"Keep it simple"** 
 , and
 **"Make it Happen"** 
 . These values are our foundation!
   

  




 Essence of the Role
   

  


**Product Operations Manager** 




 Your role is essentially to make a complex backend turned simple for clients. You'll manage and own new initiatives to enhance our cost effectiveness while routing messages tied to our SMS product. Carrying implementations from idea to reality with instant impact and take in requirements from multiple stakeholders. Coordinate with technical teams on the implementation and setup of new system features, and monitor the progress of ongoing implementations. This is a fast-moving role with need for a strong personal drive of the responsible individual.
 



**Key responsibilities:** 



* Design and activate cross-functional practices enabling product teams to harmonize product development, product introduction processes, and interactions with partners
* Test, evaluate and plan roll-out of new cost initiative solutions and track progress
* Monitoring, maintenance and enhancement of our product quality and cost improvement
* Facilitate effective coordination among the Product, Engineering, Marketing and Sales teams.
* Align with compliance requirements of SMS market-specific standards (e.g., country regulations, supported features, etc.)
* Collect client feedback and translate it into Product requirements
* Comfortable working independently and driving projects forward end-to-end.


 Requirements
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in engineering, Product Management, or equivalent experience
* 3 years + of Product Management experience in Telecommunications industry
* Problem-solving and analytical skills
* Develop and maintain close relationships with key stakeholders and decision-makers


 Our Hiring Process
   

  


 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
 



***At Sinch, English is our official working language. Please submit your application in English.***

title: PARTNERSHIP MANAGER
description:
**EuroBonus Partnership Manager – Banking & Payment Card Focus**
 Do you have a background in the credit card business and a passion for building strategic partnerships? Are you ready to shape one of Europe’s leading loyalty programs? If so, this role could be your next big opportunity!
   

  

 As a EuroBonus Partnership Manager, you will drive growth by developing and managing partnerships within banking, credit cards, and financial services, ensuring EuroBonus continues to deliver exceptional value to its close to nine million members.
   

  

**Challenges you will work on**
* Lead the development of co-branded payment card programs and financial partnerships that drive member engagement and loyalty.
* Negotiate and secure sustainable agreements with banks and fintechs to strengthen EuroBonus offerings.
* Manage and optimize partnerships to maximize mutual benefit and performance.
* Collaborate with internal teams (IT, Marketing, Legal) to integrate partner products seamlessly into the EuroBonus ecosystem.
* Use data-driven insights to monitor KPIs and recommend strategies for continuous improvement.


**The Team**
 You will join a high-performing and collaborative EuroBonus Partnership team that thrives on innovation and results. We work closely with partners across industries to create value for our members and drive SAS’ loyalty strategy forward. Our culture is dynamic, supportive, and focused on delivering excellence together - and we make sure to have fun along the way! Whether it’s celebrating wins, sharing ideas, or enjoying team activities, we believe success is best when it’s shared.
   

  

**To be successful, we believe you have**
* Experience or knowledge of the payment card business, banking, or fintech ecosystems.
* Experience in financial partnerships, business development, or loyalty programs.
* Confident in B2B solution selling, negotiation, and contract management – or eager to grow in these areas.
* Experience in Key Account Management, performance monitoring, and problem-solving.
* Familiarity with B2C marketing and activation strategies.
* Comfortable using Excel and PowerPoint in your daily work.
* Hold a degree in business, finance, or a related field, or have equivalent professional experience.


 As a person, you combine a commercial mindset with a strong drive to execute and a creative approach to developing partnership opportunities. You enjoy building relationships, are socially confident and proactive, and are motivated by delivering results together with others.
   

  

**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

**Additional Information**
* Deadline for application: 11/02/2026. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.


 Questions? Contact recruiting leader Madeleine Svantesson, Head of EuroBonus Partners, at madeleine.svantesson@sas.se. Please note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email due to the GDPR regulations.
   

  

 Come and fly with us!

title: Sales Assistant - Max Mara Fashion Group
description:
Would you like to join
 **Max Mara Fashion Group** 
 in
 **Stockholm** 
 as
 **Sales Assistant** 
 ?
 



  





 The
 **Sales Assistant** 
 is responsible for sharing the methodology and DNA of the company to clients in order to drive sales, grow the base and sustain the brand.
 



  





***You’ll be in charge of:***



* Welcome and help customers, providing an excellent in-store experience at all times.
* Demonstrate brand and product knowledge, based upon the training program provided, as well as keeping up to date with the luxury environment and competitors.
* Proactively deliver the brand's selling ceremony, maximizing sales opportunities in order to achieve store sales target and KPIs.
* Visual Merchandising Operations in the shop
* Actively builds client confidence by creating an engaging interactive experience
* Gain new clients, meeting conversion goals and continues to service existing clients



  





***If you:***



* Passion for fashion
* Customer-oriented approach
* Expertise in Retail Sales
* Strong interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills
* Fluent in English language



  





**Join US!** 




  





***About Max Mara Fashion Group***




 Max Mara Fashion Group is recognized throughout the world as the precursor of modern
 **pret-à-porter fashion** 
 .
 



  





 The Company was founded in
 **1951** 
 with the aim of offering “haute de gamme” feminine clothing, produced according to excellent industrial processes.
 



  





**Passion** 
 ,
 **commitment** 
 and
 **tradition** 
 have created a unique fashion style:
 


* 9 main brands
* 60+ fashion collections every season
* 14.000.000+ clothes sold every year
* 2.500+ single-brand shops
* 10.000+ multi-brand shops
* 27 languages spoken in the Max Mara Fashion Group world
* 5.500+ employees in the world



  





 Our ecosystem is made of
 **44 Depts** 
 , including Fashion Design, Marketing & Sales, Operations, Retail, Stores, ICT, Architecture Design, Economics, BI, etc.
 



  





 The Digital Division was the latest department to be established in 2013, with the aim of integrating the company's digital assets, as well as solutions and services related to e-commerce and digital marketing.
 



  





 Discover your potential and your substance with a career at MMFG, where work means passion, embracing new challenges, learning from each other, sharing a vision, teamwork and making it come true!
 



  





 Max Mara Fashion Group is an equal opportunity employer. Everyone is welcome!
 



  





**#joinus**

title: Full Stack Engineer - Test Experience Engineering
description:
The Test Experience squad manages the test infrastructure and tooling that underpin Spotify’s client platforms. Our mission is to provide a reliable, consistent, and efficient testing ecosystem that enables client engineers to validate their code with confidence and ship high-quality products. We’re continually evolving our systems to improve developer experience, reliability, and automation through well-designed services, tooling, documentation, and support.
   

  

 We are seeking a platform generalist with Full Stack & Data experience to join our Test Experience squad. In this role, you will leverage your curiosity and adaptability to build test infrastructure for Spotify clients. This includes test frameworks for (Android, iOS, C++, Web), data pipelines, backend services and Backstage plugins.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Shape and drive the technical roadmap of our test infrastructure environment
* Improve testing practices across the Spotify ecosystem
* Support engineers across Spotify to drive test automation and help remediate debugging failures


 Who You Are
   

  

* Proficient in Java backend services, preferably using Apollo with PostgreSQL databases.
* Proficient in web test tooling, preferably using Mocha, React, and WebdriverIO.
* Proficient in data engineering, preferably using Scala and Scio.
* Comfortable completing tasks in different domains and codebases (Android, iOS, C++, Web, Bash, Python, etc).Strong understanding of software architecture and design principles.
* Experienced with writing and maintaining automated tests.
* Familiar with designing scalable and maintainable testing systems and infrastructure.
* An understanding of CI pipelines and infrastructure tools like Bazel and Git is valued.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Assistant Store Manager - Max Mara Fashion Group
description:
Would you like to join
 **Max Mara Fashion Group** 
 in
 **Stockholm** 
 as
 **Assistant** 
**Store Manager** 
 ?
 



  





 The
 **Assistant Store Manager** 
 is responsible for maximizing sales in accordance with company standards by guiding, motivating, and developing on-floor staff. They ensure the proper distribution of personnel according to customer flow and commercial objectives
 



  





***You’ll be in charge of:***



* Achievement of the qualitative and quantitative objectives assigned by the Store Manager
* Store supervision in the absence of the Store Manager
* Development and growth facilitation of resources in coordination with the Store Manager
* Development of role learning through proactive, team, and digital activities aimed at innovation and improving the effectiveness/efficiency of their responsibilities
* Identification of effective solutions to adapt the presence of resources on the floor to customer/market needs
* Effective commercial management of events in collaboration with the Store Manager



  





***If you:***



* Passion for fashion
* Customer-oriented approach
* Expertise in Retail Store management
* Advanced Team Leadership and Motivation
* Strong Organizational and Communication skills
* Fluent in German and English language



  





**Join US!** 




  





***About Max Mara Fashion Group***




 Max Mara Fashion Group is recognized throughout the world as the precursor of modern
 **pret-à-porter fashion** 
 .
 



  





 The Company was founded in
 **1951** 
 with the aim of offering “haute de gamme” feminine clothing, produced according to excellent industrial processes.
 



  





**Passion** 
 ,
 **commitment** 
 and
 **tradition** 
 have created a unique fashion style:
 


* 9 main brands
* 60+ fashion collections every season
* 14.000.000+ clothes sold every year
* 2.500+ single-brand shops
* 10.000+ multi-brand shops
* 27 languages spoken in the Max Mara Fashion Group world
* 5.500+ employees in the world



  





 Our ecosystem is made of
 **44 Depts** 
 , including Fashion Design, Marketing & Sales, Operations, Retail, Stores, ICT, Architecture Design, Economics, BI, etc.
 



  





 The Digital Division was the latest department to be established in 2013, with the aim of integrating the company's digital assets, as well as solutions and services related to e-commerce and digital marketing.
 



  





 Discover your potential and your substance with a career at MMFG, where work means passion, embracing new challenges, learning from each other, sharing a vision, teamwork and making it come true!
 



  





 Max Mara Fashion Group is an equal opportunity employer. Everyone is welcome!
 



  





**#joinus**

title: Information Security Consultant
description:
Som ledande konsultbolag inom säker digitalisering och cybersäkerhet säkrar vi utvecklingen hos våra kunder varje dag. Vi erbjuder allt från strategisk rådgivning vid komplexa utmaningar till helhetsåtaganden inom cybersäkerhet och digitalisering. Vårt uppdrag är att skapa säkra IT-system och lösningar, effektivisera processer, skydda mot cyberhot, hantera lagkrav och bli mer hållbara i en digital värld.
 



  





 Vill du utvecklas och dela med dig av din expertis inom cybersecurity management & resilience? Då kan du vara den vi söker!
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Vi söker dig med erfarenhet och intresse för IT- och informationssäkerhet som vill arbeta med spännande uppdrag inom olika branscher och tillsammans med ett härligt gäng kollegor. Din roll kommer att vara central för våra kunder, där ditt engagemang, din lyhördhet och nyfikenhet är av stor vikt.
 



  





**Vi ser gärna att du:** 



* idag och sedan minst 4 år tillbaka arbetar med säkerhet, kanske i en linjeroll eller att du redan idag arbetar som konsult
* har erfarenhet av att arbeta med operativt, systematiskt- och riskbaserat IT- och informationssäkerhetsarbete
* har en god förståelse för organisationers styrning, riskhantering och regelefterlevnadsarbete
* har erfarenhet av säkerhetsrådgivning och granskning inom organisationer
* känner dig bekväm med att delta i projekt för införande av ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet, inklusive certifieringsprocessen
* har god teknisk kunskap samt förståelse för verksamhetens möjligheter och utmaningar inom området
* har akademisk examen eller motsvarande med inriktning mot IT- och informationssäkerhet
* behärskar svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift



  





**Det är även meriterande om du har:** 



* relevanta certifieringar som t.ex. CC, CISM, CISSP, CISA, CRISC
* erfarenhet av lagar och regelverk som t.ex. PCI DSS, GDPR, OSL och NIS
* erfarenhet av standarder som t.ex. MSB metodstöd, ISO 27001 och NIST samt CIS controls



  





 Är det någon certifiering du vill ta men ännu inte har? Inga problem! Vi står för certifieringen och uppmuntrar alltid våra kollegor till fortsatt kompetensutveckling.
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Omegapoint grundades 2001 och är Norra Europas ledande konsultbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Med en vision om en framtid där vi fullt ut kan lita på teknik använder vi vår expertis för att säkra våra kunders och medarbetares utveckling. Vi är vassa och snälla, något som karaktäriseras av vår kompetensutvecklingskultur och viljan att dela vår kunskap med varandra. För närvarande är vi över 800 anställda konsulter i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Örebro, Västerås, Enköping, Uppsala och Umeå.
 



  





**Vi satsar på dig - skapa framtiden tillsammans med oss! 🚀** 




 Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i teknikens och cybersäkerhetens framkant – tillsammans med några av branschens mest kompetenta kollegor. Vi tror på att erfarenhet och nyfikenhet går hand i hand, och vi söker dig som vill vara med och utveckla framtidens säkra digitala lösningar.
 



  




* **Kontinuerlig utveckling:** 
 Vi investerar löpande i din kompetens genom utbildningar, certifieringar, mentorskap och kunskapsdelning.
* **Meningsfulla uppdrag:** 
 Du arbetar med uppdrag som gör skillnad – där din insats bidrar till tryggare, mer hållbara och robusta digitala samhällen.
* **Samarbete och gemenskap:** 
 Hos oss råder en kultur av öppenhet och prestigelöshet. Vi lär av varandra, utmanar varandra och delar en gemensam vilja att alltid bli bättre.



  





 Vill du vara en del av ett team som kombinerar teknik, samhällsnytta och kollegial värme – och där din kompetens verkligen gör skillnad? Då är Omegapoint platsen för dig!
 



  





 Har du några funderingar kring tjänsten? Tveka inte på att kontakta petra.soderberg@omegapoint.se.
 



**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! ⤵️**

title: Senior Service Owner M365/Copilot
description:
At Vattenfall, we are committed to powering climate-smart living. As part of our digital transformation journey, we are embedding AI-driven solutions like Microsoft Copilot into our daily workflows to enhance productivity, collaboration, and innovation across the enterprise..
   

  

 As the
 **Senior Service Owner for Microsoft Co-Pilot embedded in M365** 
 , you will be end-to-end responsible for the delivery, development, and continuous improvement of the Microsoft Copilot services for all Vattenfall employees. You collaborate closely with your peers overseeing connected services, business representatives, technical experts and external partners.
   

  

 We are seeking a visionary and hands-on
 **Senior Service Owner** 
 to lead the integration and lifecycle management of Microsoft Copilot within our Microsoft 365 ecosystem. This role is pivotal in ensuring Copilot delivers measurable value to our users, aligns with business goals, remains fully compliant to European and national laws and evolves with new emerging AI capabilities.
   

  

**Your area of responsibility**
* Own and optimize the end-to-end service delivery of Microsoft Copilot across M365 applications (Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, Word, Excel, Loop, Copilot Agents)
* Drive adoption and usability improvements by collaborating with internal stakeholders and Microsoft product teams
* Manage financial aspects of the service, including budgeting, costing, charge-out and cost optimization
* Act as an escalation point for service-related issues; coordinate resolution with relevant teams, stakeholders as well as external partners
* Lead Copilot governance meetings and maintain a structured backlog of Copilot-related issues and use cases
* Ensure compliance with local data protection regulations, IT security, architecture and license management policies
* Advise on processes to maintain growing number of centrally deployed Copilot Agents.
* Facilitate user feedback loops, orchestrate the Vattenfall-wide Copilot Champion community and initiate continuous improvement initiatives
* Oversee rollout activities, upgrades, and adoption or training initiatives for Microsoft Copilot
* Communicate and promote Microsoft´s Copilot service offering to the wider Vattenfall community


**Location**
 The Service Owner can be based in
 **Stockholm,** 
**Hamburg, Berlin or Amsterdam** 
 while some business travel to other Vattenfall locations are required.
   

  

 A healthy balance between work and family is important to us and we enable therefore flexible workplace options, such as the possibility to work selectively from home.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Are we a match?**
 You have an academic degree in computer science, business informatics, or a similar technical or scientific field, and possess strong communication skills (including excellent English). You demonstrate a high degree of self-organization and the ability to work independently, you are curious and open to change.
   

  

 You are able to solve short-term operational challenges without losing sight of the overall strategic picture. You maintain an overview even in complex situations.
   

  

**We believe the following skills to ensure your success in this position:**
* 10 years of experience within enterprise IT environments
* 5 years of experience as Service Owner, Product Manager or Project Manager with strong focus on building bridges between technical innovation and real business value
* Strong understanding of Microsoft 365 architecture and AI capabilities, especially Copilot and Copilot Studio
* Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills e.g. you are excited to deliver engaging presentations to all levels of a large international organization with commitment, enthusiasm, and passion
* Familiarity with IT governance as well as license control and optimization frameworks
* Track record in orchestrating between functions such as architecture, security and delivery organizations in relation to service design, transition and delivery
* Impress others with your authenticity, reliability, and openness in personal interactions. In short: you embody our Vattenfall core values: “Connect People, Accelerate Learning, and Drive Innovation”
* Fluent in written and spoken English (C1 or higher)


**Nice To Have**
* Basic Knowledge about European General Data Protection Regulation and Data Privacy rule sets
* Exposure to agentic AI concepts and Copilot extensibility models
* Knowledge of performance benchmarking and competitive analysis of AI tools
* Ability to translate business needs into technical requirements and vice versa


 Additional Information
   

  

**Our offer**
 A challenging and independent job in an informal, dynamic working environment. You will play a part in shaping the future of a company where the only constant is change. Besides being a challenging and inspiring place to work, you will be part of an amazing team of highly experienced and talented individuals where we cherish a great work atmosphere! Everyone is really committed and we want to be the best in what we do. We offer good remuneration, attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional growth. You get the opportunity to create your own career within the company. Click here for further information.
   

  

**Why to join us?**
* You put yourself at the forefront of our AI transformation in a purpose-driven international organization
* You will intensively collaborate with cross-functional teams and global partners including Microsoft
* You shape the future of digital workplace productivity and employee experience


**More Information**
**We welcome your application in English, no later than,** 
**28th. of February 2026** 
 . We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.
   

  

**For more information** 
 about the position you are welcome to contact hiring manager
 **Mario Hempel, mario.hempel@vattenfall.com.** 
 For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter
 **Marius Gläßge, marius.glaessge@vattenfall.de.**
 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.
   

  

**Trade union representatives** 
 in Sweden (IT) are Sofi Wadström (Akademikerna), Inger Strandberg (Unionen), Christer Gustafsson (Ledarna), Lennart Bengtsson (SEKO). To get in contact with the representatives, please call Vattenfall´s switchboard +46 8 739 50 00.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall. The screening will be performed by a third party, DISA.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 21 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.

title: Systemutvecklare/Applikationsspecialist till Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset
description:
Vill du vara med att förbättra förutsättningarna för vård och forskning i Stockholm och göra regionen mer attraktiv för Life Science genom nya strukturer för samverkan mellan vård, akademi och näringsliv? Då kanske du är en av våra nya systemutvecklare!
   

  

**Du erbjuds**
* ansvar för vidareutveckling och drift av webbapplikationer och LIMS-system (LabWare)
* en arbetsmiljö med hela utvecklingskedjan – från behovskartläggning och kravinsamling till design, utveckling, implementering, test, produktionssättning samt support och förvaltning
* samarbete med drivna och engagerade kollegor
* möjlighet att bidra till förbättrad vård och forskning.


 Självklart får du också ta del av våra generella förmåner som Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset erbjuder dig.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Karolinska Universitetslaboratoriet har en regional biobank under uppbyggnad som ska stödja biobanking av hälso- och sjukvårdens och forskningens prover. Verksamheten står inför spännande utmaningar med att utveckla effektiva processer och hitta nya lösningar för service samt utveckla modern IT-arkitektur för att stödja verksamheten.
   

  

 Karolinska Universitetslaboratoriets uppdrag är att samla in prover från samtliga vårdgivare som verkar inom landstingets hälso- och sjukvård och att i regionen samordna provhantering och lagring av alla humana prover som lagras och som kan knytas till en enskild individ. Syftet är att göra alla prover jämförbara och tillgängliga för vård och forskning genom att höja kvaliteten på insamlade prover och data, införa gemensamma processer, gemensam databas för provdata och nya miljö- och arbetsmiljövänliga arbetssätt med höggradig automation. På detta sätt kommer Biobanken att bidra till bättre vård och stärkt klinisk forskning och att vara en länk mellan hälso- och sjukvården, forskningen och näringslivet. SMB kommer genom att öka kvaliteten, tillgängligheten och volymen av högkvalitativa provsamlingar göra Stockholm till en attraktiv Life science region.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en Systemutvecklare/Systemspecialist till enheten Systemförvaltning LAB på Karolinskas IT-avdelning. Enheten består av cirka 24 personer fördelat på förvaltare och systemspecialister.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att vara en nyckelperson i en förvaltning som driver utvecklingen av IT-strukturen för biobanking inom Stockholmsregionen. Du kommer att ha en central roll i vidareutvecklingen av våra internt utvecklade webbapplikationer samt ansvara för drift och vidareutveckling av verksamhetens LIMS-system (LabWare), ett IT-system som används för lagerhållning av prover samt för automation och robotteknik.
   

  

 Arbetet innebär ett nära samarbete med både verksamhet och forskning och omfattar hela utvecklingskedjan – från behovskartläggning och kravinsamling till design, utveckling, implementation, test, produktionssättning samt löpande support och förvaltning.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
* är strukturerad samt mål- och resultatorienterad
* trivs med att arbeta självständigt och tar ansvar för att initiera, driva och slutföra projekt och uppdrag enligt uppsatt tidplan
* har god samarbetsförmåga och trivs med utmaningar och problemlösning
* arbetar på ett kreativt sätt och är van vid att hantera flera parallella uppgifter
* är positiv, lyhörd och serviceorienterad med ett professionellt förhållningssätt i ditt arbete.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet för tjänsten.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* För uppdraget relevant utbildning
* Bred IT-teknisk kompetens
* Minst tre års erfarenhet av systemutveckling i Microsoft-miljö
* Minst tre års erfarenhet av SQL, främst MS T-SQL
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* Förståelse för systemintegrationer
* Grundläggande kunskap inom nätverk och IT-säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av teknisk systemdrift av webbapplikationer
* Vana av följande språk/applikationer: Microsoft Server (IIS, Services, FW, Powershell), Nätverksförståelse, SQL Server (SSMS), T-SQL (Script, Funktioner, Procedurer), Visual Studio 201x, C# .NET, MVC arkitektur, Angular, Web API och Git


**Meriterande**
* Kunskap om laboratorieverksamhet
* Kännedom om processorienterat arbetssätt, då vi arbetar enligt ITIL
* Erfarenhet av arbete i projektform
* Erfarenhet av arbete med IT-system, applikationer och kringutrustning inom Hälso- och Sjukvården.
* Erfarenhet av Labware LIMS och Visual Basic.


**Om rekryteringsprocessen**
 Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden.
   

  

 I vår rekryteringsprocess kan vi komma att använda oss av Assessios tester MAP och Matrigma. MAP är ett personlighetstest och Matrigma är ett icke-verbalt begåvningstest och båda bygger på arbetspsykologisk forskning. Testerna används som ett komplement till dina erfarenheter och kompetenser och syftet är att göra vår urvalsprocess kvalitetssäker och transparent.
   

  

 I samband med din ansökan behöver du bifoga CV. Istället för ett personligt brev ber vi dig besvara urvalsfrågor samt kort motivera varför du passar för rollen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan - Tillsammans är vi Karolinska!
   

  

 Inför tillsättning av befattning som innefattar vård av barn och ungdom, kontrolleras den som erbjuds tjänsten mot misstanke- och belastningsregistret. Här kan du läsa mer om rekryteringsprocessen och om vilka kontroller som utförs på Karolinska.
   

  

 Som anställd på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset kan du komma att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om vad det innebär här.
   

  

 Om du är eller tidigare har varit anställd i Region Stockholm kommer vi att ta interna referenser från din nuvarande eller tidigare chef, om du blir aktuell för anställning.
   

  

 För tillsvidaretjänster kan provanställning komma att tillämpas.
   

  

**Om Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset**
 Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.
   

  

 Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!
   

  

 Fackliga representanter
   

  

 Namn
   

  

 Vision
   

  

 Telefon
   

  

 vision.karolinska@regionstockholm.se

title: Regional Director - Franchising Business Opportunity
description:
**Regional Director** 

 –
 
***Franchising Business Opportunity***




**Company:** 


**The Alpha Group International (TAG)** 




**Location:** 

 Fully flexible — operate from
 
**any country or region** 




**Type:** 

 Long-term business partnership (investment involved)
 




  





**About The Alpha Group** 





 The Alpha Group International (TAG) has been operating for 11 years under
 
**Noble Manhattan Coaching** 

 , one of the world’s leading coaching and leadership organizations.
 




  





**Our purpose:** 





 Help SME business owners grow stronger, faster, and more confidently.
 





 We bring them together in confidential, expertly facilitated peer-to-peer advisory boards.
 





 TAG operates in 24+ countries—and we continue expanding globally.
 




  





**What Is a Peer-to-Peer Advisory Board?** 





 A small group of SME leaders meet once a month to:
 



* Share challenges openly
* Discuss solutions
* Make better strategic decisions
* Support each other’s growth




 As a
 
***Regional Director,***

 your role is to facilitate these sessions, guide discussions, and ensure each member receives real value.
 





 Once you establish the boards, your main commitment is one 6-hour meeting per board per month, giving you significant time freedom. You can run as many boards as you can with no limitation.
 




  





**Why Become a Regional Director?** 





 This is not a traditional 8–5 job.
 





 It is a flexible business opportunity for leaders who want to:
 



* Build and lead their own advisory boards
* Impact their local business community
* Enjoy schedule freedom
* Earn based on value and growth




 Many Regional Directors run multiple boards, enabling them to achieve significant monthly income while working far less than in a full-time role.
 





 You can also establish boards in any location — no limit of the region.
 




  





**What TAG Provides** 





 We are fully committed to supporting your success. You will receive:
 



* Training through Noble Manhattan Coaching
* Proven advisory board frameworks
* Marketing materials and branding support
* Continuous mentoring and guidance
* A global community of TAG leaders




 (Details regarding the investment and partnership structure are shared personally with interested candidates.)
 




  





**Who We’re Looking For** 





 This opportunity is ideal for professionals who:
 



* Have leadership or management experience
* Communicate clearly and build relationships easily
* Want to guide SME owners through real growth
* Value flexibility and long-term impact



  





**Why Now?** 





 Because SMEs need us — and we need you.
 





 Business owners everywhere face challenges they shouldn’t navigate alone. With your leadership, they can make better decisions and grow stronger companies.
 




  






 Interested in Learning More?
 





 If this resonates with you, simply apply through LinkedIn.
 





 You can also reach out directly:
 





 📩 abdulla.kaja@the-alpha-group.biz
 





 https://the-alpha-group.biz/
 




  





*Note: Please do not apply if you're seeking a salaried employed role*

title: Säkerhetsskyddsspecialist - informationssäkerhet
description:
**Vill du ta dig an en samhällsviktig uppgift? Vi söker en säkerhetsskyddsspecialist med möjlighet att välja primär inriktning.
