* Strong communication skills and proven experience in stakeholder management
* Excellent presentation skills, particularly in MS PowerPoint
* Experience with, or strong understanding of, financial services and banking
* Experience coordinating GDPR and compliance-related topics
* Experience working with ServiceNow
* Very good command of English, both spoken and written
* Fluent Swedish, both spoken and written (required)



  





**Meriting Qualifications** 



* Previous experience working with legal processes or Legal functions
* Experience from large organizations with complex IT landscapes

title: Junior Presales Engineer EMEA
description:
We are looking for a Junior Presales Engineer in the EMEA region to provide technical support to our customers as well as being the link into our Product Management and R&D. Are you the one we are looking for?
 



  





**Introduction** 




 Smartoptics provides innovative optical network solutions and devices for the new era of open networks, with a customer base including enterprises and public authorities, cloud providers, internet exchanges, as well as cable and telecom operators. Now, we are looking for a Junior Presales Engineer to support our optical devices business in EMEA. Are you the one we are looking for?
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As a Junior Presales Engineer you will be the go-to person for all technical solution support required by customers and our sales force. You will be the external link to our customers interfacing internally with our Product Management team, TAC Support team as well as the Production Team.
 



 As a Presales Engineer, you will work with the products in our Optical Devices and Transceiver portfolio that we develop together with leading manufacturing partners in the field. This role also involves participating in setting requirements, specifying, and qualifying products in the lab. The role involves international travelling focusing mostly on EMEA region, additional travel to US and Asia on occasion.
 



 You will work both in the office, out in the field and in a lab environment.
 



 You will manage details on coding for appropriate vendor support and understanding the different challenges with interop and verification of transceivers in network equipment, routers etc.
 



  





**About You** 




 To take on the role of Junior Presale Engineer, you need to be interested in technology and networking. As a person, you should have good communication skills, an eye for both detail and the bigger picture, strong self-motivation, and a genuine interest in learning more.
 



 You are early in your career or a recent graduate from a technical education, such as a bachelor's or master's degree in engineering physics, Optics, or another hardware-oriented engineering field, or from a Swedish Higher Vocational Education (Yrkeshögskolan) or Technical High School.
 



  





**You should have experience in the following areas:** 



* IT competence and networking skills
* IP Networking experience
* Working in a lab environment with instruments
* Hands on work with Routers and Switches



  





**Merits:** 



* Experience with telecom/networking products
* Experience with optical systems and optical instruments
* Experience of presales or other sales or product supporting function
* IP over DWDM experience



  





 To succeed in this role, you need self-drive and engagement. You should be curious and fearless. Proficiency in English is required, Swedish is commonly spoken in the office, learning it over time is encouraged.
 



  





**What We Offer** 




 At the Stockholm office, Smartoptics is gathered in one place. We have a culture of openness and involvement. If you thrive on a dynamic environment and love being involved in problem-solving, there’s a great chance you’ll enjoy working with us! We have an ambitious roadmap ahead and offer strong development opportunities for our employees.
 



  





**About Smartoptics** 




 Smartoptics is a Scandinavian company offering innovative fiber-optic network solutions and components for the new era of open networks. We solve technical challenges in networks to enhance our customers’ competitiveness. Smartoptics’ customer base today includes hundreds of companies, such as government clients, cloud providers, and cable and telecom operators. Smartoptics was founded in 2006 and has its headquarters in Oslo. The Stockholm office houses about 90 great colleagues, characterized by a culture of innovation and drive. Across the company, there are currently 140 employees. Our modern office is just a stone’s throw from the Kista subway station and the Helenelund commuter train station.

title: Patient Safety Manager - RayIntelligence & Machine Learning
description:
Are you motivated by ensuring that complex medical software is safe, reliable, and compliant with international standards? Do you have a strong interest in risk management and regulatory compliance, and want to play a key role in maintaining high-quality products? If so, this could be the role for you. As Patient Safety Manager, you will help ensure the safety, effectiveness, and regulatory compliance of our products throughout the entire product lifecycle.
   

  

**About RayIntelligence And Machine Learning At RaySearch Laboratories**
 RayIntelligence is a specialized platform developed by RaySearch Laboratories to provide intelligent support for oncology clinics. It assists clinical staff, such as physicians, physicists, and treatment planners, by offering data-driven insights and recommendations throughout the patient care process. In addition, RaySearch develops and integrates machine learning functionality across its products, to enhance treatment planning, decision support, and workflow optimization. Together, RayIntelligence and machine learning technologies aim to improve patient outcomes, streamline oncology workflows, and enable more efficient and personalized care.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a Patient Safety Manager for these areas, you will be responsible for identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks associated with both RayIntelligence and RaySearch’s machine learning solutions, ensuring their safe and effective use in clinical settings. Your responsibilities will span the entire product lifecycle, ensuring that risk management work is performed in accordance with relevant standards and regulations. You will collaborate closely with development teams in the Machine Learning department and contribute to risk management for integrations with RaySearch’s other products. In this role, you will be part of the RayIntelligence project management team. You will also collaborate with Patient Safety Managers from other development projects and with Product Cybersecurity Managers to ensure comprehensive risk mitigation.
   

  

**Your main tasks**
* Participate in project planning together with the project management team.
* Support the development team with risk management related tasks, e.g., ensuring that the risk management process is applied, taking part in design and risk analysis of new and changed functionality and ensuring that risks are appropriately mitigated and tested.
* Own and maintain the project’s risk management documentation, in compliance with relevant risk management standards and regulations.
* Handle post-market surveillance activities, such as patient safety issues and CAPA.


**Your profile**
 We are looking for someone who understands the importance of risk management in medical software and is motivated by working in this field with all the responsibilities it entails. You are responsible, meticulous, and structured, with a strong personal drive and the ability to work independently in a highly organized and efficient manner. You also bring a background in system development – not necessarily as a developer – but with sufficient technical understanding to navigate complex software environments and processes.
   

  

**Requirements**
* BSc or MSc degree in engineering, or equivalent.
* 3+ years’ experience in software development with complex products.
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English.


**Meriting**
* Experience from the medtech industry or other regulated or safety critical industries.
* Experience of device risk management
* Experience with product safety standard requirements for medical devices (IEC/ISO standards, e.g., ISO 14971).
* Leadership or project management experience.
* Experience as a system developer.


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization, where everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability to deliver exceptional results, pay close attention to detail, and consistently go the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in their field, driven by a relentless focus on solving problems - no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in leading the way in cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative solutions that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply to the position through the application form below. Selection and interviews will be ongoing. We do not accept applications by email.

title: SAC Solution Architect with a financial planning focus to Management Consulting, KPMG (Stockholm)
description:
Are you an experienced solution architect with deep expertise in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), passionate about financial planning and performance management and ready to deliver and shape transformative analytics solutions? Join KPMG’s Management Consulting and help leading organizations in Sweden shape the future of enterprise analytics!
   

  

**Your Role**
 We are seeking a SAC Solution Architect to join our Finance Transformation team in Stockholm. As part of our Management Consulting practice, you will collaborate with major Swedish corporations and organizations to design and deliver modern analytics solutions, drive digitalization, and support strategic decision-making.This role is a functional, business-driven position at the intersection of finance processes and modern technology.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to contribute to high-impact projects, work alongside senior stakeholders, and be part of a collaborative, high-performing, and purpose-driven team.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Oversee and execute SAC solution architecture, data modeling, and integrations of SAP and non-SAP environments
* Lead requirements workshops and process discussions with finance and business stakeholders
* Develop functional planning models, implement driver-based logic, and configure data flows to support accurate and efficient financial planning
* Together with business process experts design end-to-end SAC Planning solutions, including predictive scenarios and dashboards, to optimize business planning processes
* Drive governance, performance optimization, and best practices within analytics solutions
* Collaborate with technical teams to ensure accurate data integration and model performance
* Translate business needs into solution architecture, ensuring scalability and best-practice design. Partner with stakeholders to deliver scalable and robust analytics solutions
* Facilitate workshops to engage both business stakeholders and technical teams


 ,
   

  

**Relevant Experience And Knowledge**
* You have significant experience in business intelligence, analytics, or data warehousing, with at least 8 years in the field and a minimum of 3 years working directly with SAC
* You have strong understanding of FP&A, budgeting, forecasting, cost allocation, and performance management
* You have knowledge of planning best practices: scenario modelling, rolling forecasting, driver-based planning
* Basic knowledge in SAP BW, HANA Data Warehouse, Datasphere, and integration of complex systems
* You have demonstrated success in solution architecture, leadership of analytics initiatives and experience collaborating with cross-functional teams including finance, business, and technical stakeholders
* You have experience facilitating workshops with finance stakeholders and ability to translate business requirements into planning models, driver-based logic, workflows, and reporting structures


**Requirements**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Finance, Business, Engineering, or related field
* Minimum of 8 years’ experience in BI/Analytics/Data Warehousing, with at least 3 years in SAP Analytics Cloud
* Strong analytical and conceptual skills with the ability to design end-to-end planning processes
* Practical experience with SAC Planning or similar enterprise planning tools
* Strong business acumen and proven leadership in analytics projects
* Excellent communication and workshop facilitation skills
* Ability to operate cross-functionally across finance, business, and technical areas
* Fluency in English


**What We offer:**
* An exciting opportunity to work on different types of engagements across various industries
* An inspiring work environment where you are empowered to perform at your best
* An inclusive environment where diversity is one of our core foundations
* A flexible workplace, where work-life balance is a top priority
* Generous employee benefits package


 Want to make a difference together with us?
   

  

 Then you are warmly welcomed with your application. If you have any questions regarding the position, you are very welcome to contact our Head of Finance Transformation Victor Crona victor.crona@kpmg.se or responsible Talent Manager marie-louise.baath@kpmg.se or mobile +46 76 717 46 85.

title: Field Service Engineer (FTC)
description:
**Job Description Summary**
 Join our team as a Field Service Engineer, providing high‑quality technical support for BD Medication Management Solutions.
   

  

 This field/depot‑based role includes travel mainly across Sweden and the Nordic region to perform repairs, updates, and customer training. You will also handle remote troubleshooting and maintenance to minimize downtime and ensure excellent service. This is a fixed-term contract for at least 18 months, ideal for someone looking to kickstart their career or gain valuable experience with a global leader in the medtech industry.
   

  

 Our vision for MMS at BD
   

  

 With our technical capabilities, the Medication Management Solutions (MMS) team are able to manage multiple systems and our operational capabilities enable us to have medications available when and where needed, reducing inefficiency and waste for nursing and pharmacy teams.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are the makers of possible
   

  

 BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.
   

  

**Why join us?**
 A career at BD means learning and working alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. You will have the opportunity to help shape the trajectory of BD while leaving a legacy at the same time.
   

  

 To find purpose in the possibilities, we need people who can see the bigger picture, who understand the human story that underpins everything we do. We welcome people with the imagination and drive to help us reinvent the future of health. At BD, you’ll discover a culture in which you can learn, grow and thrive. And find satisfaction in doing your part to make the world a better place.
   

  

 Become a
 **maker of possible** 
 with us!
   

  

**Main Responsibilities Will Include**
* Provide on‑site technical support, including repairs, upgrades, and technical training for infusion and dispensing devices.
* Complete preventive maintenance, upgrades, and corrective actions within required timeframes.
* Maintain accurate service records in line with reporting and compliance guidelines.
* Maintain spare parts' inventory, ensuring readiness for service tasks by maintaining required tools and spare parts.
* Identify opportunities to improve customer satisfaction and communicate potential business growth areas.
* Adhere to all quality, safety, and compliance regulations while consistently delivering excellent service.
* Promote service contract, you will inform our customers about our range of technical services - such as maintenance contracts


**About You**
* Hold an engineering degree or possess extensive experience as a Field Service Engineer.
* Experience in the medical device industry is an advantage.
* Strong analytical and problem‑solving skills, with the ability to work independently.
* Skilled in performing corrective and preventive maintenance on technical equipment.
* Comfortable adapting to new technologies and a broad range of products.
* Highly customer‑focused, professional, and service‑oriented.
* Proficient in relevant IT systems and tools.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.
* Hold a valid driving license.


 Click on apply if this sounds like you!
   

  

 Becton, Dickinson and Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital or domestic or civil union status, familial status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, disability, military eligibility or veteran status, and other legally-protected characteristics.
   

  

 To learn more about BD visit: https://bd.com/careers

 Additional Locations

 At BD, we are strongly committed to investing in our associates—their well-being and development, and in providing rewards and recognition opportunities that promote a performance-based culture. We demonstrate this commitment by offering a valuable, competitive package of compensation and benefits programs which you can learn more about on our Careers Site under Our Commitment to You.

There are many factors, such as location, that contribute to the range displayed.

title: Senior Data Engineer till BROCC
description:
At BROCC, data drives every decision, from risk management to strategic growth. As a Senior Engineer, you will build and evolve our data platform from the ground up, turning complex data into trusted insights that power reporting, regulatory compliance, and smarter business decisions.
 



 You will work at the heart of a high-performing, innovative fintech company, in a small, senior and T-shaped team. This role combines hands-on technical work with strategic influence, giving you the opportunity to design scalable, future-proof data solutions while building a strong data culture across the organization.
 



  





**Work Description** 




 As Senior Data Engineer at Brocc, you will:
 


* Work with modern tech stack (snowflake, DBT, airflow, fivetran, AWS, kubernetes)in a broad role and collaborative environment, optimizing performance, scalability, and reliability across the data value chain, from raw ingestion to finished insights.
* Design, implement and maintain end-to-end ELT processes, develop clear and well-documented transformations and build business-critical data models to serve as the single source of truth.
* Collaborate with teams across finance, risk, operations and product to turn data needs into scalable, practical solutions. You will enable self-service analytics by providing well-structured datasets, documentation and shared definitions.
* Contribute to building a strong data culture with common standards and best practices and ensure high data quality, traceability, and consistent use of KPIs and metrics across the business.
* Be an integral part of a small, senior data team and take end-to-end responsibility of architecture, standards, and best practices, while remaining hands-on in implementation.
* Continuously identify opportunities to increase automation, efficiency, and performance.



  





**Your Profile** 




 We are looking for someone with:
 


* Several years of experience in data engineering, analytics engineering, and BI development.
* A deep technical expertise combined with broad understanding of how data, technology, and business interconnect.
* Strong SQL skills and several years of experience with dimensional and relational data modeling.
* A deep understanding of data orchestration, ingestion and transformation, and related tools.
* Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Synapse or Databricks).
* A self-motivated and solution-oriented contributor, with a structured approach who shares knowledge and lifts both team and across the business.
* The ability to translate complex data concepts into clear insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.



  





 It is a strong plus with experience from regulated industries (fintech, banking, financial services) and an understanding of compliance and regulatory reporting.
 



  





**About BROCC** 




 Brocc was founded in 2016 as a Stockholm based fintech specialized in peer-to-peer lending. We have since then transitioned into an established, pan-European niche bank within consumer lending and debt management. We are active in 15+ markets across Europe, and have offices in Sweden, Finland and UK.
 



  





 We aim to build a stronger European ecosystem through transparent, data-driven, and fair financial solutions. Read more: www.brocc.se
 



  





**Apply now!** 




 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Recruitment is handled in collaboration with Inhouse IT & Tech. Selection is ongoing, so don’t wait! Apply directly via www.inhouse.se.
 



 For questions, contact recruitment consultant Louise Hagen Furugård at louise.furugard@inhouse.se or 073-311 87 26.

title: B2B Content Lead (Global) till Vaimo
description:
**Are you a senior content marketer who wants to own the strategy, set the direction, spot the opportunities and build something meaningful at scale?** 




  





**At Vaimo you’ll be trusted to define what great B2B content looks like, challenge conventional B2B thinking and create marketing that is genuinely compelling and delivers results. We believe the best work comes from people who are confident in what should work but curious enough to test, learn and iterate. Trial and error is encouraged here. You’ll have the support of the rest of the marketing team and skilled content writers – meaning actual time for strategic thinking.** 




  





**Is it you? Let's talk!** 




  





  





**About us** 




 Vaimo is one of the world’s most respected experts in digital commerce and customer experiences. For us, experience is everything. It is at the heart of all we do, and we are leading the way in delivering on it in these fields:
 


* Digital Commerce
* Content Management
* Data Management
* Insights & Activation



  





 As a full-service digital experience agency, we deliver consulting, design, development, support, and analytics services within all four fields.
 



  





 We are a global partner with a local presence, focused on cultivating close, long-term relationships with our clients. We work with brands, retailers, manufacturers, and organizations all over the world and are based in offices in more than 15 markets across EMEA, APAC, and North America.
 



  





 The B2B Content Lead sits internally within the organisation and you will be part of our global marketing team, working closely with stakeholders across marketing, sales, consulting and leadership to ensure our content reflects real customer needs and commercial priorities. Reporting directly to the Global Head of Marketing.
 



  





  





**About the job** 




 As our B2B Content Lead you will shape how Vaimo communicate our value, expertise and point of view to decision-makers across all our markets.
 



  





 You will own our global B2B content strategy end-to-end, ensuring every message is insight-led, audience-driven and designed to build trust, demand and long-term relationships across the full funnel.
 



  





**Your responsibilities** 



* Own, develop and evolve Vaimo's global B2B content strategy and tone of voice across all our marketing channels
* Ensure messaging is clear, compelling and conversion-focused - without sounding like generic B2B
* Plan, lead and execute B2B content marketing projects end-to-end, with strong project management ownership
* Operate close to the business, balancing strategic direction with hands-on execution
* Track, measure, optimize and report on content performance, insights, learnings and next steps
* Lead the way by showing “this is what good looks like”
* Explore and leverage AI and emerging technologies as a natural part of content strategy, creation and optimization, with a continuous focus on efficiency, quality and performance.



  





  





**About you** 




 You bring structure, momentum and trust and enjoy building clarity where things are not fully defined from the start.
 



  





 You combine strategic thinking with a strong ability to execute. You take ownership, own your decisions, and care deeply about creating marketing that people actually value and content that actually performs.
 



  





**You bring solid experience in:** 



* B2B content strategy and content operations but at the same time comfortable challenging traditional B2B thinking
* Conversion-driven approach, translating business goals into measurable content initiatives
* Wide understanding of content formats and how to systematically repurpose and scale content
* How to build content that supports SEO, AI discoverability and long-term authority
* Understanding of psychological factors in marketing
* Leading cross-functional projects with multiple stakeholders
* Data analysis, measurement, and insight-led optimisation
* Working full funnel, with a clear focus on what drives results
* Working closely with sales and operations to turn real customer, deal and delivery insights into content



  





**You’ll thrive in this role if you:** 



* Are analytical by nature and motivated by improving performance over time
* Have a strong ability to defend the client perspective: what is genuinely interesting, relevant and valuable to the client



  





 We work with modern tools that enable content marketing at scale (HubSpot, Contentful, Figma), so previous experience with these platforms is a plus.
 



  





 You communicate fluently in Swedish and English and are comfortable presenting in a senior, international setting.
 



  





 As a person, you are proactive, solution-oriented, and take clear ownership of what you commit to.
 



  





  





**What’s in it for you?** 




 You’ll take on a senior role with real influence over how Vaimo communicate with the market, and the mandate to improve how we connect with customers globally.
 



  





 You’ll work in an international organisation where marketing and content are taken seriously — expected to drive real commercial impact, not just visibility — and where your recommendations will shape decisions.
 



  





 The role is based in Stockholm, with a flexible way of working that allows you to manage your time in a way that supports both performance and balance.
 



  





 You’ll join a collaborative, global team that values ownership, quality, and accountability, and takes pride in strong client relationships.
 



  





 For employees based in Sweden, we offer a competitive benefits package including health benefits, pension, 30 days of vacation, and opportunities to connect with colleagues locally and internationally.
 



  





***We look forward to welcoming you to our global marketing team!***




  





  





**Application and recruitment process** 




 This assignment is managed by our trusted executive search partner, WOOW Executive Search, specialising in recruitment within digital marketing, marketing, sales, analytics and martech – from junior roles to C-level and leadership positions. For further questions and interest please contact Anton (anton@woowes.com) or Lisa (lisa@woowes.com).
 



  





 Due to GDPR regulations, we only process applications submitted via the designated application link for this position.

title: Controller
description:
Vill du bidra till att lösa en av vår tids största samhällsutmaningar? Trivs du i en miljö som präglas av handlingskraft och samhällsengagemang? Utbetalningsmyndigheten är en innovativ myndighet under utveckling. Genom att jobba hos oss får du vara med och forma en verksamhet som upptäcker, förhindrar och förebygger felaktiga utbetalningar och välfärdsbrott. Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats där du får stort ansvar och mandat att påverka. Hos oss gör din kompetens och ditt engagemang skillnad.
   

  

 Ansvar och arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som controller på Utbetalningsmyndigheten får du en viktig roll i myndighetens arbete med ekonomi- och verksamhetsstyrning. Du arbetar verksamhetsnära och stöttar chefer inom både kärnverksamhet och stödverksamhet i det löpande arbetet med budget- och verksamhetsplanering, uppföljning och analys. Du blir en del av en centralt placerad funktion som idag består av två controllers och en redovisningsekonom. Du arbetar nära dina kollegor och ni ger och får stöd av varandra. Då funktionen är relativt ny blir en viktig del av uppdraget att vara med och bygga upp och utveckla arbetssätt och strukturer inom controllerområdet.
   

  

 Följande arbetsområden ingår:
   

  

* Verksamhetsplanering, budgetering och prognostisering
* Uppföljning och analys av verksamhet och ekonomi
* Hantering av anläggningstillgångar
* Uppföljning av externa samverkansparter och leverantörer
* Framtagning och beredning av olika beslutsunderlag
* Medverka till ständiga förbättringar av arbetssätt och processer
* Vid behov vara backup för controllerkollegor


 Rollen är placerad vid enheten för verksamhetsstöd som hör till den administrativa avdelningen. Administrativa avdelningen ansvarar även för HR, inköp, arkiv och registratur, samt lokalförsörjning inklusive internservice och växel.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

* Akademisk utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant för tjänsten
* Minst tre års aktuell erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som controller
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med ekonomi i staten
* Goda kunskaper i Office-paketet och vana att arbeta i Excel
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska


 Det är meriterande om du även har
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att driva eller delta i större utvecklingsarbete
* Erfarenhet av extern samverkan
* Erfarenhet av att stötta it-nära verksamhet
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i Unit4 Business World (UBW)
* Genomgått Statens controllerutbildning hos ESV eller motsvarande


 Efterfrågade förmågor och färdigheter
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen som controller behöver du ha hög personlig mognad och gott omdöme. Du behöver även vara strukturerad, initiativtagande och självgående. Vidare behöver du ha god samarbetsförmåga och pedagogisk insikt.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 Tjänstgöringsorten är i Stockholm. Myndigheten finns i moderna lokaler i närheten av Gullmarsplan. Befattningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass vilket kräver svenskt medborgarskap. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Anställningen inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Du kan komma att krigsplaceras på myndigheten.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter att alla medarbetare ska ha en hållbar arbetsmiljö och balans mellan jobb och fritid. Vi erbjuder många förmåner för dig som anställd.
   

  

 Förmåner på UBM
   

  

 I denna rekrytering söker du med ditt CV. Istället för att bifoga ett personligt brev vill vi att du svarar på några frågor kring din kompetens kopplat till jobbet. Vi ber dig svara utförligt på dessa frågor. Arbetsprov samt arbetspsykologiska tester kan bli aktuellt i urvalsprocessen.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?**
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten, så kan du kontakta enhetschef Anna Forsberg på telefon 010-5727580. Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet, men tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner för de fackliga organisationerna är: Anna Frängsmyr (Saco-S) 010-572 75 78, Mattias Kollberg (Seko) 010-482 17 59 och Michael Ohlsson (ST) 010-572 75 12.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2026/4 | Kontakt: Anna Forsberg enhetschef 010-5727580, | Publicerat: 2026-02-09 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2026-03-04

title: Internrevisor
description:
Inera är ett digitaliseringsbolag som bidrar till att utveckla välfärden. Vi är Sveriges digitala ingång till hälsa, vård och omsorg och utvecklar digital infrastruktur för en sammanhållen välfärd. Vi arbetar på uppdrag av kommuner och regioner. Vår vision är världens mest innovativa och omtänksamma välfärd.
 



  





 I rollen som senior internrevisor på Inera får du en central roll i att stödja styrelse och ledning i arbetet med att uppnå verksamhetens mål. Genom analyser, insikter och förbättringsförslag bidrar du till att stärka intern styrning och kontroll och regelefterlevnad. Du blir en nyckelperson i uppbyggnaden och vidareutvecklingen av Ineras internrevision, vilket ger dig stora möjligheter att påverka både arbetssätt och innehåll i rollen.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Rollen som internrevisor är både strategisk och operativ och ger dig möjlighet att arbeta nära verksamheten såväl som ledning och styrelse.
 



 Operativt ansvar innebär att du:
 


* planerar och genomför internrevisioner och granskningar.
* agerar rådgivande stöd till verksamheten i frågor som rör intern kontroll, risker och regelefterlevnad
* bidrar till internrevisions arbete med riskanalys, revisionsplanering, metodutveckling och omvärldsbevakning.



 Strategiskt ansvar innebär att du:
 


* medverkar i det långsiktiga arbetet med att utveckla och stärka Ineras interna styrning och kontroll
* bidrar till att verksamheten kontinuerligt förbättra sin regelefterlevnad



  





 Internrevisionen är idag en liten och sammansvetsad funktion, vilket ger dig stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att påverka hur arbetet drivs. Målet är att utgöra ett bra stöd för våra verksamheter likväl som styrelsen i att utöva sitt ansvar, att revisionsarbete leder till förbättringar av Ineras interna styrning och kontroll samt att internrevisionen uppfattas som professionell och värdeskapande.
 



 Internrevisionsfunktionen består idag av två revisorer. Funktionen befinner sig i en utvecklingsfas med ambitionen att under 2026 bli en bolagsövergripande internrevisionsfunktion.
 



 Tillsammans med din chef, chef för Juridik och Säkerhet tillika Ineras chefsjurist, arbetar du med att utveckla internrevisionsfunktionens långsiktiga inriktning, processer och metodik.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Vi söker dig som:
 


* har relevant akademisk utbildning inom ekonomi/ samhällsvetenskap/juridik/ statsvetenskap/systemvetenskap eller annat område som vi bedömer relevant
* har flerårig erfarenhet från att ha arbetat som revisor med internrevision
* har goda kunskaper om intern styrning och kontroll eller ledning och styrning av organisationer
* flerårig erfarenhet från att ha arbetat med internrevision kopplat till någon av standarderna ISO 9001, ISO 13485 eller ISO 27001.



 Det är meriterande om du:
 


* arbetat med revision inom det medicintekniska området.
* har erfarenhet av ramverk gällande intern styrning och kontroll, riskhantering, it- eller informationssäkerhet
* har erfarenhet från arbete inom regionstyrd internrevision eller från internrevision inom kommunen/SKR
* CeCQI och IRCA-certifierad utbildning (CQI (Chartered Quality Institute) and IRCA (International Register of Certificated Auditors



  





**Varaktighet och tillträde** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Intervjuer kommer ske löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstidens slut.
 



  





**Frågor om rollen?** 




 Bechir Eklund, Chefsjurist, bechir.eklund@inera.se
 



*Fackliga frågor (Vision), Monica Rosén,* 
 monica.rosen@inera.se

title: Junior konsult med erfarenhet CFO Advisory I Financial Services | Stockholm
description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.
   

  

 We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.
   

  

 Join EY and help to build a better working world.
   

  

**Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär inom CFO Advisory?**
 EY Financial Services söker dig med erfarenhet inom ekonomi, finans eller rådgivning som vill utveckla CFO Advisory inom bank, försäkring och kapitalförvaltning. Hos oss får du bidra med din kompetens och utvecklas i en dynamisk miljö nära våra kunder.
   

  

**Möjligheten:**
 Vår vision är att vara den främsta partnern för ledare i finanssektorn och stötta dem i att hantera förändringar som påverkar redovisnings-, finans- och riskfunktioner. Branschen genomgår en snabb transformation – med ökad digitalisering, förändrade regelverk och ett skifte från CFO till CVO (Chief Value Officer), där fokus ligger på att skapa värde.
   

  

 Som konsult hos oss får du:
   

  

* En bred roll där du bidrar med engagemang och ansvar i våra kundteam.
* Möjlighet att utveckla specialistkompetens inom våra fokusområden.
* Bygga ett starkt professionellt nätverk.


 Vi erbjuder en fokuserad yrkesmiljö och rådgivning till ledande företag inom bank, försäkring och asset management. Här får du unika möjligheter att utvecklas och anta utmaningar i en professionell miljö i framkant av finanssektorn.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden:**
 Du arbetar med centrala frågor för finans- och riskavdelningar i svenska och europeiska företag, ofta i internationella team med kollegor från Norden och Europa. Dessutom får du tillgång till seminarier och kurser som stärker din konsult- och branschkompetens.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer för tjänsten**
* 2-3+ års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Masterexamen eller högre inom relevant område
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


**Egenskaper för att lyckas i rollen**
* Starka analytiska färdigheter och förmåga att lösa problem på ett strukturerat sätt
* Intresse för att arbeta i och driva projekt
* God förmåga att bygga förtroende och relationer samt trivs med att arbeta i team
* Proaktiv, nyfiken och självgående
* Energi, engagemang och mod att leda samt utmana etablerade arbetssätt


**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
* Kontinuerligt lärande: Du utvecklar tankesätt och färdigheter som hjälper dig att navigera in i framtiden.
* Framgång så som du definierar den: Vi ger dig verktygen och flexibiliteten, så att du kan göra skillnad på ditt sätt.
* Transformativt ledarskap: Vi ger dig insikter, coachning och självförtroende för att bli den ledare som världen behöver.
* Inkluderande kultur: Du kommer att accepteras för den du är och få möjlighet att använda din röst för att hjälpa andra att hitta sin.


 Läs gärna mer om vad EY kan erbjuda dig på Karriärsidan, i sociala medier och på Karriärbloggen.
   

  

**Är du redo att ”Shape your future with confidence”?** 
**Ansök idag.**
 Välkommen att söka tjänsten! Vänligen skicka in din ansökan senast den
 **15 februari 2026** 
 . Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Vid frågor gällande tjänsten, kontakta Martina Policastro på Martina.Policastro@se.ey.com. Vid frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta Adrian Lyng på Adrian.Lyng@se.ey.com. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
 *Observera att en bakgrundskontroll kommer att genomföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.*
 På EY främjar vi en inkluderande miljö och värdesätter olikheter. Vi uppmuntrar ansökningar från kandidater med olika bakgrunder och strävar efter en rättvis rekryteringsprocess. Vid behov av stöd eller anpassningar, kontakta vårt rekryteringsteam på recruitmentsweden@se.ey.com.
   

  

**EY | Building a better working world**
 EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.
   

  

 Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.
   

  

 EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

title: Domänarkitekt med huvudinriktning Analys och Data
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens infrastruktur för dataanalys för Sveriges Riksbank i rollen som domänarkitekt? Du kommer leda arbete med målarkitekturen för din domän, driva teknisk utveckling och skapa moderna, skalbara lösningar i en hybridmiljö med hög teknisk mognad. Här får du ett stort handlingsutrymme, inflytande i strategiskt viktiga beslut och chansen att bidra direkt till ett samhällsviktigt uppdrag.* 




  





 Riksbanken är Sveriges centralbank med uppdrag att säkerställa låg och stabil inflation, att det finansiella systemet fungerar effektivt och att betalningar kan genomföras säkert. Som en samhällsbärande myndighet är vi en nyckelspelare i svensk ekonomi.
 



  





 Som
 **Domänarkitekt** 
 får du en avgörande och ledande roll i att driva den tekniska transformationen genom ändamålsenlig målarkitektur och etablerande av nästa generations lösningar med mål att förbättra Riksbankens analysförmågor. Du kommer agera i rollen som domänarkitekt för ett eller flera verksamhetsområden där du är med och driver förändringsarbete för att skapa Riksbankens framtida lösningar.
 



  





 På Riksbanken arbetar vi i en modern containeriserad hybridmiljö som kombinerar on-premise och molntjänster. Några av applikationer som vi använder oss av inom dataområdet är LakeFS, MinIO, Dagster, Jupyter och OpenMetadata. Arbetssättet inom området bygger på en hög grad av decentralisering där centrala plattformsteam skapar förutsättningar för tekniskt kompetenta team i olika delar av organisationen. Vi är öppna för nya tekniska lösningar och strävar efter att snabbt kunna utveckla och lansera nya förmågor.
 



  





**DET HÄR GÖR DU HOS OSS** 




 Vi är på en resa där du har alla möjligheter att påverka och forma hur vi bygger upp alltifrån arbetssätt till utformningen av vårt framtida IT-landskap.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Leda arbetet med att kontinuerligt vidareutveckla och implementera analys- och dataområdets målarkitektur
* Arbeta nära verksamheten för att fortsätta utveckla organisationen för dataanalys och ta fram datalösningar med hög grad av självhjälp för kodande ekonomer och analytiker
* Medverka i styrningen av relevanta verksamhetsområden
* Översätta organisationens behov till fungerande lösningar och leda krav- och lösningsworkshoppar
* Samverka internt med verksamhet, utvecklingsteam och förvaltningsorganisation samt externt i relevanta forum med andra myndigheter och internationella organ
* Säkerställa att IT strategi, styrande principer och riktlinjer för IT-arkitektur efterlevs och kontinuerligt utvecklas
* Jobba på strategisk-, taktisk- och operativ nivå
* Omvärldsbevaka inom området



  





**DITT TEAM** 




 Riksbankens IT-avdelning leds av en IT-chef/CIO och består av sex enheter som leds av varsin enhetschef. Du tillhör Enheten för Säkerhet och Arkitektur där du kommer arbeta nära andra domänarkitekter, lösningsarkitekter, informationsarkitekter och IT-säkerhetsarkitekter.
 



  





**MER OM DIG** 




 Du har förmåga till helhetssyn och genuint intresse för hur IT kan användas för att stödja verksamhetsbehov samt är van att arbeta med lösningsalternativ. Du har erfarenhet av att omsätta kunskap till praktisk tillämpning med fokus på framdrift, realisering, återanvändbarhet och kostnadseffektivitet.
 



  





 Krav
 


* Du har mångårig erfarenhet som lösningsarkitekt inom främst open source-baserade dataplattformar och datasjöar med både on-premise och moln som distributionsmodell
* Du har flera års praktisk erfarenhet av programmering
* Har flera års erfarenhet av arkitekturarbete i agil kontext såväl som i traditionella förändringsprojekt
* Kan bra svenska och engelska både i tal och skrift
* Utbildning inom exempelvis datavetenskap, systemvetenskap alternativt annan relevant utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig



  





 Meriterande
 


* Erfarenhet av kravställning mot leverantörer
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med förvaltningsorganisationer
* Erfarenhet av att jobba i en myndighet
* Certifiering som lösningsarkitekt, domänarkitekt, verksamhetsarkitekt, IT-arkitekt eller motsvarande



  





 Du är initiativtagande samt mål- och resultatinriktad. Du är positiv, drivande och strukturerad och bra på att lösa komplexa problem. Du är van att leda workshops, dokumentera och presentera. Du har en god samarbetsförmåga och trivs att arbeta tillsammans med andra mot ett gemensamt mål. Du har också en mycket god kommunikationsförmåga. Du kan diskutera tekniska frågeställningar och lösningar både med tekniska specialister och med personer utan teknisk kunskap.
 



  





**MER OM TJÄNSTEN** 




**Tillträde:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



**Anställningstyp:** 
 Tillsvidareanställning
 



**Placering:** 
 Huvudkontoret på Brunkebergstorg samt HK Klara Klarabergsgatan, mitt i centrala Stockholm
 



**Arbetstid:** 
 Förtroendearbetstid
 



**Möjlighet att jobba distans:** 
 upp till 2 dagar i veckan
 



**Förmåner** 
 : Generösa semestervillkor, löneväxling till pension, subventionerad lunch i personalmatsal, friskvårdsbidrag, subventionerad massage och tillgång till gym och ledarledda träningspass. Läs mer om våra förmåner
 **här** 
 .
 



 Tjänsten kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning innefattande registerkontroll, säkerhetsprövningssamtal och särskild personutredning görs då för slutkandidaten. För vissa tjänster ställs krav på svenskt medborgarskap.
 



  





**ANSÖK** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Riksbanken med rekryteringsföretaget ComputerSweden Recruitment. Deras rekryterare gör ett första urval i samråd med rekryterande chef samt utför intervjuer. De kandidater som går vidare träffar sedan rekryterande chef.
 



  





**Vid frågor** 
 är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Britta Liljegren, rekryteringskonsult på 070-771 18 11,
 **britta.liljegren@csrecruitment.se** 
 eller Alexandra Tihinen, rekryteringskonsult, på 070-447 92 24 eller

 .
 



  





 Vi vill ha din ansökan senast

 . Logiska tester och arbetsprov kan komma att ingå som en del av rekryteringsprocessen. Vi genomför också bakgrundskontroller på slutkandidaterna, vilket innebär att du lämnar in examensbevis eller annat dokument som styrker din utbildning och vi kontrollerar att dessa stämmer.
 



  





 Du kan läsa mer om hur det fungerar när du söker jobb på Riksbanken

 . Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Supplier Accountant
description:
We are looking for a driven Supplier Accountant. You will be part of the Accounts Payable team, which consists of 8 people divided into four teams in Sweden, Denmark, the UK and the Netherlands. Accounts Payable is part of Northern Europe's finance department, which has 65 people. The role will focus on Swedish properties (Mall of Scandinavia, Westfield Taby Centrum and Nacka Forum). The position is based in Stockholm and starts immediately.
 



  





**Key objectives** 




 To ensure accurate, timely, and efficient management of accounts payable processes for Swedish properties (Mall of Scandinavia, Westfield Täby Centrum, and Nacka Forum), while fostering strong supplier relationships, driving process harmonisation across Northern Europe, and contributing to the successful transition to SAP S/4 HANA. The Supplier Accountant will play a pivotal role in maintaining financial integrity, supporting operational excellence, and enabling continuous improvement within the regional finance team.
 



  





**What you will be doing…** 



* Manage accounts payable for assigned shopping centres or management companies
* Provide on‑site financial support by working regularly from our centres
* Record and reconcile bank transactions accurately
* Process invoices, including manual handling when required
* Support month‑end closing, reconciliations, and reporting
* Handle payment reminders and follow‑ups with suppliers
* Act as a key contact for supplier queries and relationships
* Contribute to process improvements and system development, including SAP S/4 HANA transition
* Participate in regional projects to harmonise accounts payable processes.



  





**What skills, experience, and knowledge will you need to be successful?** 



* Good knowledge of SAP (S4 / HANA)
* Good skills in Excel
* 3 - 5 years of relevant work experience
* Meticulous and detail-oriented with the ability to work towards deadlines
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written
* Experience working in a larger, global company is a plus
* Accounting knowledge is a plus but not required



  





**Who are we?** 




 At Unibail-Rodamco-Westfield (URW), we develop and operate a portfolio of sustainable, premium, mixed-use real estate assets across Europe and the United States. Driven by our purpose to Reinvent Being Together, we are committed to accelerating urban regeneration and rethinking how we live together in cities. Today, 2,000 dedicated individuals are working together to reshape the future of real estate and shopping centres by creating innovative, engaging spaces that truly redefine community connections.
 



  





 Our flagship destinations are more than just places; they're the heartbeat of the community. We empower our employees to make a real impact through volunteering, DE&I programs, and leading ESG efforts. URW is at the forefront of experiential entertainment, constantly pushing boundaries to craft unforgettable in-person and digital experiences. By surprising and delighting our customers, we create magical moments and reinvent togetherness in every interaction.
 



  





 Within our Northern Europe Region - spanning the Netherlands, Denmark, Sweden, and the UK - we own and manage eight exceptional assets. These include Westfield Mall of the Netherlands, Stadshart Amstelveen, Westfield London, and Westfield Stratford City.
 



  





**As an international company, our primary internal language is English. Therefore, we kindly ask that you submit your application and resume in English.** 




  





**Why work for us:** 




 We put people's development and learning at the heart of what we do. We'll help you master your role, build your technical skills, and take advantage of top-notch management and leadership programs. From face-to-face workshops to our global online learning resources, we encourage you to make learning a part of your daily routine.
 



  





 We offer a fantastic bonus scheme, and many other incentives, including company health insurance is available at a reduced tariff.
 



  





 Want to know more about what it's like working at URW? Visit our site
 
 https://www.urw.com/join-us/life-at-urw
 




  





**What Matters to Us:** 




 At URW, our purpose is to
 **Reinvent Being Together** 
 , reimagining how people and communities connect, socialise, and experience dynamic moments in unique and meaningful ways.
 



  





 We are proud to promote equal opportunities and embrace diversity in profiles, experiences, and skills. At URW, we believe that diversity is the cornerstone of our success, and we are dedicated to fostering an environment that respects, values, celebrates, and leverages individual differences to their fullest potential.
 



  





 We evaluate each application with fairness and without discrimination based on disability, age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected characteristics. Our commitment is to provide equal access to our services for everyone. If you require any adjustments for your interview, please let us know in advance, so we can support you accordingly.
 



  





 As part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and trustworthy working environment, we conduct comprehensive security checks on all employees prior to their start date. These checks may include identity verification, employment history, and criminal record screening, in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.
 



  





**Join us and be part of a team that's making a real difference in your local communities!**

title: Business Development Manager GCC - Server, Storage & Network
description:
**Business Development Manager GCC - server, storage & network**
 Brinner du för försäljning och älskar att skapa affärer som gör skillnad? Då har du chansen att ta nästa steg i din karriär hos TD SYNNEX - en global ledare inom IT-distribution.
   

  

 Rollen
   

  

 Som Business Development Manager för GCC (Global Computing Components) kommer du ingå i ett nordiskt team och blir en nyckelspelare i att driva vår försäljning i både Sverige och Norden. Du får möjlighet att arbeta med några av världens mest innovativa varumärken - Intel, AMD, Nvidia, Supermicro, Micron, Seagate och många fler.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du primärt att arbeta med områdena sever, storage och nätverk. Några av arbetsuppgifterna är:
   

* Proaktivt driva försäljningen av GCCs produktportfölj genom daglig kontakt med kunder
* Identifiera potentiella kunder och affärsmöjligheter
* Bygga relationer med kunder, tillverkare och andra team inom TD SYNNEX
* Planera och genomföra marknadsaktiviteter och go-to-market initiativ tillsammans med tillverkare
* Delta i försäljningsaktiviteter, evenemang och utbildningar


 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är duktig på att skapa goda relationer och tar ett starkt ägendeskap för din affär. Som person måste du gilla att arbeta självständigt, du är ansvarsfull, strukturerad och sätter ambitiösa mål. Du ser värdet i att samarbeta och gillar att bygga relationer med partners och kollegor.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig med de rätta kvalifikationerna ett jobb i ett internationellt företag där ingen dag är den andra lik. Om det låter spännande med ett företag som präglas av högt tempo i en spännande marknad och har engagerade kollegor, är TD SYNNEX en attraktiv arbetsplats för dig. För rätt person finns det goda möjligheter att utvecklas både hos oss lokalt men även inom våra internationella team.
   

  

 Vi är stolta över att vara certifierade som A Great Place to Work, och har en grupp som heter Elevate med kollegor i Norden med fokus på könsmångfald. Dessutom arbetar vi aktivt med mångfald. Vi fokuserar på karriärutveckling och som en nordisk och global organisation har vi kollegor som nyligen har flyttat från lokala till nordiska roller som en del av karriären inom TD SYNNEX.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder också
   

* Konkurrenskraftig ersättning med regelbundna årliga löneöversyner.
* Hybridarbete - (3 dagar på kontoret, 2 dagar hemma)
* Vi värdesätter kontinuerligt lärande och erbjuder en tydlig utvecklingsplan.
* Omfattande förmåner, inklusive sjukförsäkring, betald ledighet, pensionsplaner och mer


 Ansökan och om du vill veta mer
   

  

 Skicka ditt CV via länken. Vi vill ha tjänsten tillsatt så snart som möjligt och ansökningarna behandlas därför löpande.
   

  

 Kom och bli en del av oss!
   

  

 TD SYNNEX hanterar rekryteringsprocessen själv och vill inte ha kontakt med rekryteringsbyråer.
   

  

  

  

  

  

**Key Skills**
 At TD SYNNEX, our values guide everything we do: Together, We Own It, We Dare to Go, We Grow and Win, and above all, We Do the Right Thing. These principles shape how we work with each other, our partners, and our communities as we drive innovation and create lasting impact.
   

  

**What's In It For You?**
* **Elective Benefits:** 
 Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
* **Grow Your Career:** 
 Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
* **Elevate Your Personal Well-Being:** 
 Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
* **Diversity, Equity & Inclusion:** 
 It's not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
* **Make the Most of our Global Organization** 
 : Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
* **Connect with Your Community:** 
 Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.


**Don't meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.**
 At TD SYNNEX, we're proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you're excited about working for our company and believe you're a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we're looking for!

title: Medical Education & Training Manager Nordics - Aesthetics
description:
Galderma is the emerging pure-play dermatology category leader, present in approximately 90 countries. We deliver an innovative, science-based portfolio of premium flagship brands and services that span the full spectrum of the fast-growing dermatology market through Injectable Aesthetics, Dermatological Skincare and Therapeutic Dermatology. Since our foundation in 1981, we have dedicated our focus and passion to the human body's largest organ - the skin - meeting individual consumer and patient needs with superior outcomes in partnership with healthcare professionals. Because we understand that the skin, we are in shapes our lives, we are advancing dermatology for every skin story.
   

  

 We look for people who focus on getting results, embrace learning and bring a positive energy. They must combine initiative with a sense of teamwork and collaboration. Above all, they must be passionate about doing something meaningful for consumers, patients, and the healthcare professionals we serve every day. We aim to empower each employee and promote their personal growth while ensuring business needs are met now and into the future. Across our company, we embrace diversity and respect the dignity, privacy, and personal rights of every employee.
   

  

 At Galderma, we actively give our teams reasons to believe in our bold ambition to become the leading dermatology company in the world. With us, you have the ultimate opportunity to gain new and challenging work experiences and create an unparalleled, direct impact.
   

  

**At Galderma we’re unique and we embrace difference.** 
  

  

  

  

 Whether it’s the unique breadth of our integrated offering that covers Aesthetics, Consumer, and Prescription products; or our commitment to recognising and rewarding people for the contribution they make – working here isn’t like anywhere else.
   

  

  

  

 At Galderma, we actively give our teams reasons to believe in our ambition to become the leading dermatology company in the world. With us, you have the ultimate opportunity to gain new and challenging work experiences and create an unparalleled, direct impact.
   

  

  

  

**Medical Education & Training Manager Nordics - Aesthetics**
**Location:** 
 Based in Stockholm. Hybrid work model.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Responsible for the local strategy development and execution of GAIN (customer education and training activities). Activities are to be aligned with Nordic BU strategy and objectives and should be conducted in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders to ensure compliance with Galderma code of ethics and local and international standards and regulatory requirements for medical device, pharmaceuticals and cosmetic products.
   

  

  

  

**Key responsibilities** 
  

  

  

  

* Leads the GAIN ( Galderma Aesthetic Injector Network ) medical education strategy in the Nordics Including the creation of the yearly plan (TTT, masterclasses, workshops, peer-to-peer activities, congress participation) and translating global/regional guidance into local materials and needs.
* Develops and manages the Local Faculty of Trainers  Selects, coaches, and supports Nordic Trainers; builds development plans, and oversees their activities (briefings, demonstrations, hands-on workshops, anatomy masterclasses).
* Oversees planning, execution, and follow-up of all HCP training events  Ensures alignment with cross-functional teams (Marketing, Medical Affairs, Sales) and integrates Galderma IDS into local activities when possible.
* Builds strategic relationships and manages KOL engagement  Provides guidance to field teams on key KOLs to engage and develops strong cross-functional partnerships to maximize impact.
* Holds budget accountability and drives short-term operational impact  Manages the area’s budget, contributes to local commercial results, and develops 1–2-year operational plans for the function/job family.


  

  

**Skills And Qualifications**
  

  

* 8–10 years of experience in marketing, medical, or training roles, preferably within Aesthetics or Prescription businesses, with strong knowledge of the local industry landscape and KOL environment.
* Proven track record in leading and delivering educational and training events, including strong expertise in event management and marketing.
* Prior experience in the pharmaceutical or consumer healthcare industry, with the ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
* Strong influencing, communication, and collaboration skills, with the ability to partner effectively with key internal stakeholders and communicate complex topics clearly.
* Master’s degree, MBA, or equivalent, with LIF certification mandatory.
* Travel can be expected.

title: Konsult inom Pega – Bank & Försäkring
description:

 hjälper vi banker, försäkringsbolag och pensionsförvaltare att genomföra komplexa förändringsresor. Vi kombinerar djup branschkunskap inom bank, försäkring samt liv & pension med teknisk spets och arbetar nära våra kunder för att skapa verklig och långsiktig affärsnytta.
