title: System Architect to Qmatic!
description:
Qmatic is a global leader in customer journey solutions and is now entering an exciting modernization phase. They are looking for an experienced and pragmatic **System Architect** who wants to own and further develop the architecture behind a platform that enables more than **2 billion customer journeys** every year. This is a unique opportunity for someone who wants to take a central role in modernizing a global platform used across sectors such as finance, healthcare, retail, and public services.

##### **ABOUT THE ROLE**


As an System Architect at Qmatic, you will be at the core of modernizing and modularizing the platform—through a sustainable, gradual, and business-focused approach. Qmatic is looking for an architect who enjoys working closely with development teams and who thrives in a role that combines strategic thinking with hands-on technical work.


You will:

* Own and evolve the system architecture for a platform deployed both containerized on-prem and in AWS.
* Ensure consistent packaging, upgrades, observability, and operational environments.
* Support development teams in architectural questions and contribute with hands-on technical work.
* Identify and design sustainable solutions that simplify integrations and empower partners.
* Lead the modernization journey through stepwise modularization and decommissioning of legacy systems.
* Ensure security, compliance, traceability, and access control are built in from the start.
* Collaborate closely with DevOps, Product Management, global development teams, and Compliance.

##### **TECHNICAL ENVIRONMENT**


Qmatic’s platform is built on a modern and robust technology stack, where the backend is primarily developed in **Java and Spring Boot**, while frontend solutions are created in **Vue 3**. The platform is containerized and runs in **Docker** and **Kubernetes**, enabling flexible deployments both on-prem and in **AWS**. Data is primarily managed in **PostgreSQL**, complemented by **MySQL** for customers operating on-premises installations. Qmatic works in an agile setup following **Scrum**.

##### **YOUR PROFILE**


We are looking for an experienced System Architect who enjoys driving change while also working hands-on with the platform. You see the bigger picture, propose improvements, and drive initiatives that strengthen the platform. You communicate clearly and inspire collaboration across teams and functions.


You have:

* Experience modernizing monolithic systems
* Strong skills in Java and Spring Boot
* Practical experience with Docker and Kubernetes
* Experience designing/building systems for hybrid deployments (cloud + on-prem)
* Experience designing API lifecycle/versioning and backwards-compatible integrations
* Experience designing authentication/authorization patterns for platforms serving multiple applications
* Experience with load testing and performance testing
* Working knowledge of secure architecture (identity, least privilege, audit logging, secrets, encryption) and designing for auditability/traceability
* Excellent communication skills in English, both spoken and written


Meritorious:

* Observability depth (metrics/logging/tracing, OpenTelemetry or similar)
* Familiarity with frontend platform patterns (Vue3) and authentication flows
* Practical experience in ISO27001/SOC2 or similar regulated environments
* Experience with multi-tenant SaaS architectures
* Ability to communicate in Swedish

##### **ABOUT QMATIC**


Qmatic is a global leader in reshaping connections between people and services to enable exceptional customer experiences. Working closely with partners worldwide, the company supports over **2 billion customer journeys** each year, across more than **60,000 systems** in over **120 countries** and across industries including finance, healthcare, retail and public services.  

Headquartered in Mölndal, Sweden, Qmatic also has sales and service offices in Atlanta, Bocholt, Dubai, Katwijk, and Madrid. Through smart and future‑driven technology, Qmatic helps clients create excellent customer and employee experiences — enabling smoother, more efficient operations every day, around the world.

##### **YOUR APPLICATION**


In this recruitment, Qmatic is collaborating with Wise.


We do not accept applications via email. Please apply easily with your CV or LinkedIn profile at **wise.se**.  

We use a competency‑based recruitment process in our effort to ensure potential‑based and objective selection. We therefore welcome applicants of all backgrounds, ages, and experiences, as we know that diversity strengthens us as a team and as an organization.


If you have questions about the process or the role, you are welcome to contact Recruitment Consultant **Jacob Elmeljung** at *jacob.elmeljung@wise.se*. Interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the final application date.

**We look forward to receiving your application!**

title: Tech Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
*Vill du bidra till en förflyttning inom teknisk marketing automation och vara med på en spännande teknikresa? Hos oss får du en nyckelroll i att vidareutveckla en avancerad plattform, arbeta med stora datamängder och bidra till framtidens kundkommunikation inom ett av Sveriges starkaste varumärken.*


**Om jobbet**



Som Tech Marketing Automation Specialist blir du en viktig del av ett högspecialiserat CRM- och MA-team i en miljö som präglas av stora datamängder, komplexa system och hög teknisk mognad. Rollen kombinerar tekniskt djup med verksamhetsförståelse och ger dig möjlighet att påverka hur marketing automation och CRM utvecklas framåt. Vi befinner oss i en förändringsresa med ny teknik och nya arbetssätt, där du får en central roll i att säkerställa att plattformen används optimalt – både idag och inför kommande tekniska förflyttningar.



Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:


* Delta i konceptutveckling och bygga avancerade dialoger i Adobe Campaign Classic
* Samarbeta med Operational Data Steward för att identifiera och använda rätt data
* Supportera teamet och ta lead i teknisk och avancerad felsökning i plattformen
* Konfigurera och anpassa MA-plattformen utifrån nya och förändrade behov
* Utveckla enklare funktionalitet för att effektivisera arbetssätt och processer
* Sätta upp automatiserade filintegrationer med interna system och externa dataleverantörer
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam för att hitta bästa lösning ur ett verksamhetsperspektiv
* Agera operativ plattformsexpert tillsammans med ansvarig för MAS-arbetssätt
* Utföra business acceptance test (BAT) för funktionalitet som levereras av utvecklingsteamet


**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

Personalvillkor på bolån och blancolån


Rabatt på sak-, person- och djurförsäkring


Friskvårdsbidrag och friskvårdstimma


Gym & gruppträning på kontoret


Lunchförmån


Fyra extra lediga dagar/år utöver semesterdagarna


Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:


* Flera års erfarenhet av teknisk marketing automation i komplexa miljöer
* Djup kunskap i Adobe Campaign eller motsvarande avancerat MA-system, inklusive utveckling och konfiguration
* Goda kunskaper i SQL, XML, datamodeller och relationsdatabaser
* Goda kunskaper i JavaScript, JSON, HTML och CSS
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i Azure DevOps (ADO)

Meriterande är även om du har:


* Erfarenhet från större organisationer eller konsultverksamhet med komplexa systemlandskap
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i SAFe eller liknande ramverk


Som person är du lösningsorienterad och analytisk, med förmåga att identifiera, utveckla och implementera rätt teknisk lösning. Du arbetar strukturerat och metodiskt, vilket gör det lätt för andra att följa dina resonemang och planer. Samtidigt är du pragmatisk, trygg i din kompetens och har förmågan att omsätta metoder och teknik på ett effektivt sätt med tydligt fokus på slutmålet.


**Kontaktuppgifter:**



Rekryterande chef: Katarina.Forssen@lansforsakringar.se  

Facklig representant Forena: susanne.hirsch2@lansforsakringar.se  

Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen: maria.eriksson@lansforsakringar.se


*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*


  
Länsförsäkringar AB är en inkluderande arbetsplats där mod, möjligheter och engagemang står i centrum. Vi erbjuder ett hållbart arbetsliv med flexibla villkor och satsar på att alla medarbetare ska kunna växa och trivas, oavsett bakgrund.


Affärsenhet Sak är länsförsäkringsgruppens drivkraft inom sakförsäkring. Vi utvecklar nya affärer, skapar smarta försäkringslösningar och ser till att kunderna alltid har trygghet i vardagen. Vi står bakom gemensamma koncept, digital försäljning och kundkommunikation – och vi kompletterar bolagens erbjudanden med specialprodukter som gör skillnad.


Hos oss får du vara med och forma framtidens försäkring – där innovation möter samhällsnytta.


  
Katarina Forssén | Kontaktperson

title: DevOps-Specialist
description:
OM TJÄNSTEN
   

  

 Arbetsgivare: Svenska kraftnät
   

  

 Antal tjänster: 2
   

  

 Placeringsort: Sundbyberg, Stockholm
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag: 3 mars 2026
   

  

 Kvalifikationer: Relevant utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande kompetens. Flerårig erfarenhet av IT-infrastruktur och applikationsdrift i Linux och/eller Windows. Vana av automatisering med exempelvis Ansible, skriptprogrammering i Bash, Powershell eller Python samt arbete med CI/CD, monitorering och logghantering. Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Meriterande: Erfarenhet av containerplattformar och orkestrering som Docker eller Kubernetes, CI/CD-verktyg såsom Azure DevOps eller GitLab, systemutveckling eller testautomatisering samt arbete i miljöer med höga IT-säkerhetskrav.
   

  

 Övrigt: Tillsvidareanställning. Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %. Tester ingår i rekryteringsprocessen. Säkerhetsprövning genomförs och tjänsten kan innebära krav på svenskt medborgarskap samt krigsplacering.
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 I rollen som DevOps-specialist arbetar du med att automatisera och effektivisera utvecklings- och driftsprocesser för IT-system som stödjer kraftsystemanalys, driftplanering och utvecklingen av det svenska kraftsystemet. Rollen kombinerar operativt arbete med utveckling av arbetssätt, där fokus ligger på stabila, säkra och reproducerbara leveranser i en verksamhetskritisk miljö.
   

  

**Tjänsten Innebär Bland Annat Att Du**
* Automatiserar konfigurationshantering och driftsättning av applikationer
* Installerar och konfigurerar system på ett reproducerbart och säkert sätt
* Stöttar utvecklingsteam vid driftsättning, konfiguration och felsökning
* Bygger, förbättrar och förvaltar CI/CD-pipelines
* Arbetar med loggning, monitorering och observerbarhet
* Samarbetar med systemansvariga, utvecklingsteam, plattform, infrastruktur och IT-säkerhet


 Du får möjlighet att vara med och forma DevOps-arbetet i en sektion där rollen är ny inom teamet. Organisationen är under tillväxt och det finns utrymme att påverka både tekniska lösningar och arbetssätt.
   

  

 Som DevOps-specialist tillhör du enheten Analysapplikationer B inom avdelningen IT för Kraftsystem & Elmarknad. Enheten ansvarar för systemstöd som används för analys, planering och drift av det svenska kraftsystemet och elmarknaden. Du arbetar tillsammans med systemansvariga i ett team som ansvarar för inköpta system samt att stödja de tvärfunktionella utvecklingsteamen.
   

  

 Om dig
   

  

 Skallkrav
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är analytisk, strukturerad och resultatorienterad, med god samarbetsförmåga. Du tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och arbetar metodiskt för att driva arbete framåt. Egenskaperna är viktiga då rollen innebär arbete med automatisering samt nära samarbete med systemansvariga, utvecklingsteam och andra IT-funktioner.
   

  

 Du ska också leva upp till den statliga värdegrunden. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Vidare har du en examen inom IT eller annan relevant utbildning, eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt som Svenska kraftnät bedömer som likvärdig.
   

  

**Du Har Även Flerårig Erfarenhet Av**
* IT-infrastruktur, exempelvis operativsystem, containerplattformar, databaser, lagring, nätverk och säkerhetslösningar
* Driftsättning och felsökning på Linux och/eller Windows av applikationer skrivna i till exempel C++, C# och/eller Python
* Automatisering av konfiguration med till exempel Ansible
* Skriptprogrammering med till exempel Bash, Powershell och/eller Python
* Konfiguration av monitorering, observerbarhet, logghantering med till exempel OP5, Loki, Grafana och/eller Prometheus
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Containers och orkestrering, exempelvis Docker, Kubernetes eller Podman
* CI/CD-verktyg såsom Azure DevOps, GitLab, Argo CD, Artifactory, JFrog Xray eller SonarQube
* Systemutveckling eller testautomatisering i C++, C# eller Python
* Arbete i miljöer med höga IT-säkerhetskrav
* Arbete i agila team, gärna i en ledande teknisk roll


 Bra att veta
   

  

* Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm / Sundbyberg
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Sista ansökningsdag är den 2026-03-03 Vi använder urvalsfrågor istället för personligt brev
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidaretjänst
* I denna rekryteringsprocess tillämpas tester
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät


 Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Sandra Peiper, sandra.peiper@adadigital.se eller linda.segerman@adadigital.se. Vid frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Anna Maria Hedman, 010-489 26 71, (AnnaMaria.Hedman@svk.se). Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010-475 87 72 och Erica Midfjäll, ST, 010-475 87 31. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät kan det vara ett krav på svenskt medborgarskap i vissa befattningar. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
   

  

 För mer information om säkerhetsprövning
   

  

 Svenska Kraftnät Arbetar För Att Främja Mångfald Och Motverka Diskriminering Och Ser Gärna Sökanden Med Olika Bakgrund Och Erfarenheter Till Våra Rekryteringar. Lär Känna Svenska Kraftnät Och Hur Det Är Att Arbeta Hos Oss
   

  

 Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät
   

  

 ANSÖK HÄR

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about creating smooth, efficient development processes? Do you thrive in agile environments where collaboration, automation, and continuous improvement drive success? Would you like to be part of a team developing cutting-edge software that supports cancer care around the world? Then join us at RaySearch Laboratories as a DevOps Engineer and help shape the future of oncology information systems.
   

  

**About The Role**
 RaySearch is developing advanced software solutions to improve cancer treatment worldwide. As a DevOps Engineer at RaySearch, you’ll be part of a collaborative team driving automation, efficiency, and reliability across our development environments. You’ll work closely with developers and DevOps engineers across several products — including our oncology information system and treatment planning system — to optimize build pipelines, release processes, and development workflows. As our configuration teams grow, you’ll have great opportunities to shape routines and ways of working together. Your main tasks will be to:
   

  

* Strive to make the development iteration times short and efficient
* Manage build and release flows using pipelines
* Create and manage tools using the Azure DevOps API to input and output information
* Manage build and test servers and the related environments
* Administer, manage and provide support for Git version control


**Your profile**
**Required**
 We believe you are a collaborative and curious professional who enjoys working closely with others to make things run smoothly. You take initiative, share ideas, and look for ways to improve how things are done. We believe you are attentive to details and value quality in your work, while keeping a pragmatic mindset. You’re comfortable in a dynamic environment where teamwork and communication are key to success. Fluency in English is required, and Swedish proficiency is a plus. Further, we believe you have:
   

  

* A B.Sc. or M.Sc. in engineering or equivalent experience
* 5 years’ experience in software development and/or configuration managementExperience in programming using .NET (PowerShell/C#).
* Experience in continuous integration and deployment (using e.g. Azure DevOps pipelines, GitHub Actions, or similar).
* Experience in Infrastructure as Code (Terraform/Ansible).
* Experience in Windows Server administration/management.
* Excellent communication skills in English.


 Lastly, it is not a requirement but highly meritorious if you have experience in:
   

  

* Microsoft Visual Studio
* Git
* Automation and process management using Azure DevOps


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySearch is the driving force behind our organization
 **,** 
 where everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability to deliver exceptional results, pay close attention to detail, and consistently go the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in their field, driven by a relentless focus on solving problems - no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in leading the way in cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative solutions that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer** 

 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply for the position through the application form below. Selection and interviews will be ongoing. We do not accept applications by email.

title: Senior Solution Architect (Cloud & Software)
description:
**About the job** 




 Arratech is building the trusted infrastructure behind global e-invoicing and e-reporting. Our mission is to make digital compliance frictionless — empowering governments, enterprises, and service providers to connect securely, scale confidently, and trade freely. From access points to continuous transaction controls, we design with purpose, move with momentum, and earn trust daily. If shaping the future of regulatory tech on a global scale excites you, you’ll thrive here.
 



**Senior Solution Architect (Cloud & Software)** 




 We are looking for a skilled Senior Solution Architect with strong hands-on and architectural experience to join our agile technology team. Both contract-based consultants (immediate availability) and permanent positions (on-site in Stockholm) are relevant. You are a strategic thinker and practical doer — capable not only of defining high-level architectures but also contributing code where needed.
 



 You have proven expertise in cloud architecture (AWS is primary, GCP experience valued as well), deep familiarity with software development (especially Node.js and Java), and strong experience working with many types of databases and data-intensive systems. You excel at bridging business requirements with scalable technical solutions and champion best practices in design, security, performance, and maintainability.
 



**Responsibilities** 




 As a Senior Solution Architect at Arratech, you will:
 


* **Design and lead cloud-native architectures** 
 that are robust, scalable, cost-effective, and secure, focusing primarily on AWS services (and GCP where relevant).
* **Translate business needs into technical blueprints** 
 , collaborating with product managers, engineering leads, and stakeholders to align architectural vision with strategic goals.
* **Provide technical leadership and mentorship** 
 to development teams, facilitating architectural discussions, design reviews, and coaching best practices.
* Evaluate and select appropriate technologies, tools, and patterns that support microservices, APIs, event-driven systems, and distributed computing.
* **Hands-on coding and prototyping** 
 be comfortable writing, reviewing, and contributing to mission-critical code in Node.js, Java, or other languages as required by architectural needs.
* **Support DevOps and automation practices** 
 , helping improve CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code (IaC), monitoring/observability, and automated test strategies.
* **Ensure architectural documentation and standards** 
 are maintained — including diagrams, rationale, constraints, and architectural decisions.
* Advocate for security, compliance, resilience, performance, and cost-efficient design in all systems and solutions.



**Requirements** 



* **Master’s degree** 

 in computer science or similar discipline
* **8+ years of experience** 
 in technical architecture, systems design, or senior engineering roles with a focus on cloud-based solutions.
* **Strong cloud architecture expertise** 
 , especially AWS, understanding of core services (e.g., EC2, Lambda, VPC, RDS, API Gateway, IAM, monitoring/logging).
* **Proficiency in Node.js and Java** 
 capable of contributing technically and making informed decisions about code and architecture.
* Solid experience with
 **multiple database technologies** 
 (SQL + NoSQL) and with data-intensive architectures.
* Demonstrated ability to
 **design, communicate, and implement complex software solutions** 
 aligning with business requirements.
* Strong
 **communication and collaboration skills** 
 , capable of engaging technical and non-technical stakeholders alike.
* Fluent in English (written and spoken).
* Must be able to
 **work on site in Stockholm** 
 .



**Nice to Have** 



* **AWS Certification** 
 (e.g., Solutions Architect – Associate or Professional).
* Experience with
 **GCP or multi-cloud architecture** 
 .
* Familiarity with
 **DevOps practices** 
 (Terraform/CloudFormation/CDK, CI/CD automation, container tooling).
* Experience shaping architectural governance, standards, and enterprise-wide technical roadmaps.
* Understanding of modern
 **security principles** 
 , identity systems, and compliance.



**What we offer** 




**Flexibility & Work-Life Balance:** 




 We understand the importance of a healthy work-life balance and offer flexible working arrangements, including remote work options and adaptable schedules, to ensure our team members can thrive both professionally and personally.
 



**Rapid growth in a startup environment:** 




 We’re a startup, which means you’ll wear many hats, solve real problems, and grow faster than you thought possible.
 



**Having fun is non-negotiable:** 




 We offer a competitive compensation package and a culture of working hard and playing hard.
 



**A team that trusts and delivers:** 




 We move fast, but never solo. You’ll work with sharp people who care deeply about what we do.
 



**Apply now.** 




 Applications will be evaluated when received, so please apply as soon as possible.
 



 All applications must be submitted in English and are treated confidentially.

title: Engineering Manager, Back End (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.
   

  

 Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.
   

  

 No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you’re ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 In Agoda’s Back End Engineering department, we build the scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. These mission-critical systems change frequently with dozens of releases per day, so we must employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques in order to make sure everything works without any downtime. We also ensure that our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. In order to accomplish this, we use state-of-the-art languages like Scala and Go, data technologies like Kafka and Aerospike, and agile development practices. Most importantly though, we hire great people from all around the world and empower them to be successful. Whether it’s building new projects like Flights and Packages or reimagining our existing business, you’ll make a big impact as part of the Back End Engineering team.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 The Engineering Manager role at Agoda is one of the most significant and challenging roles at the company. The right candidate is both extremely hands on – technically excellent, with solid engineering principles – and exhibits strong leadership and people development skills. We are looking for world class development managers to lead one or more of our engineering teams.
   

  

**In this Role, you'll get to:**
* Be hands on - its one of the job’s fundamental task, and most of our development managers are writing and reviewing code, giving expert level coaching and guidance to their engineers.
* It's important to have a love of engineering and a passion for building things elegantly and at scale. Staying in touch with where the industry is going is crucial, and it’s important to have strong opinions about how systems should be architected, engineered, and maintained.
* Do full stack engineering: you should have solid experience in all parts of the technology stack: infrastructure, client side, back end, performance, data, and others.
* Developing people - Despite our investment and belief in technology, people are still our greatest asset. The right candidate will have a keen interest in developing people: inspiring those around them so they can achieve their potential. Being able to bring A-players such as yourself from outside and integrating them into the business will also be important.


**What you'll Need to Succeed** 
**:**
* Extremely proficient in at least 1 programming language (Java, Scala, C#)
* Strong experience in systems architecture – particularly in complex, scalable and fault tolerant distributed systems
* Demonstrable experience as a system owner with operational responsibility
* Proficient in lower level engineering (Garbage collection, context switching, threading)
* DevOps culture – Agility. Leanness. Automation. CI/CD
* Good understanding of application security
* Passionate about technology and the Internet
* Must have worked in a successful agile development team
* Must have run engineering teams before with 5+ direct reports
* Able to operate with autonomously: making decisions, setting KPIs, with a strong sense of ownership
* Practices data driven decision making


**It's Great if you have:**
* Proficiency in more than one programming language

title: Cloud/ Infrastructure Architect
description:
På Sogeti tror vi att det bästa finns inom oss alla. Oavsett om du är i början av din karriär eller redan på toppen av ditt spel, kommer vi att uppmuntra dig att nå din fulla potential och bli bättre. Genom vår gemensamma passion för teknik, vår entreprenöriella kultur och vårt fokus på kontinuerligt lärande, kommer vi att ge dig allt du behöver för att göra ditt bästa arbete och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
   

  

**Cloud\Infrastructure Architect**
**Om rollen**
 Vi söker dig som älskar molnteknologi! Vill du vara en nyckelspelare inom molnteknologi och hjälpa företag att förverkliga sin digitala potential? Hos Sogeti får du möjligheten att vara den drivande kraften som tar våra kunder genom molnets alla faser – från strategi och design till implementation och vidareutveckling. Vi söker dig som är redo att ta din Cloud-kompetens till nästa nivå och bli en del av ett globalt nätverk av molnexperter.
   

  

*I den här rollen kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i:*
* Designa och leda kunders molnresor, från planering av applikations- och datamigrering till molnbaserad applikationsutveckling.
* Samarbeta nära med utvecklingsteam och verksamhet för att säkerställa optimal prestanda och kompatibilitet i kundernas molnmiljö.
* Bidra med teknisk expertis och rekommendera innovativa, kundanpassade molnlösningar som driver verksamhetsnytta.


**Din profil**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som Cloud Solution Architect eller liknande roll.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att analysera affärsbehov och skapa anpassade molnlösningar.
* Erfarenhet av att samarbeta med IT-utvecklingsteam och säkerställa optimal prestanda efter migrering.
* God kunskap inom virtualisering, applikationsarkitektur och molnplattformar (Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, IBM Cloud).
* Vi ser gärna att du är certifierad, exempelvis som Azure Solutions Architect Expert eller AWS Certified Solutions Architect.
* Du har utmärkta kommunikationsförmågor och behärskar svenska och engelska flytande, i såväl tal som skrift.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
 Innovativ miljö: Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
   

  

 Karriärutveckling: Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
   

  

 Flexibelt arbete: Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
   

  

 Teamkänsla: Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.
   

  

**Ansökan**
*Vi välkomnar varmt din ansökan idag, urvalet sker löpande! Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Team Manager, Simon Karlsson på simon.karlsson@sogeti.se*
*Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.*
 Om Sogeti
   

  

 Sogeti Sverige, en del av Capgemini-koncernen, med 19 kontor och 1200 medarbetare, skapar affärsvärde med teknologi för organisationer som behöver införa innovation snabbt och som vill ha en lokal partner med global skalbarhet. Med en hands-on-kultur och närhet till kunderna, implementerar Sogeti lösningar som hjälper organisationer att arbeta snabbare, bättre och smartare. Genom att kombinera agilitet och snabb implementation via en DevOps-ansats, levererar Sogeti innovativa lösningar inom test- och kvalitetssäkring, molnet och systemutveckling, förstärkta av AI, data och automation.

title: AI / Cloud Engineer
description:
**Startdatum:** 
 2026-03-02
   

  

**Slutdatum:** 
 option på förlängning
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 100 %
   

  

**Plats:** 
 Solna, Hybrid
   

  

 Uppdragsbeskrivning
   

  

 En större aktör inom samhällskritisk verksamhet söker en erfaren AI- och Azure-konsult till ett uppdrag med tydligt fokus på avancerade AI-lösningar i molnmiljö. Rollen innebär att ta fram skalbara, säkra och verksamhetsnära AI-tjänster som integreras i befintliga IT- och affärsprocesser.
   

  

 Uppdraget kombinerar AI-utveckling, backendutveckling och integrationsarbete i en miljö med höga krav på tillförlitlighet, säkerhet och regelefterlevnad. Konsulten förväntas bidra genom hela livscykeln – från design och implementation till drift och vidareutveckling.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**
* Utveckla och implementera AI-lösningar i Azure, inklusive promptbaserade flöden, RAG-arkitekturer och konversationslösningar
* Bygga och vidareutveckla backendtjänster och integrationslager i Azure
* Designa och implementera integrationer mot etablerade företagsplattformar och verksamhetssystem
* Automatisera ITSM- och affärsrelaterade flöden med hjälp av AI och molntjänster
* Implementera lösningar för kunskapshantering, sök och informationsåtervinning
* Säkerställa produktionsberedskap genom övervakning, dokumentation och driftsstöd


 Skall-krav
   

  

* Flerårig erfarenhet av utveckling och arkitektur i Microsoft Azure
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att bygga AI-lösningar med språkmodeller, embeddings och prompt engineering
* Erfarenhet av backendutveckling i C# och/eller Python samt REST-baserade API:er
* Erfarenhet av integrationsutveckling mot större verksamhetssystem via API:er, middleware eller liknande
* God förståelse för RAG-arkitekturer, informationssökning och kvalitetssäkring av AI-svar
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD, automatiserade leveranser och molnbaserad drift


 Meriterande
   

  

* Kunskap om ITSM-processer såsom incident, change, request och kunskapsbas
* Erfarenhet av automatiserings- eller lågkodsplattformar
* Vana vid arbete med säkerhet, identitetshantering och styrning i större organisationer
* Tidigare uppdrag i komplexa eller reglerade miljöer

title: Application Maintenance Engineer
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 As an
 **Application Maintenance Engineer** 
 you will be part of a team responsible for maintaining and supporting applications, ensuring stability and performance. The role involves incident resolution, change implementation, automation, and monitoring across technologies such as Java, JavaScript, Perl, Unix shell scripting, and containerised environments.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Maintain and support applications, ensuring availability and adherence to SLAs.
* Troubleshoot and resolve incidents; perform root cause analysis and implement fixes. Automate routine maintenance tasks using scripts and tools.
* Apply changes and releases safely across Unix/Linux environments.
* Set up monitoring and dashboards for proactive issue detection. Participate in extended hours/on call support rotation when required.


**Your profile**
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field.
* 5+ years of experience in application maintenance or production support.
* Strong skills in Java, Perl, and Unix/Linux scripting. Working knowledge of JavaScript for minor fixes or enhancements.
* Exposure to monitoring tools (e.g., Grafana) and log analysis. Understanding of ITIL processes (Incident, Problem, Change). Familiarity with Docker and container basics.
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications.


***As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.***
  

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Director of Engineering
description:
Keystone Education Group is proud
 *“To help everyone in the world find the right education”* 
 . Keystone is a global leader in matching students with the right education. With a reach of more than 100 million unique prospective students every year, the company helps many people make one of the most important decisions of their lifetimes.
 



  





 Keystone also offers education institutions an end-to-end solution across the entire student recruitment value chain, providing tech-powered student marketing and recruitment services to over 5,500 institutions in more than 190 countries.
 



  





 The Search & Discovery Engineering organization at Keystone will spend the coming years consolidating and improving its platforms while developing new product features. To support this journey, Keystone is now looking to appoint a Director of Engineering.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As Director of Engineering for Search & Discovery, you will lead an organization of 50+ engineers across multiple locations, reporting to the Executive Director of Product & Technology. Supported by Engineering Managers, a Principal Architect, and Senior Engineers, you will combine people leadership, operational excellence, and long-term engineering strategy. In addition to leading the overall organization, you will directly manage one of the squads and work closely with Product Management on planning, delivery, and product strategy.
 



  





 You will own the engineering strategy, architecture, and delivery for the Search & Discovery business area, ensuring scalable, performant, and cost-effective solutions. A key part of the role is driving strong ways of working through agile principles, OKRs, and close collaboration with suppliers and stakeholders.
 



  





**Our technology stack** 




 The tech stack consists of Next.js, React, and TypeScript on the frontend, and .NET/C# on the backend. The platforms run in the cloud on AWS, GCP, and Vercel, with Elasticsearch, GraphQL, and REST as key components. CI/CD is managed through GitHub and GitHub Actions, and the organization is actively adopting AI, using Python, OpenAI, and LangChain.
 



  





**About you** 




 You are an experienced engineering leader with a strong background in modern product development. You are comfortable operating at both strategic and operational levels, and you enjoy taking full responsibility for people, technology, and delivery. You lead with clarity and trust, balance long-term thinking with day-to-day execution, and create strong alignment between engineering, product, and business.
 



  





**Your experience includes** 



* Several years in senior engineering leadership roles, including managing managers
* Leading engineering organizations of 30+ people across multiple locations
* Strong experience with modern product development practices (agile, lean, OKRs)
* Ownership of engineering strategy, architecture, and delivery for complex systems
* Building and operating scalable, cloud-based web platforms
* Cost-aware engineering leadership, including budgeting, prioritization, and cost efficiency
* Experience with DevOps, CI/CD, test automation, and engineering metrics
* Managing external suppliers and technology partners
* A genuine interest in AI and emerging trends in software engineering



  





 Fluency in English is required. Swedish is not required, but the role is based in Stockholm.
 



  





  





*Keystone Education Group is working in partnership with Safemind on this recruitment process.*

title: Test Automation QA Engineer, BE
description:
**About the Company** 




  





 At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it. FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day. We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field. Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
 



  





**About the Role** 




  





 We're looking for a Test Automation Engineer with strong Java experience to build and maintain automated testing frameworks, ensure quality across APIs and services, and actively contribute to our agile team culture. This role is perfect for someone who values collaboration, continuous learning, and technical ownership.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Design, develop, and maintain Java-based test automation frameworks (TestNG, RestTemplate, RestAssured).
* Execute functional, regression, and integration testing across services and components.
* Implement and maintain API testing suites and integrate with tools like RestAssured or Postman.
* Own test execution within CI/CD pipelines (Git workflows, branching, PR checks).
* Collaborate with developers and product teams to define testable requirements and quality gates.
* Monitor test results, triage failures, and drive root-cause analysis.
* Contribute to test strategy, coverage metrics, and continuous quality improvements.
* Perform testing relevant to your role, sometimes under support.
* Understand different test approaches and when to use each.
* Learn and apply best practices for good quality testing.







**Qualifications** 




  





 Must-have: Java for test automation, TestNG, RestTemplate, RestAssured, functional/regression/integration testing, API testing, CI/CD pipelines, Git.
 



  





**Required Skills** 




  




* Java for test automation
* TestNG
* RestTemplate
* RestAssured
* Functional/regression/integration testing
* API testing
* CI/CD pipelines
* Git







**Preferred Skills** 




  




* Spring Framework
* Performance/load testing (Gatling, k6)
* Docker/Kubernetes
* Contract testing (Pact)

title: Testare på Meepo
description:
Vi söker dig som vill ta helhetsansvar för vår manuella testning. Du gillar att arbeta agilt där testning och kvalitetssäkring sker kontinuerligt och inte vid sidan av. Är detta du? Sök! 
 



  





**Kort om Meepo** 




 Meepo består av 31 tekniknördar med en gemensam drivkraft: att skapa innovativa och omsorgsfullt formgivna digitala lösningar som gör skillnad på riktigt. Vi samarbetar med allt från startups till globala bolag och är en pålitlig, nyfiken och kunnig techpartner som bryr sig om helheten.
 



  





**Teamet och produkten** 




 För den här rollen kliver du rakt in i team Minso och vårt gäng på tio personer: Erika, Sandra, Henrik, Erik, Tim, Frej, Carl, Mattias, Frida och Fredrika! Vi är utvecklare, UX-designers, lösningsarkitekter, testare, produktägare och projektledare med en gemensam kärlek till vår produkt, och ett starkt driv att hela tiden göra den ännu bättre.
 



 Tillsammans försöker vi göra pensionsvärlden lite mindre snårig. Vi bygger en modern, väldesignad och användarvänlig plattform som hjälper människor att förstå och ta kontroll över sitt pensionssparande. Den används redan av flera stora aktörer och gör livet enklare för miljontals användare. Och det bästa, vi är bara i början på vår resa!
 



 Tekniskt då? Vi bygger modulärt, med en och samma kodbas som kan anpassas efter olika kunders behov. Det kräver smart arkitektur, kluriga lösningar och tätt samarbete. Vår stack består bland annat av Java, Typescript och Vue
 



 Vi har automatiserad testning på plats, men manuell testning har hittills varit fördelad i teamet. Det som saknas är en tydlig motor och genomförare. Någon som brinner för test, tar ägandeskap och ser till att kvalitet inte blir en eftertanke. Det är precis den rollen du kliver in i.
 



  





**Rollen som Testare** 




 Som manuell testare hos oss tar du ägandeskap för den manuella testningen i teamet, både operativt och strukturellt.
 



 Det innebär att du:
 


* Utför manuella tester
* Ansvarar för planering, ledning och uppföljning av testarbete
* Tar fram och förvalta teststrategier, testplaner och testfall
* Är med tidigt i kravprocessen och tar fram testfall parallellt med kravarbete
* Koordinerar testarbete i teamet
* Rapporterar och hantera felrapportering och kvalitetssäkring
* Samarbetar tätt med utvecklare, lösningsarkitekter och automattestare



 Rollen är ny och formbar. Det finns ingen färdig mall att följa, du får vara med och sätta hur testning ska fungera framåt. Frihet, ansvar och möjlighet att påverka är en naturlig del av vardagen.
 



  





**Din bakgrund** 




 Du har jobbat med manuell testning ett tag och vet hur viktigt det är att komma in tidigt, tänka brett och se samband. Du har också erfarenhet av att arbeta i team där samarbete och eget ansvar varit en naturlig del av vardagen.
 



 Vi tror att du:
 


* Har minst två års erfarenhet av test och kvalitetssäkring i systemutvecklingsprojekt, gärna i webbmiljöer.
* Har minst tvåårig eftergymnasial utbildning.
* Har erfarenhet av testverktyg, felrapportering och uppföljning av kvalitet.
* Är van att ta fram testfall utifrån krav, användningsfall och andra underlag.
* Är bekväm med svenska i tal och skrift.
* Trivs i agila arbetssätt och tvärfunktionella team.



  





**Vi blir extra glada om du dessutom har erfarenhet av:** 



* Intresserad av att använda AI som verktyg.
* Har jobbat med Playwright.
* Har erfarenhet från pension, försäkring eller finans.
* Har jobbat med Lumera.
* Kan läsa loggar eller har viss förståelse för Java-kod.
* Är van vid Git-baserade plattformar som GitLab.



  





**Personen vi söker** 




 Du tar initiativ, skapar struktur och ser till att testningen rullar på utan att någon behöver peka ut exakt vad som ska göras.
 



 Du är nyfiken, gillar felsökning och vill förstå flöden och samband. Du behöver inte vara utvecklare, men du har ett tekniskt intresse. Du har också grundkoll på tillgänglighet och kan testa med skärmläsare som VoiceOver eller NVDA.
 



 Som person är du strukturerad, prestigelös och en lagspelare som gärna tar ägandeskap för testområdet.
 



  





**Vad du får hos oss** 



* Ett team där gemenskap, omtanke och glädje inte bara är fina ord, det är så vi jobbar!
* Vi delar på 15 % av vinsten varje år. Går det bra för Meepo, går det bra för alla.
* Du får 50 000 kronor om året i utbildningsbudget, att använda till det du vill lära dig mer om.
* Vi ger 10 % av vinsten till välgörenhet – för att vi vill att vår techkraft ska göra skillnad, även utanför skärmen.
* Tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kronor och dessutom ett gymkort, för att nämna några av alla våra förmåner.
* Vi sitter i fina lokaler i Mariahissen med magisk utsikt över Riddarfjärden och Stadshuset.



  





**Slutkläm** 




 Låter det här som något för dig? Hör gärna av dig, oavsett om du är redo att söka eller bara vill veta lite mer. Vi berättar gärna mer om hur vi jobbar och hur det är att vara en del av teamet.

title: COS Data Engineer (Senior)
description:
**Company Description**
 COS offers a wardrobe of ready-to-wear and accessories rooted in exceptional quality and lasting design. The creative soul of the brand is fuelled by a deep connection to modern culture, dynamic global cities and compelling fashion movements. With an emphasis on expert craftsmanship, innovation and materiality, collections are created with a mindful approach, seamlessly blending contemporary and timeless.
   

  

**Job Description**
 If you are passionate about data and eager to tackle some of the most interesting AI, analytics and data use cases in the fashion retail industry, COS is the place for you!
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced data engineer who likes to resolve complex issues and choose the best course of action. In this exciting and critical role, you will help us build data products that directly impacts business spanning all global COS.
   

  

 You will join COS data engineering team within COS AI, analytics and data (aiad) function.
   

  

 We appreciate a multitude of technical backgrounds, and we believe you will enjoy working here if you are passionate about data. In this role, you will be required to implement data-intensive solutions for a data-driven organization.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize and support of existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
* Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and able to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
* Ensure that our built data products work as independent units of deployment and non-functional aspects of the data products follow the defined standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
* Develop and optimize complex data pipelines, ensuring smooth data flow across multiple business domains
* Understand business issues, create data-driven solutions and present them to stakeholders, ensuring alignment with the business goals
* Work close to the stakeholders around vision for existing data products and identifying new data products to support our business needs.
* Work with product teams within COS and across H&M group around topics that relate to our data modernization initiative.
* Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams
* Maintain expertise in latest AI, analytics/data and cloud technologies


**Qualifications**
 Alignment to our company values is the most important characteristic we look for in all new joiners. Our values are the behaviours that we appreciate above and beyond anything else. We are
 **open-minded** 
 and
 **curious** 
 , we dare to be
 **different** 
 , we believe in
 **constant improvement** 
 and we
 **empower and trust** 
 you to take ownership. Our values are part of who we are, what we stand for and how we act.
   

  

**What You Need To Succeed**
* Extensive work experience including hands-on as either:
* Data engineer on modern cloud data platforms /or advanced analytics environments.
* Software Engineer with cloud technologies and infrastructure
* Experience in different data formats (Avro, Parquet)
* Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar)
* Experience in data centric programming using one of more programming languages Python, Java /or Scala.
* Good understanding of different data modelling techniques and trade-off
* Good understanding of Data Lakes, Data Mesh principles, domain-oriented data ownership and governance
* Knowledge of NoSQL and RDBMS databases
* Have a collaborative and co-creative mindset with excellent communication skills
* Motivated to work in an environment that allows you to work and take decisions independently
* Experience in working with data visualization tools - PowerBI/Looker studio etc.
* Experience in DBT for data transformation and GCP tools - Dataflow, Bigquery etc
* GCP (or/& Azure) data engineering certification is a plus
* Fluent in English both written and verbal


**Additional Information**

 In this role you will have the flexibility to work both remotely and, from the office. While remote working is part of our offer, approx. 4 days per week office presence is required to foster strong collaborations and team work.
   

  

 WHY YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE
   

  

 We offer all our employees attractive benefits with broad development opportunities. All our employees receive a staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program - HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

**In Addition To This, H&M-based Colleagues Also Receive**
* 30 days holiday

 JOIN US
   

  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things - our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it's our people who make us who we are.

 We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Clinical Validation Specialist
description:
Are you passionate about improving cancer care by making complex, safety-critical systems work seamlessly in real clinical practice? As a Clinical Validation Specialist at RaySearch, you’ll help turn clinical and technical insight into safer, smarter integrations between RayCare and cutting-edge treatment delivery devices. By designing and validating realistic workflows, uncovering edge cases, and ensuring treatment data flows correctly between systems, you directly shape software used in oncology centers worldwide—helping thousands of patients receive safer, more efficient treatments every day.
   

  

**About RayCare**
 RayCare is our next-generation oncology information system, built to bring order, clarity, and efficiency to some of the most complex workflows in modern cancer care. Used in clinics around the world, RayCare supports every step of the patient journey—from the first registration to treatment delivery and follow-up.
   

  

 Designed together with leading cancer centers, RayCare helps physicians, physicists, treatment planners and therapists coordinate their work, access the right information at the right time, and deliver care safely and efficiently. The system integrates deeply with RayStation and external treatment delivery devices, enabling seamless data flow through HL7, DICOM, and dedicated device interfaces. With RayCare, clinical teams can focus less on system friction and more on patient care—and you will be part of shaping how that happens.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a Clinical Validation Specialist, you’ll step into a role where clinical expertise meets technical innovation. You’ll work at the heart of our integration efforts—collaborating with developers, treatment machine vendors, and clinical partners to ensure that RayCare’s integrations are not just functional, but truly aligned with how radiotherapy is delivered in practice.
   

  

 Your days will be a mix of running full treatment workflows on simulators, validating complex device interactions, troubleshooting unexpected behaviors, and shaping solutions that improve safety, usability, and efficiency for clinics worldwide. What you discover, refine, and validate becomes part of a product used in oncology centers across the globe.
   

  

 Travel plays a big role—you’ll regularly visit clinics and vendor sites to test integrations in real environments, work with experts, and see firsthand how your work influences daily patient care. This is a hands-on, problem-solving role with global impact.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We believe you are someone who understands how complex, safety-critical workflows work in practice—and who enjoys validating that they behave correctly in real clinical settings. You have a structured way of thinking, a strong sense for detail, and an interest in how different steps in the radiotherapy treatment chain interact with each other.
   

  

 Your background may come from working close to the clinic—such as treatment planning, OIS/TPS usage, or treatment delivery—or from testing and validating medical software or other critical systems in healthcare. Regardless of where you started, you’re comfortable analysing real workflows, identifying risks, and ensuring that systems behave safely and predictably in practice.
   

  

 Equally important is your ability to collaborate and communicate. You enjoy working closely with developers, clinical experts, vendors, and other stakeholders, and you’re able to translate clinical or technical insight into clear feedback and concrete improvements. You appreciate a role that combines hands-on testing, analytical problem-solving, and real clinical logic.
   

  

 You don’t need to be an expert in everything from day one. What we value most is your curiosity, your willingness to learn, and your ability to take ownership when validating real-world treatment workflows.
   

  

**We believe you’ll thrive in this role if you have:**
* A master’s degree in medical physics or a similar technical or clinical field, or equivalent experience working with medical software or systems in healthcare.
* Experience from radiotherapy workflows or from testing and validating medical software, medical devices, or other safety-critical systems.
* An understanding of how medical software and technical systems are used in practice—and an interest in how different steps in a workflow affect each other.
* Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, particularly in safety-critical contexts.
* The ability to communicate clearly in English and work closely with both clinical and technical stakeholders.
* Willingness to travel for onsite validation with clinics and vendors.
* Comfort working independently and taking initiative when validating workflows in real clinical environments.


**Nice To Have (but Not Required)**
* Experience designing or executing test cases, working with simulators, or validating workflows in realistic clinical scenarios.
* Previous exposure to HL7, DICOM, or other clinical integrations and data flows.
* Experience from multiple treatment systems, vendors, or clinical environments.


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization, where everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability to deliver exceptional results, pay close attention to detail, and consistently go the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in their field, driven by a relentless focus on solving problems - no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in leading the way in cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative solutions that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply to the position through the application form below. We do not accept applications by e-mail. Selection and interviews will be ongoing.

title: Lead Backend Developer to DanAds
description:
*DanAds is transforming its architecture to become truly platform-first and we are now looking for a Platform Lead Back-End Developer to design the reusable, high-performance microservices that will power our global self-serve advertising products.*
**About The Position**
 This is a direct recruitment, which means that the recruitment process takes place through Bravura and you are employed directly by DanAds.
   

  

**About The Company**
 DanAds is a leading global SaaS company within AdTech, providing automated self-service advertising platforms for publishers and brands worldwide. Our technology helps media owners streamline ad sales, operations, and creative workflows, empowering advertisers of all sizes to buy media in a transparent, efficient way.
   

  

 Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Stockholm, we work with well-known international partners and are on a mission to shape the future of self-serve advertising through automation, AI and scalable platform thinking.
   

  

 You will join a product & engineering organization that values ownership, pragmatism and collaboration, where experienced engineers work closely with product and commercial teams to build a platform used by multiple customers across the globe.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 DanAds is shifting from monolithic, client-specific codebases to a standardized, API-driven ecosystem. As Lead Backend Developer you will be the Technical Guardian of our backend platform.
   

  

 Your mission is to design and build backend microservices (e.g. Identity, Booking, Reporting, AI) that are:
   

  

* Multi-tenant
* Serverless-first
* Strictly decoupled from the frontend
* Built for reuse across many clients


**You Will**
**Provide technical leadership**
* Act as gatekeeper of the API, defining and maintaining strict OpenAPI contracts – no implementation starts until the contract is in place.
* Drive a serverless-first architecture on AWS (Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB, EventBridge) to support a “scale-to-zero” cost model and strong FinOps discipline.


**Own platform governance**
* Apply a “reusability filter” to new features: reject one-off, “snowflake” logic and instead design generic capabilities that can serve many customers.
* Enforce data standards such as the Ad Context Protocol (AdCP) across services, ensuring a unified data language within our AdTech ecosystem.
* Implement robust multi-tenancy and logical isolation so that tenant data is strictly separated, enforcing policies via JWT and row-level security patterns.


**Lead by example in the team**
- Be a hands-on technical leader who writes the “golden path” templates, libraries and patterns that other developers build upon.

 Conduct rigorous code reviews to ensure our non-functional requirements are met — including latency (<200 ms), 99.99% availability and strong observability.
 - Translate commercial and product requirements into clear technical designs — turning “we need better sales” into “we need a Recommendation Engine API”.

**In Short, You Will**
* Own and evolve the core backend platform and microservices
* Define and maintain high-quality API contracts and standards
* Drive AWS serverless architecture and FinOps best practices
* Enforce multi-tenancy, security, and data standards across services
* Mentor other engineers and set the technical bar for back-end development


**Required Experience**
* 7+ years of backend engineering experience, with a strong focus on API design and microservices.
* Deep experience with AWS, especially Lambda, DynamoDB, EventBridge, and CloudFormation and/or Terraform / AWS CDK.
* Strong skills in TypeScript/Node.js for building scalable backend services.
* Proven track record designing and implementing RESTful and/or GraphQL APIs, treating them as products (versioning, documentation, backward compatibility).
* Solid understanding of multi-tenant architectures, security and data isolation.
* Experience working with event-driven architectures and distributed systems.
* A clear “platform mindset”: you understand the difference between building a one-off project and building a reusable platform, and you naturally prefer standardization over customization.


 You are a senior engineer who enjoys owning the big picture while still being hands-on in the code. You are opinionated about good architecture and API design, but pragmatic enough to ship.
   

  

**We Believe You**
* Think in terms of platforms and reusable capabilities, not one-off custom builds.
* Are comfortable saying no to solutions that don’t fit the architecture – and explaining why in a clear, constructive way.
* Communicate well with both engineers and non-technical stakeholders, translating business goals into simple, understandable technical concepts.
* Enjoy mentoring and helping other developers grow by providing actionable feedback, examples and “golden path” implementations.
* Have a strong sense of ownership, caring about quality, observability, and the long-term health of the platform.


**Other Information**
**Start: As agreed upon**
**Location: Stockholm or Malmö**
**Salary: According to agreement**
 We use a competency-based method in all recruitment processes to ensure unbiased selection. We also work with ongoing selection, which means that we’ll take down the job ad when enough candidates have reached the final steps of the process.
   

  

 If you are considered for the position, we will contact you for an initial interview. Regardless of whether you proceed in the process or not, you will receive feedback on your application.
   

  

 If you have questions about the role or about your application, you are welcome to contact Navid Parsa who is in charge of the recruitment process on navid.parsa@bravura.se or 070 - 434 17 71.
   

  

 We recommend that you submit your application immediately as we make a continuous selection.
   

  

 Welcome with your application!
   

  

*#Brillante*
