title: BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE EXPERT
description:
We are looking for a senior Data Engineer in our clients CoDev Data Team, you’ll deliver privacy-compliant data products, maintain pipelines for driver feedback and car signals, and ensure data quality and uptime. You’ll collaborate with engineers, architects, and stakeholders, and support the Product Owner with communication and leadership tasks.
  

More specifically, you will design and develop data pipelines to create business-aligned data products that meet company standards and governance, using the codev time series source-aligned data product. These data products may include attributes such as software version, distance driven, driver duration, and common identifiers for each driving cycle. You will also implement monitoring metrics to ensure data quality and track usage and costs, document the implementation per team guidelines, and prepare for handover.


**Mandatory Requirements**


* Strong expertise in Python, version control (Git/Gerrit), and CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or GitLab CI/CD.
	+ Experience with containerization (Docker) and building modern, scalable data pipelines using tools such as Databricks or Airflow.
	+ Solid background in system design, programming, and database interfacing, with autonomy to design solutions and improve datasets.
	+ Proficient in data visualization (Power BI), API management, and SQL; skilled in handling large datasets and developing robust workflows.
	+ Hands-on experience with Azure cloud services, Snowflake, and test program development.
	+ Analytical mindset with a passion for exploring new tools and methods to deliver stakeholder value.
	+ MSc degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Data Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent; fluent in English.
	+ Familiarity with UDS diagnostic communication protocol (automotive industry).
	+ Fluent English


**Roles and Responsibilities**


* Deliver privacy-compliant CoDev data products in raw and refined formats.
	+ Maintain and improve data pipelines for driver feedback and car signal/diagnostic data.
	+ Ensure data quality, uptime, and reliability of reports and dashboards.
	+ Document datasets and provide clear overviews for stakeholders.
	+ Collaborate with data engineers, software teams, architects, and product users.
	+ Support the Product Owner with stakeholder communication and leadership tasks.
	+ Design scalable solutions and continuously improve datasets and tools.


**The scope of the full project**


* Deliver CoDev Data Products


Provide quality-assured, privacy-compliant data in raw and refined formats for internal users.


* Maintain Data Pipelines


Ingest driver feedback and car signal/diagnostic data.


Ensure uptime and data quality for reports and dashboards.


* Data Documentation


Create descriptive overviews of datasets for stakeholder clarity.


* Collaboration


Work closely with data engineers, software teams, architects, and stakeholders.


* Support Leadership


Assist Product Owner and Engineering Manager with communication and stakeholder needs.


* Technical Development


Design scalable solutions, improve datasets, and explore new tools.


**APPLY, DEVELOP AND CREATE YOUR FUTURE!**


We hope you find this attempting to be a part of! Join us on the travel to YOUR best future! Apply, Develop and Create Your Future! Now!


Send your application as soon as possible to jobb@mutualbenefits.se


Name your application to “**Data Engineering Expert**”


**ABOUT MBE**
=============


ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY AND MANAGEMENT


MBE have solid experience of sustainable product development in Automotive and Clean Energy Tech industry in combination with advanced AI for electrical grid (similar to stock market). After several awards for technical expertise from European Council, Swedish Energy Agency and Västra Götalandsregionen as well as growth and leadership such as DI Gazelle with successful international business we feel confident in our progress and are welcoming additional exeperts to the journey.


We created and developed our distinguished leadership model together with professors at IHM Personal Leadership program and Stephen R Covey’s methodology. You will recognize many similarities in Simon Sinek’s visions. The model is continuously sharpened since 2001.


VERSATILE & INCLUSIVE TEAM


We are happy to see applications from creative, curious and senior developers to join our expert team towards advanced technology clients within Automotive and Circular Energy. We are extra happy to see applications from FEMALE applicants.


We engage top engineers. Experienced experts as well as distinguished Newly graduated engineers with personal values for Sustainable Engineering, IT and Embedded solutions, caring for a well balanced life with family & fun together with YOUR best career development!


3D CAREER PLAN


Successful companies build a well-planned business plan. MBE builds successful people through their individual “Personal Business Plan”! Since we have a wide palette of recognized international clients and assignments, there’s always a matching assignment connecting to YOUR career plan.


Through the MBE’s solid leadership model, our employees develop their career in 3D! Through long-term planning, between the 3D parts Work, Health and Social life, together with challenging assignments, important contacts and supplementary courses to become the best they can be… with their own individual prerequisites!

title: Lead Architect Digital Cockpit
description:
ECARX is a global automotive technology provider partnering with OEMs to accelerate the future of software-defined vehicles. As OEMs develop new vehicle platforms from the ground up, ECARX is developing a full-stack solutions to enhance the user experience, while reducing complexity and cost.
  
To date ECARX products have been integrated into more than 8.7 million cars worldwide, and we continue to shape the interaction between people and vehicles by rapidly advancing the technology at the heart of smart mobility. Founded in 2017, and listed on the Nasdaq in 2022, we have more than 1,800 team members across Europe, Asia and the Americas working towards one ambition: to redefine the driving experience by making it safer and more enjoyable for everyone.
  
We are now looking for a Lead Architect Digital Cockpit to join our team in Gothenburg.
  
Job Responsibilities
  
As the lead architect COC you will lead the interpretation and analysis of the latest Google&Android requirements, technological trends and methodologies. Lead and support the activities of proof of concept for new beneficial proposals and the introduction to actual programs/projects as common, reusable and future-proof solutions. Be the internal stakeholder interface for Google&Android competency and support the customer-oriented architectural activities.
  
As the lead architect of arch hub you will be responsible for maintaining the architecture, system design, strategy and roadmap of the superset product Cloudpeak, with support from other architects and TLs. Bridging between the new ideas from COC, the new business strategies from BG, and the new product definition&introduction. Lead the definition of the best practice of processes and ways of working with the alignment across other architects and TLs. Architectural and technological support in R&D team's product delivery work. Internal stakeholder interface for product architecture and support the customer-oriented architectural activities.
  
  

​Job Requirements
  
Minimum of 8-10 years of experience in software architecture, system design, and R&D within the tech industry, preferably focused on consumer electronics, mobile platforms, or cloud-connected products.
  
Proven experience in a lead architect or principal engineer role, demonstrating the ability to define, maintain, and drive the architecture and roadmap of a complex product or product suite
  
Deep, verifiable expertise in Google & Android platforms, including a thorough understanding of their latest requirements, architectural changes, APIs, and technological trends.
  
Demonstrated success in leading the research, design, and execution of PoCs for novel technologies, and successfully transitioning them into common, reusable, and robust product solutions.
  
Strong background in defining and documenting comprehensive system designs, strategies, and technical roadmaps. Leadership & Stakeholder Management.
  
Proven ability to lead and mentor a group of architects and technical leads (TLs), including setting best practices for architectural design and development processes.
  
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with proven experience as a key internal stakeholder interface for both technical expertise (Google/Android competency) and product architecture.
  
Demonstrated ability to act as a bridge between new technological ideas, business strategies, and product definition/introduction, ensuring technical roadmaps align with business goals.
  
Experience in defining, standardizing, and ensuring the alignment of architectural best practices and ways of working across multiple R&D teams.
  
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field.

title: Data Platform Product Owner
description:
Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
  
  

DeLaval is now looking for an experience product owner who has genuine interest in Data&AI platform development to join Digital Services Organization.
  
  

The Digital Services Unit leads DeLaval’s transition to offer cloud-based services to bring unique value to dairy farmers, dealers, partners, and its own organisation. We are on an exciting journey of connecting farms, robots and cows to the cloud. Through data collection in combination with AI/ML, we are creating new and innovative solutions helping the dairy farmers all around the world.
  
  

Purpose of role and key responsibilities
  
As a Product Owner at DeLaval Digital Services organization, you will be part of our Data Platform team, you will operationalize the vision and data platform strategy, empowering stakeholders with the right data infrastructure at the right time. You will ensure that the data platform evolves in sync with the organization's changing needs, enabling various product teams to share and harness data for insightful decisions. The challenge is multifaceted—balancing technological advancements, data governance, and user needs while keeping an eye on business objectives and strategic direction. The Product Owner helps the adoption of the data platform, actively investigating different data personas and implementing platform capabilities in accordance with use value drops.
  
  

We are modernizing the DeLaval data platform, transitioning from a centralized to a decentralized (mesh) operating model to enhance agility and scalability. An excellent team has come together to kick off this rare and transformative journey, if you have genuine interest and experience to make a significant impact, this is a unique opportunity to contribute to this groundbreaking initiative.
  
  

**What you'll do as a Data Platform Product Owner:**  

Drive data platform roadmap and lead the sprint demos, retrospectives, and stakeholder interview sessions
  
Manage the product backlog and prioritize features based on business value (e.g. User Story Mapping sessions, co-define the DoD with the team,)
  
Guide stakeholders and communicate the data team’s strategy, ambitions and priorities
  
Champions the platform’s value, actively inspires stakeholders to think differently about how data platform can be used
  
Work closely with data engineers, tech lead, analysts, data stewards and business stakeholders to ensure the platform's features meet their requirements
  
Establish and monitor the platform’s health metrics
  
Sketch proper golden paths for different JTBDs tailored different data personas
  
Set up a feedback loop mechanism to enhance the quality of processes
  
Prepare for quarterly CoPlanning sessions, collect requirements, pain points and priorities
  
  

**Required qualifications and experience:**  

**To be successful in this role we see that you have:**  

Proven track record and more than 3 years of experience in a similar role
  
Product ownership productivity tools expert (e.g. Jira, Miro, Confluence…)
  
Good experience with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban)
  
Self-motivated, curious with an analytical thinking capacity, metric-oriented to measure the success of the data platform
  
Decent cross-functional communications skills, act as the "voice of the customer"
  
Familiarity with data management and governance principles (Data catalogue, quality, SLI/SLO, regulations, access management,….)
  
Familiarity with Databricks and/or AWS is a big plus
  
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT, and Business Administration
  
Professional English, written and spoken skills
  
  

Working at DeLaval
  
Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviours. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours, Set Direction, Make things happen and One DeLaval.
  
  

We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. DeLaval is a part of the Tetra Laval Group together with Tetra Pak and Sidel. In addition, we offer:
  
Market-based salary with an individual incentive program based on performance and company result
  
Secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance).
  
Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
  
Wellness contribution of 4 000 SEK/year
  
Private health insurance
  
Flexible working hours and reduced working hours.
  
30 days paid vacation
  
  

This position is located in Tumba, Sweden. You will report to Data&AI Platform Product Manager.
  
  

Application
  
To apply for this position, you must send in your application though the DeLaval career page. Careers - DeLaval. Kindly note that we do not accept applications via email. We review applications ongoing so do not wait to apply. Please note that response times may be longer than usual due to holiday periods. We appreciate your patience and understanding.
  
  

Contact
  
If you have questions regarding the position or the recruitment process, please contact:
  
**Hiring manager:** Mohammmadreza Babaee, Data&AI Platform Product Manager (Mohammadreza.babaee@delaval.com)
  
**Recruiter:** Agnes Edbom, (agnes.edbom@delaval.com)
  
  

We look forward to hearing from you!
  
  

About DeLaval
  
  

Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions. Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,700 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
  
  

See more at www.corporate.delaval.com

title: Senior SAP Analytics Engineer to BSH Home Appliances, Solna
description:
**Senior SAP Analytics Engineer (Datasphere/BW/HANA)**



Welcome to the innovation leader in home appliances and the Strategy and Business Development for the Nordics! We are strengthening our data foundation to power reliable reporting and automation. For this, we are now looking for a Senior SAP Analytics Engineer, who will play a central role in building and evolving the local data models and flows that power our services, automations & tools in the Nordics.



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES  

  

Navigate the SAP landscape, in close collaboration with local customers and counterparts from global IT teams. This encompasses:


**Operative part**


* Build local data flows and models on global datasets (SAP Datasphere, BW/4HANA, HANA) and optimize queries and calculation views to provision trusted data to consumers like SAC and Power BI.
* Translate Nordic business requirements into consumption-ready datasets, coordinating with Sales Analytics and Global Infrastructure teams on access, performance, and releases.
* Manage local reports from creation to automated distribution, collaborating with process automation and platform teams to ensure reliable, end-to-end data refreshes.


**Project part**


* Establish robust processes, standards, and user authorizations for local data provisioning and reporting, driving the full lifecycle from solution design to testing and documentation.
* Be an active member in international BSH communities on Business Intelligence, data engineering, and reporting.


**YOUR BENEFITS**



You will be a key member in a highly dedicated and competent team in an international setting. We offer a creative environment with broad exposure to systems and databases, giving you strong opportunities to learn and develop. You will work closely with key stakeholders, and as part of the Strategy and Business Development department you will continuously contribute to interesting new developments and projects. The team also runs Automation and AI projects and in the team you’ll be at the center of our future.


**YOUR PROFILE**



Background & skills


* Senior professional with a proven track record of building reliable data models and reporting datasets in the full flow from requirement to release (end-to-end)
* Solid experience (5+ years) in a SAP S/4HANA environment and ideally also in one or more of the following applications: • SAP Datasphere (DWC) • SAP BW/4HANA (consumption layer/BEx-style queries) • SAP HANA (SQL, Calculation Views) • Analysis Office • SAC (SAP Analytics Cloud) • Business Objects • Power BI/Power Query
* Familiarity with connectivity and integrations (e.g., OData, JDBC/ODBC), roles/authorizations and collaborating with platform owners on performance topics
* Experience with scheduling/reporting automation; working with process automation tools is an advantage.
* Preferred MSc in Computer Science or equivalent experience


**Personality**


* Thrives with the balance of project work and operative data provisioning
* Comfortable communicating with both end users as well as tech teams. Enjoys enabling others and thrives on being a part of a team.
* Comfortable coordinating with global platform teams
* Fluent in English; proficiency in a Nordic language is an advantage


*CURIOUS? The position is placed in Solna (Stockholm); therefore, you need to have a residence permit in Sweden. For more information about the role, please contact hiring manager Pär Löfgren, Head of Sales Systems at Strategy & Business Development, at* *paer.loefgren@bshg.com**. We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so please send your application as soon as possible, but no later than 2026-02-20.*


**If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact**
company_description: At BSH, we strive to improve your quality of life at home through our exceptional brands, high-class products, and exceptional solutions.

title: Engineering Manager Connected Infrastructure, Lund
description:
Job Title
Engineering Manager Connected Infrastructure, Lund
Job Description*At Axis Communications, we are passionate about creating a smarter and safer world. We have delivered several groundbreaking products and continue to pioneer new solutions at the intersection of devices, software, and cloud. Our success is driven by highly skilled people and a culture that dares to challenge the status quo and constantly break new ground. Enterprise and Partner Solutions is now looking for an Engineering Manager to lead a core part of Axis Cloud Connect — maybe that’s you?*
Who is your future team?
You will lead a team of experienced engineers responsible for the core building blocks of Axis Cloud Connect, the backbone of Axis’ cloud and hybrid-cloud offerings. Your team’s mission is to enable the rest of Axis to build cloud services that are secure, reliable, compliant, and highly available. You do this by setting clear direction, establishing effective ways of working, and ensuring an excellent internal developer experience that allows teams to focus on delivering customer value. Concretely, you and your team will be responsible for:* Identity and Access Management (IAM), with end-to-end responsibility for the IAM offering in Axis Cloud Connect.
* Core cloud platforms and infrastructure, including Kubernetes-based environments that provide a stable and scalable runtime for Axis cloud services.
* Internal developer experience, owning tooling, automation, and platform services that help Axis engineering teams build, deploy, and operate services efficiently and safely.
* Common ways of working, defining shared principles, patterns, and practices that enable consistent delivery across teams and make sure the platform is: Compliant, reliable, available, and cybersecure.


Your team functions as a platform enabler for the rest of Axis, supporting many other teams and services. Success in this role depends on close collaboration and strong relationships across the organization.
You will be an active member of a management team where alignment, transparency, and shared ownership are essential. There are high expectations on your ability to collaborate across organizational boundaries, balance multiple stakeholder needs, and contribute to both strategic and operational decision-making.
What will you do — and who are you?
As Engineering Manager for Axis Cloud Connect Core Platform, you are responsible for a foundational part of Axis’ cloud strategy. Your primary focus is people leadership and strategic direction. Together with your team, you own the lifecycle of the platform services, ensuring the right priorities, focus areas, and long-term direction are set. To be successful in this role, you are a strong people manager with a solid general understanding of software and service development. We expect that you:* Have experience leading engineering teams and creating an environment where people can grow, collaborate, and perform.
* Have a solid understanding of modern software-based services and cloud environments.
* Are comfortable leading through others, trusting your team’s expertise while providing clarity, structure, and direction.


You are an excellent communicator with strong interpersonal skills. You enjoy working closely with other managers and stakeholders to align priorities and resolve dependencies. You are comfortable navigating ambiguity, making trade-offs, and helping teams move forward even when all details are not fully known. Axis is a complex and fast-moving organization, and you thrive in that environment. You take a structured and pragmatic approach to problem-solving and value collaboration over control.
Who am I, your future manager?
As a manager and leader, my most important task is to ensure that my teams — including yours — have the right conditions to succeed. That means clear goals, strong support structures, and a shared understanding of why our work matters.
I believe in setting high expectations and trusting people to take responsibility and lead themselves. My door is always open for discussions, and I value openness, collaboration, and independence.
Our people and their knowledge are what drive Axis’ success. As a growing company, Axis offers great opportunities for development and new challenges. I hope to give you the opportunity to grow as a leader, take on increased responsibility, and help shape the future of Axis.
What Axis has to offer
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide. As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.
To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?  

Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.
We go through applications continuously so don’t wait – send in your application today!
In case of questions, please reach out to recruiting manager Niklas Holmqvist.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2026-03-09*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Receptionist Scandic Sundsvall Nord
description:
**Nu söker vi en Receptionist till Scandic Sundsvall Nord.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en anställning för enstaka dagar på extra vid behov.


Vi söker en anställnings för enstaka dagar som sedan kan bli ett sommarvikariat.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

Enable "functional cookies" to watch the video


...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.
company_description: Nordiskt hotellföretag i världsklass som skapar enastående upplevelser för de många människorna. 16 000 medarbetar, 280 hotell i 6 länder.

title: Data Scientist
description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic junior to mid-level data scientist to join our dynamic and growing team at LeoVegas. The ideal candidate will have an open-minded attitude and be eager to learn. You will get the opportunity to work hands-on in the entire lifecycle of putting machine learning based applications in production.
  
  

Our team is responsible for providing the entire organisation, including all brands and markets, with algorithms for decision-making support, product personalization, and optimization and automation of business processes. Our project portfolio is diverse and constantly growing. Examples include churn prediction, lifetime-value prediction, player risk assessment models (responsible gaming), money laundering detection, and recommender systems to name a few.
  
  

Our data science team is not focused on reporting; we actively develop and deploy models into production that directly serve and enhance the entire organisation.
  
  

**YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:**  

* Interpret stakeholder requirements to develop, implement, and fine-tune machine learning models that address their specific needs and business objectives.
* Improve and maintain existing machine learning models to enhance their performance, accuracy, and efficiency over time as well as following new regulations.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with various teams, including product, engineering, and business, to ensure seamless integration and alignment of machine learning solutions with overall company goals.
* Analyse and transform data using SQL to prepare datasets for machine learning model development and ensure data integrity and accuracy.
* Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the effectiveness of new features and promotions.
* Collaborate with external parties to enable outsourced ML based applications.
* Perform advanced analysis on large and complex datasets to extract actionable insights and inform the business to make informed decisions


**OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:**  

ESSENTIAL SKILLS
  
* 2+ years of experience in a similar role
* Understanding of fundamental concepts in statistics and machine learning
* Experience in apply machine learning, either in academia or industry
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
* Experience with SQL
* Basic understanding of Git


NICE TO HAVES
  
* Experience in any of the following techniques or systems: Airflow, Bayesian statistics, BigQuery, causal inference, Docker, GitHub, Google Cloud Platform, Kubeflow, natural language processing, neural networks, scikit-learn, Stan, survival analysis, TensorFlow, time-series forecasting, Vertex AI, and XGBoost


WHO WE ARE
  
  

At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.
  
  

BENEFITS
  
  

* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


JOIN US!
  
  

In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
  
Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
  
  

\*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: Support Specialist till Visma Publitech
description:
*Bli en del av ett engagerat team som supportspecialist! Vi söker en supportspecialist med erfarenhet av Personec P och ett brinnande intresse för kundservice. Är du dessutom analytiskt lagd och lösningsfokuserad? Då kan det här vara tjänsten för dig!*

### **Om rollen**


I rollen som Support Specialist får du jobba med Visma Publitechs största produkt, vårt HRM-system Personec P. Vi är stolta över att ha majoriteten av Sveriges kommuner och regioner som kunder och varje dag arbeta tillsammans med dem för ett hållbart samhälle.


Som Support Specialist arbetar du dagligen med avancerad 2nd-line felsökning och assistans av våra applikationer och komponenter. Det handlar om att utreda incidenter, bevaka ärendekö, hantera behörighetsproblematik eller problem med integrationer.


Utöver dina närmaste supportkollegor, har du även ett nära samarbete med andra team inom teknik, utveckling samt applikationskonsulter. Vi strävar alla efter att göra våra kunder nöjda med våra produkter, systemlösningar och tjänster.

#### **Arbetsuppgifter**

* Felsöka och vägleda kunder med frågor och problem
* Samla in och sammanställa information för vidare felsökning
* Inmatning av information i vårt ärendehanteringssystem Service Cloud och ge statusuppdateringar till kunder
* Arbeta enligt Visma Publitech’s Quality Management Systems
* Ge snabb och kvalitativ kundvård samt uppfylla såväl interna som externa SLA:er
* Prioritera kundnärvaro som i ärenden eller möten samt ge personligt stöd för bästa kundupplevelse
* Använda automation och AI-metoder samt andra digitala verktyg i det dagliga arbetet


Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning och placeringsort är i första hand i Göteborg eller Helsingborg då de flesta kollegor inom teamet finns här. För rätt kandidat kan andra orter vara aktuella. Vi tillämpar en flexibel hybridmodell med möjlighet kombinera arbete på kontoret och hemifrån.

#### **Om teamet**


Teamet består av 10 engagerade supportspecialister med djupgående kompetens inom applikationssupport. De har en gedigen förståelse för våra kunders behov och en stark förmåga att snabbt lösa kunders problem och utmaningar. Vi är stolta över vårt team och vi ser fram emot att fortsätta växa och utvecklas tillsammans med våra talangfulla medarbetare.

### **Vem söker vi?**


Vi söker dig som har ett stort intresse för Personec P och som trivs i en kundorienterad roll och att samarbeta med andra. Du är en analytisk, självgående, problemlösande person som tycker om att fördjupa dig i komplexa ärenden. Du har kunden i fokus och ser värdet i en god leverans. Vidare kommunicerar du obehindrat i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska.


Vi ser gärna att du även har:

* Flera erfarenhet av applikation/system Personec P (2nd line).
* Högre utbildning inom ekonomi, HR, lön, datavetenskap eller liknande.
* Förmåga att arbeta i ett högt tempo och ständigt föränderlig miljö


Det är även meriterande om du har

* Kunskap om Anställningsguiden
* Kunskap om integration till Medvind från Personec P
* Kunskap om integration såsom Time Care eller annan tredjeparts produkt till Personec P

### **Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?**


Visma Publitech är ett bolag inom Visma-koncernen. Vi drar fördelarna av att vara ett mindre, entreprenöriellt bolag med ett nära samarbete och en varm familjär kultur, samtidigt som vi ingår i en av Europas ledande IT-koncerner. Vår vision är att stärka offentlig sektor med innovativa lösningar som bidrar till maximerad verksamhetsnytta och ett hållbart samhälle.  

  

Vi är oerhört stolta över vårt höga medarbetarengagemang som placerar oss på topp-fem procent i tech-branschen!  

  

Gör skillnad från dag 1: Hos oss får du möjlighet att påverka såväl företaget som din egen utveckling. Vi vill se dig äga din roll, och ger dig således frihet under ansvar för att nå de mål som vi har kommit överens om.


Vi investerar i din framtid: När du börjar på Visma öppnar du dörren till oändliga möjligheter. Du kommer att mötas av engagerade ledare som bryr sig om och stöttar dig, och hjälper dig utvecklas både inom ditt specialistområde men även genom nätverk och andra kompetenshöjande aktiviteter.


Framför allt är vi ett team: Teamkänsla är det som får oss att kunna hålla våra löften och leverera på en hög nivå, men också det som gör att vi kan främja en hållbar företagskultur där vi stöttar och bryr oss om varandra.

### **Ansökan**


Du söker tjänsten via länken. Vi kommer gå igenom urvalet och kalla till intervjuer löpande, skicka därför in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.  

Har du frågor eller önskar mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta: Åsa Edvardsson på mail: asa.edvardsson@visma.com eller via Linkedin.


Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!  

  

***I denna rekrytering kommer bakgrundskontroller att genomföras på slutkandidat.***

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**Xensam: Join the Future of SAM**  

Xensam is the leader in AI-powered, cloud-based Software Asset Management. Our technology brings clarity to complex IT environments, helping users make smart, data-driven decisions and maximize software ROI.


Recognized with the Highest Growth Award and ranked #3 Overall Champion at the Main Software 50 Awards Nordics, we’re scaling fast and looking for people who want to join the journey. At Xensam, you play a key role in a team built on energy, focus, and positivity. We value experience, but even more, the person behind it.


Together, we build the future of SAM.

 **About the role**


We are seeking an experienced Engineering Manager to lead and scale engineering execution and people leadership across multiple development teams in our R&D organization. The role is central to building a predictable, scalable, and sustainable engineering organization as the company continues to grow.


As Engineering Manager, you will focus on establishing consistent and scalable ways of working, developing leaders and teams, and ensuring reliable delivery while maintaining quality, stability, and clear ownership. You will work closely with Product, QA, Security, Infrastructure, and other engineering leaders to ensure alignment, resolve dependencies, and continuously improve how engineering delivers value.


**Responsibilities**

* Lead, mentor, and develop multiple development teams, establishing clear roles, ownership, balanced team capacity, and scalable ways of working.
* Support efficient and predictable delivery across teams by resolving blockers, managing dependencies, and supporting priority decisions in close collaboration with product leadership.
* Evolve and standardize engineering practices and tooling to maximize efficiency, stability, and consistency across teams.
* Implement and continuously evolve AI-supported engineering workflows and methodologies that are safe and efficient.
* Collaborate closely with QA and Security leadership to integrate sustainable quality assurance processes and secure development practices into everyday engineering work.
* Drive technical improvement initiatives, including technical debt and component lifecycle management, by clearly articulating trade-offs, risks, and alternative costs in collaboration with product leadership.
* Participate in hiring, onboarding, development and performance management.
* Manage the full lifecycle of consultant engagements, ensuring effective integration with internal teams and alignment with delivery goals.
* Establish and use execution metrics to create transparency, support decision-making, and drive continuous improvement.

**Qualifications**

* Proven experience in a senior engineering leadership role (e.g. Director of Engineering, Senior Engineering Manager, or similar) with responsibility for multiple teams.
* Strong people leadership skills with a focus on coaching, development, and building scalable organizations.
* Experience establishing consistent and scalable execution models.
* Solid technical background with the ability to engage in architectural and lifecycle discussions without requiring hands-on coding.
* Experience working cross-functionally with Product, QA, Security, and Infrastructure teams.
* Ability to manage complexity and scale in a fast-paced, growing organization.
* Experience using execution metrics to support continuous improvement.
* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in fluent English (Swedish is a plus).

**What you get**

* A generous work culture with free drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Other location-specific benefits.

**Our values at Xensam**

**Rebellious**  

We challenge the norm and act with initiative – always with responsibility.

**Humane**  

We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.

**Harmony**  

We value balance and create a supportive workplace where people thrive.


As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Regional Sales Manager - Nordics
description:
- Job Description
**Regional Sales Manage - Strategic Industries, Nordics**  

  

**Location: Kista, Stockholm**  

  

  

**ABOUT WIND RIVER**  

Wind River is a global leader in delivering software for mission-critical intelligent systems. For more than four decades, the company has been an innovator and pioneer, powering billions of systems that require the highest levels of security, safety, and reliability.  



  

Wind River helps customers across automotive, aerospace, defense, industrial, medical, and telecommunications industries solve complex technology challenges on their journey toward the new intelligent machine economy. The company’s software powers generation after generation of the safest, most secure systems in the world. Examples include playing a key role in NASA space missions such as Artemis I, the James Webb Space Telescope, and multiple Mars rovers. We’ve achieved recent 5G milestones including the world’s first successful 5G data session with Verizon and building one of the largest Open RAN networks in the world with Vodafone.  



  

The company has received industry recognition for its technology innovation and leadership, and for its workplace culture, including global Great Place to Work certification and being named a “Top Workplace” for ten consecutive years. If you want to be part of a unique culture where the lived experience is based on our cultural attributes of growth mindset, customer-focus, and diversity, equity, inclusion & belonging, come join us and help advance the future software defined world.
  

  

**ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY**  

The EMEA Strategic Industries Sales Team is engaged in both collaborative & strategic long-term partnerships allowing them to unlock the full potential of Wind River solutions, and building new business of the near and far future. We strive to become the premier provider of products & services for our customers, engaging at the senior management level in a vision-setting, business outcomes-focused, value-added capacity.
  

  

**Your Role:**  

The Regional Account Executive’s primary responsibilities include prospecting, qualifying, selling and closing new business within new and existing customers in the Nordic region. In addition, the Regional Account Executive brings a “Point of View” to Customer engagement; uses all resources to solve customer problems with appropriate Wind River products and Services, with accountability for increasing revenue of all Wind River solutions through Software Subscriptions and Licensing, Customer Success Engagement, Professional Services and retention activities such as Consulting, Enablement and Education Services.  

  

  

  

**HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE** 


	* Account and Customer Relationship Management
	* Annual Revenue - Achieve/exceed quota targets.
	* C Level access – ability to access C Levels involving Wind River Executive Sponsors.
	* Sales strategies - Develop effective and specific account plans to ensure revenue target delivery and sustainable growth. Develop relationships in new and existing customers and leverage them to drive strategy through the organization.
	* Organizational acumen – ability to understand Customer’s power-map, internal and external influencers.
	* Trusted advisor - Establishes strong management and C-level relationships based on knowledge of customer requirements and commitment to value (value of counsel and expertise, the value of solutions, the value of implementation expertise). Build a foundation to harvest future business opportunities and accurate account information and coaching.
	* Customer Acumen - Actively understand each customer’s technology footprint, strategic growth plans, technology strategy and competitive landscape. Review and analyze public information (e.g. new executive appointments, earnings statements, press releases) for the company and its competitors to remain updated on key industry trends and issues impacting the prospect.
	* Territory and Account Leadership - Lead designated territory, including accounts, account relationships, prospect profiling, and sales cycles.
	* Business Planning – Develop and deliver a comprehensive business plan to address customer and prospects' priorities and pain points. Utilize benchmarking and ROI data to support the customer’s decision process  

**Demand Generation, Pipeline and Opportunity Management**


	* Pipeline planning - Follow a disciplined approach to maintaining a rolling pipeline. Keep the pipeline current and move the Sales Cycle.
	* Pipeline partnerships – Leverage support organizations, including Marketing, inside sales, SDRs, and Partners, to funnel pipeline into the assigned territory.
	* Leverage Wind River Solutions – Be proficient in and bring all Wind River offers to bear on sales pursuits such as Wind River Linux, ElxrPro, Wind River Cloud Platform, and associated Professional Services.
	* Advance and close sales opportunities - through the successful execution of the sales strategy and roadmap.
	* Support all Wind River promotions and events in the territory  

  

**Your Background:**


	* Attitude is everything.
	* The ideal candidate should have 10+ years of quota-bearing sales experience, ideally selling into decision makers across relevant industries in the UK/I.
	* Experience with Linux and open-source software or software development an advantage.
	* Experience with Cloud Platforms such as VMware and enterprise software such as Redhat.
	* Embedded software sales a plus.
	* Demonstrated success using a consultative, solutions/value-oriented sales approach and team selling environment.
	* Evidence of success selling solutions to new and existing customers.
	* Strong hunting and prospecting skills.
	* Excellent listening, presentation and public speaking skills.
	* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	* Self-motivated individual who can work well on their own or in a team.
	* Ability to manage own area and introduce tailored customer solutions to drive sales forward.
	* Ability to work under pressure with excellent attention to detail.
	* Masters degree or equivalent in business administration or computer science#LI-AW1
