 https://www.femhire.co/job-application?jobadid=410&jobadtitle=Senior%20Java%20Engineer%20(Contractor) or send your cv to talent@femhire.co

title: Tech Lead - Circular Parts Platform
description:
Join Scania Ventures & New Business
   

  

 Scania Ventures & New Business builds new digital ventures that extend Scania’s role in the transport ecosystem. The Circular Parts Platform is one of these ventures — a digital platform connecting heavy truck workshops and vehicle dismantling companies to enable the reuse of high-quality spare parts through secure, scalable, and data-driven solutions.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Tech Lead to take ownership of the technical direction and product delivery of this venture. You will be part of the core venture leadership team, working closely with the Venture Lead (Managing Director), Venture Business Lead, and Finance Lead.
   

  

 Your Mission
   

  

 As Tech Lead, you are accountable for product delivery, technical integrity, scalability, and reliability of the Circular Parts Platform. You ensure that business and product ambitions are translated into robust, secure, and maintainable solutions.
   

  

 You will work in close partnership with the Venture Growth and Commercial Business Lead to align product priorities with technical feasibility, and with the Venture Finance Lead to ensure cost efficiency, scalability, and compliance. Together with the Venture Lead, you shape the long-term technical strategy of the venture.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Define and own the platform’s technical architecture, standards, and long-term technical roadmap. Collaborate with the Venture Growth and Commercial Business Lead to create and maintain the product roadmap and make feature prioritizations.
* Own the product backlog and lead end-to-end product and technology delivery, from MVP to scalable production platform.
* Ensure the platform meets requirements for security, reliability, performance, and compliance.
* Partner with the Venture Finance Lead on cost structures, scalability considerations, and investment decisions.
* Build and lead a high-performing technical team, including internal and external contributors.
* Establish AI-driven and agile ways of working, engineering standards, and quality practices.
* Act as the primary technical representative in internal reviews and external partner discussions.
* As a member of the management team of the venture, shape the venture’s overall success, actively taking part in decision-making


 Who You Are
   

  

 You are a senior technical leader who combines strong engineering expertise with a pragmatic, product and business-oriented mindset. You thrive in venture environments where clarity must be created, and decisions balance speed, quality, and long-term sustainability.
   

  

**Your Background**
* 10+ years of experience in software engineering
* 2+ years of experience in technical leadership roles with end-to-end product delivery responsibilities
* Proven experience architecting and delivering cloud-native, scalable digital platforms.
* Strong understanding of modern architectures, APIs, data platforms, and integrations.
* Experience leading cross-functional teams in agile environments.
* Familiarity with marketplace or multi-stakeholder platforms is a strong advantage.
* Fluent in English; Swedish proficiency is an advantage.


**Your Personal Traits**
* Structured, analytical, and quality-driven.
* Comfortable in making architectural and delivery trade-offs.
* Collaborative leader who communicates clearly across business and technology domains.
* Curious, pragmatic, and motivated by building sustainable digital solutions.
* Strong product-thinking mindset and ability to empathize with customer needs


 Why Join Us
   

  

  

* Take a leading role in building a new digital venture from the ground up.
* Be part of the core leadership team shaping a new digital venture within Scania’s innovation ecosystem.
* Influence product, architecture, and delivery decisions from day one.
* Combine startup agility with Scania’s industrial scale and long-term vision.
* Contribute directly to circularity and sustainability in the transport industry.


 Contact & Application
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application, consisting of your CV and any relevant certificates, and kindly ask you not to share a cover letter to ensure an efficient and unbiased recruitment process for all parties.
   

  

 We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-03-01. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Katarina Stylander, Talent Acquisition Specialist, katarina.stylander@scania.com

title: Tech Lead Android Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* 10+ years of experience in Android engineering.
* Deep expertise in Kotlin and leading large-scale app development.
* Proven ability to implement modern Android architectures.
* Experience with Jetpack Compose, Coroutines, and latest SDKs.
* Strong knowledge of app performance and concurrency.
* CI/CD workflow improvement skills.
* Passion for testing and automation.
* Excellent communication skills.


**Meritorious**
* Experience with Firebase and location APIs.
* Background in modular multi-module projects.


**Application deadline:** 
 16-02-2026
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Data Engineer till BROCC
description:
At BROCC, data drives every decision, from risk management to strategic growth. As a Senior Engineer, you will build and evolve our data platform from the ground up, turning complex data into trusted insights that power reporting, regulatory compliance, and smarter business decisions.
 



 You will work at the heart of a high-performing, innovative fintech company, in a small, senior and T-shaped team. This role combines hands-on technical work with strategic influence, giving you the opportunity to design scalable, future-proof data solutions while building a strong data culture across the organization.
 



  





**Work Description** 




 As Senior Data Engineer at Brocc, you will:
 


* Work with modern tech stack (snowflake, DBT, airflow, fivetran, AWS, kubernetes)in a broad role and collaborative environment, optimizing performance, scalability, and reliability across the data value chain, from raw ingestion to finished insights.
* Design, implement and maintain end-to-end ELT processes, develop clear and well-documented transformations and build business-critical data models to serve as the single source of truth.
* Collaborate with teams across finance, risk, operations and product to turn data needs into scalable, practical solutions. You will enable self-service analytics by providing well-structured datasets, documentation and shared definitions.
* Contribute to building a strong data culture with common standards and best practices and ensure high data quality, traceability, and consistent use of KPIs and metrics across the business.
* Be an integral part of a small, senior data team and take end-to-end responsibility of architecture, standards, and best practices, while remaining hands-on in implementation.
* Continuously identify opportunities to increase automation, efficiency, and performance.



  





**Your Profile** 




 We are looking for someone with:
 


* Several years of experience in data engineering, analytics engineering, and BI development.
* A deep technical expertise combined with broad understanding of how data, technology, and business interconnect.
* Strong SQL skills and several years of experience with dimensional and relational data modeling.
* A deep understanding of data orchestration, ingestion and transformation, and related tools.
* Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Synapse or Databricks).
* A self-motivated and solution-oriented contributor, with a structured approach who shares knowledge and lifts both team and across the business.
* The ability to translate complex data concepts into clear insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.



  





 It is a strong plus with experience from regulated industries (fintech, banking, financial services) and an understanding of compliance and regulatory reporting.
 



  





**About BROCC** 




 Brocc was founded in 2016 as a Stockholm based fintech specialized in peer-to-peer lending. We have since then transitioned into an established, pan-European niche bank within consumer lending and debt management. We are active in 15+ markets across Europe, and have offices in Sweden, Finland and UK.
 



  





 We aim to build a stronger European ecosystem through transparent, data-driven, and fair financial solutions. Read more: www.brocc.se
 



  





**Apply now!** 




 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Recruitment is handled in collaboration with Inhouse IT & Tech. Selection is ongoing, so don’t wait! Apply directly via www.inhouse.se.
 



 For questions, contact recruitment consultant Louise Hagen Furugård at louise.furugard@inhouse.se or 073-311 87 26.

title: Sales Executive Senior-Merchant
description:
We are Worldpay. Our technology powers the world’s economy and our teams bring innovation to life. We champion diversity to deliver the best products and solutions for our colleagues, clients and communities. If you’re ready to start learning, growing and making an impact with a career in fintech, we’d like to know: Are you Worldpay?
   

  

**About The Role**
 In a Sales Executive - Merchant - Quota Carrier role, you will work as a member of a sales team to find new opportunities for continued growth. This will include providing industry-leading payment solutions to prospective clients, which could include small- and medium-sized business as well as large, enterprise businesses.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Act as the strategic sales thread while consulting with prospects at the owner and C-suite level.
* Leverage referred leads and self-cultivated leads to nurture your pipeline.
* Connecting with prospects to help improve their experience, cash flow, and bottom line.
* Collaborate with sales teams and focusing on growing the existing customer base.


**What You Will Need**
* At least 2 to 4 years of sales experience including research, discovering needs, recommending solutions and solving business problems.
* Experience in technology solutions is helpful, as is a background in the payments industry.
* A consultative approach that’s successful with C-suite and business owners.


**What We Offer You**
 At Worldpay, you can learn, grow and make an impact in your career. Our benefits include:
   

  

* Flexible and creative work environment
* Diverse and collaborative atmosphere
* Professional and personal development resources
* Opportunities to volunteer and support charities
* Competitive salary and benefits

title: Enterprise Architect – Credit & Banking (Mainframe, Integration & Modernization)
description:
CGI is looking for a senior Enterprise Architect to strengthen our Banking & Financial Services practice in Stockholm. The role focuses on Credit and core banking platforms, with a strong emphasis on Mainframe systems, enterprise integration, and modernization.
   

  

 You will work closely with our clients to define future IT direction, ensure architectural coherence, and support long-term transformation initiatives. The role combines strategic advisory responsibilities with a solid technical foundation, in line with Nordic values of trust, pragmatism, and collaboration.
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

* Collaborate with senior stakeholders to define IT vision and target-state architecture
* Translate business needs, regulatory requirements, and risk considerations into architecture roadmaps
* Provide guidance on technology choices, modernization paths, and integration strategies
* Support architecture governance and cross-domain alignment
* Define enterprise architecture covering Mainframe and modern platforms
* Design and govern integration architectures (APIs, middleware, messaging, event-driven solutions)
* Support Mainframe modernization initiatives, including hybrid and incremental approaches
* Contribute to cloud and hybrid architecture adoption in regulated banking environments
* Ensure non-functional requirements such as security, resilience, scalability, and performance


**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
* At least 15 years of experience in enterprise architecture within Banking / Financial Services
* Strong domain knowledge in Credit and core banking
* Proven experience with Mainframe technologies (z/OS, COBOL, CICS, DB2)
* Experience integrating legacy platforms with modern architectures
* Familiarity with enterprise architecture frameworks (e.g. TOGAF)
* Strong communication skills and experience working with senior stakeholders


**Want to Learn More?**
 We look forward to hearing from you! Applications will be reviewed continuously, and the position may be filled before the final application deadline. For further information about this position, please contact the Hiring Manager Niriksha Shetty niriksha.shetty@cgi.com
   

  

****What CGI Offers****
* Long-term and trusted client relationships
* Assignments with real impact in the Nordic banking sector
* Collaborative, respectful, and inclusive work culture
* Opportunities for continuous learning and professional development
* Competitive compensation and benefits


**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Domänarkitekt med huvudinriktning Analys och Data
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens infrastruktur för dataanalys för Sveriges Riksbank i rollen som domänarkitekt? Du kommer leda arbete med målarkitekturen för din domän, driva teknisk utveckling och skapa moderna, skalbara lösningar i en hybridmiljö med hög teknisk mognad. Här får du ett stort handlingsutrymme, inflytande i strategiskt viktiga beslut och chansen att bidra direkt till ett samhällsviktigt uppdrag.
 



  





 Riksbanken är Sveriges centralbank med uppdrag att säkerställa låg och stabil inflation, att det finansiella systemet fungerar effektivt och att betalningar kan genomföras säkert. Som en samhällsbärande myndighet är vi en nyckelspelare i svensk ekonomi.
 



  





 Som Domänarkitekt
 
 får du en avgörande och ledande roll i att driva den tekniska transformationen genom ändamålsenlig målarkitektur och etablerande av nästa generations lösningar med mål att förbättra Riksbankens analysförmågor. Du kommer agera i rollen som domänarkitekt för ett eller flera verksamhetsområden där du är med och driver förändringsarbete för att skapa Riksbankens framtida lösningar.
 



  





 På Riksbanken arbetar vi i en modern containeriserad hybridmiljö som kombinerar on-premise och molntjänster. Några av applikationer som vi använder oss av inom dataområdet är LakeFS, MinIO, Dagster, Jupyter och OpenMetadata. Arbetssättet inom området bygger på en hög grad av decentralisering där centrala plattformsteam skapar förutsättningar för tekniskt kompetenta team i olika delar av organisationen. Vi är öppna för nya tekniska lösningar och strävar efter att snabbt kunna utveckla och lansera nya förmågor.
 



  





**DET HÄR GÖR DU HOS OSS** 




 Vi är på en resa där du har alla möjligheter att påverka och forma hur vi bygger upp alltifrån arbetssätt till utformningen av vårt framtida IT-landskap.
 



  





 Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter
 


* Leda arbetet med att kontinuerligt vidareutveckla och implementera analys- och dataområdets målarkitektur
* Arbeta nära verksamheten för att fortsätta utveckla organisationen för dataanalys och ta fram datalösningar med hög grad av självhjälp för kodande ekonomer och analytiker
* Medverka i styrningen av relevanta verksamhetsområden
* Översätta organisationens behov till fungerande lösningar och leda krav- och lösningsworkshoppar
* Samverka internt med verksamhet, utvecklingsteam och förvaltningsorganisation samt externt i relevanta forum med andra myndigheter och internationella organ
* Säkerställa att IT strategi, styrande principer och riktlinjer för IT-arkitektur efterlevs och kontinuerligt utvecklas
* Jobba på strategisk-, taktisk- och operativ nivå
* Omvärldsbevaka inom området



  





**DITT TEAM** 




 Riksbankens IT-avdelning leds av en IT-chef/CIO och består av sex enheter som leds av varsin enhetschef. Du tillhör Enheten för Säkerhet och Arkitektur där du kommer arbeta nära andra domänarkitekter, lösningsarkitekter, informationsarkitekter och IT-säkerhetsarkitekter.
 



  





**MER OM DIG** 




 Du har förmåga till helhetssyn och genuint intresse för hur IT kan användas för att stödja verksamhetsbehov samt är van att arbeta med lösningsalternativ. Du har erfarenhet av att omsätta kunskap till praktisk tillämpning med fokus på framdrift, realisering, återanvändbarhet och kostnadseffektivitet.
 



  





 Krav
 


* Du har mångårig erfarenhet som lösningsarkitekt inom främst open source-baserade dataplattformar och datasjöar med både on-premise och moln som distributionsmodell
* Du har flera års praktisk erfarenhet av programmering
* Har flera års erfarenhet av arkitekturarbete i agil kontext såväl som i traditionella förändringsprojekt
* Kan bra svenska och engelska både i tal och skrift
* Utbildning inom exempelvis datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande relevant utbildning eller arbetserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig



  





 Meriterande
 


* Erfarenhet av kravställning mot leverantörer
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med förvaltningsorganisationer
* Erfarenhet av att jobba i en myndighet
* Certifiering som lösningsarkitekt, domänarkitekt, verksamhetsarkitekt, IT-arkitekt eller motsvarande



  





 Du är initiativtagande samt mål- och resultatinriktad. Du är positiv, drivande och strukturerad och bra på att lösa komplexa problem. Du är van att leda workshops, dokumentera och presentera. Du har en god samarbetsförmåga och trivs att arbeta tillsammans med andra mot ett gemensamt mål. Du har också en mycket god kommunikationsförmåga. Du kan diskutera tekniska frågeställningar och lösningar både med tekniska specialister och med personer utan teknisk kunskap.
 



  





**MER OM TJÄNSTEN** 




**Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse** 




**Anställningstyp: Tillsvidareanställning** 




**Placering: Huvudkontoret på Brunkebergstorg samt HK Klara Klarabergsgatan, mitt i centrala Stockholm** 




**Arbetstid: Förtroendearbetstid** 




**Möjlighet att jobba distans: upp till 2 dagar i veckan** 




**Förmåner:** 
 Generösa semestervillkor, löneväxling till pension, subventionerad lunch i personalmatsal, friskvårdsbidrag, subventionerad massage och tillgång till gym och ledarledda träningspass. Läs mer om våra förmåner här .
 



  





 Tjänsten kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning innefattande registerkontroll, säkerhetsprövningssamtal och särskild personutredning görs då för slutkandidaten. För vissa tjänster ställs krav på svenskt medborgarskap.
 



  





**ANSÖK** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Riksbanken med rekryteringsföretaget ComputerSweden Recruitment. Deras rekryterare gör ett första urval i samråd med rekryterande chef samt utför intervjuer. De kandidater som går vidare träffar sedan rekryterande chef.
 



  





 Vid frågor
 
 är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Britta Liljegren, rekryteringskonsult på 070-771 18 11, britta.liljegren@csrecruitment.se eller Alexandra Tihinen, rekryteringskonsult, på 070-447 92 24 eller alexandra.tihinen@csrecruitment.se .
 



 Vi vill ha din ansökan senast
 **2026-02-27** 
 . Logiska tester och arbetsprov kan komma att ingå som en del av rekryteringsprocessen. Vi genomför också bakgrundskontroller på slutkandidaterna, vilket innebär att du lämnar in examensbevis eller annat dokument som styrker din utbildning och vi kontrollerar att dessa stämmer.
 



 Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Data & Tech Director till Choreograph / WPP Media
description:
**Vill du forma framtidens data- och techstrategier och driva affärsresultat för ledande varumärken?** 




  





***Nu söker vi en Data & Tech Director som vill ta ett strategiskt och affärsdrivet ansvar för att utveckla vårt erbjudande och hjälpa våra kunder att maximera värdet av sina investeringar. I den här rollen kommer du att vara en nyckelspelare i att driva affärsutveckling, arbeta nära ledningsgrupper och ta fram insiktsdrivna strategier som förbättrar både marknadsföring och affärsresultat.***




  





 Choreograph är WPP Medias Data & Tech-hub – en samlingsplats för några av branschens skarpaste hjärnor inom data, analys och teknik. Vi hjälper våra kunder att fatta bättre beslut och driva affärsutveckling genom datadrivna strategier och tekniska lösningar.
 



  





 Trivs du i en senior rådgivande expertroll där du med samlad erfarenhet inom analys, martech, CRM och datadriven affärsutveckling får möjlighet att ta ett strategiskt ansvar att hjälpa våra kunder att maximera värdet av sin data och teknologi? Trivs du med att leda digitala transformationsprojekt, utbilda andra och tala inför kunder och branschkollegor?
 



  





 Då kan det här vara rätt roll för dig!
 



  





  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Data & Tech Director är du en strategisk rådgivare som hjälper våra kunder att översätta sina affärsmål till konkreta och skalbara datadrivna strategier. Du leder uppdrag från behovsanalys till leverans, äger kunddialogen och säkerställer att data och teknik används på ett sätt som skapar verklig affärsnytta.
 



  





 Du kommer att ha en affärsnära och kundfokuserad roll, där du både säljer in och levererar projekt. Det innebär att du ansvarar för att identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter, skapa presentationer och strategiska rekommendationer samt leda workshops och kundmöten.
 



  





 Utöver kundarbetet har du en central roll i utvecklingen av Choreographs data & tech-erbjudande samt teamet genom mentorskap och kunskapsdelning.
 



  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter** 



* Leda och driva kunduppdrag inom data, analys, martech och digital transformation
* Fungera som strategisk rådgivare till ledningsgrupper och beslutsfattare
* Utveckla och presentera datadrivna strategier och rekommendationer
* Driva workshops, kundmöten och strategiska diskussioner
* Identifiera affärsmöjligheter och bidra till försäljning och erbjudandeutveckling
* Coacha och utveckla juniora konsulter och specialister
* Säkerställa att Choreograph ligger i framkant inom data, teknik och analys



  





  





**Om dig** 




 Vi söker dig som har lång erfarenhet inom data, analys, martech, CRM och datadriven affärsutveckling och är flytande i både svenska och engelska (tal och skrift).
 



  





**Vi ser gärna att du har:** 



* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av strategiskt rådgivning inom ovan områden
* Stark förmåga att koppla data och teknik till affärsresultat
* Erfarenhet från olika större martech- eller dataplattformar samt dess arkitektur
* Erfarenhet av att analysera data utifrån verktyg som Google Analytics 4, SQL, BI-verktyg eller molnplattformar som GCP
* God teknisk förståelse med stor erfarenhet av att leda komplexa digitala uppdrag och transformationsprojekt
* God vana att arbeta nära ledningsgrupper och beslutsfattare
* Erfarenhet av att tala vid branschevent samt skapa och hålla utbildningar och presentationer för ledningsgrupper
* Förmåga att ta en aktiv roll i affärsutveckling och försäljning
* Relevant akademisk utbildning inom teknik, analys, marknadsföring, ekonomi eller liknande



  





**Meriterande** 



* Erfarenhet av Google Marketing Platform (GMP), Adobe Experience Cloud eller molntjänster (t.ex. GCP, AWS)
* Förståelse för medielandskapet (betald, förtjänad och ägd media)
* Förståelse för digital marknadsföring och hur CRM-data används för att optimera kampanjer och kundresor
* Erfarenhet av affärsutveckling och försäljning i konsultmiljö



  





**Som person tror vi att du** 



* Har förmåga att leda och driva kundprojekt, från analys till strategi och implementering
* Har ett analytiskt och strukturerat tankesätt med en problemlösningsorienterad inställning
* Har förmåga att kommunicera tydligt och anpassa budskap till olika målgrupper
* Trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och tillsammans med andra i olika teamkonstellationer
* Drivs av att lösa utmaningar tillsammans



  





  





**Varför WPP Media?** 




 Vi erbjuder en roll där du får kombinera strategi, analys och teknik för att verkligen påverka hur data används i marknadsföring och affärsutveckling. Här får du möjligheten att arbeta med ledande varumärken och vara en del av digitala transformationsprojekt på hög nivå. Du ges frihet att driva egna initiativ och bidra till utvecklingen av vårt erbjudande inom Data & Tech. Dessutom blir du en del av en dynamisk och social arbetsmiljö där innovation och expertis står i centrum.
 



  





  





**Om tjänsten och ansökan** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering på vårt huvudkontor i centrala Stockholm.
 



  





 Rekryteringen görs i samarbete med WOOW Executive Search, rekryteringsexperter inom digital marknadsföring, marknad, sälj, analys och martech - från juniora roller till CxO-nivå och ledning. Vid frågor och intresse kontakta Anton på 070-7321930 (anton@woowes.com) eller Lisa på 070-7505760 (lisa@woowes.com).
 



  





 Med anledning av GDPR hanteras endast ansökningar som inkommer via ansökningslänken för uppdraget.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer
description:
*To one of our important customers in Lund we are now looking for a Mechanical Engineer with CATIA V6 competence.*

**Scope of the assignment:**

* Integrate components designed in our partner facilities and manage their integration into the ESS Master CAD model
* Participate directly in the system assembly, machine installation and relevant operations: Activities and work can take place on surface assembly halls (laboratories).
* Generate, maintain and update 2D drawings in CATIA environment and interact/archive them in CHESS (the ESS in-house CAD management software tool).
* Generate 2D design from 3D input.
* Generate 3D model from 2D input.
* Generate 2D and 3D from Requirements input.
* Generation and updates of conceptual, draft, detailed and manufacturing 2D drawings (and 3D models) in CATIA V6.
* Produce, update and review technical documentation.
* Provide installation coordination on site, Generate 2D installation drawings and documentation.
* Follow-up manufacturing of components, monitor production performance and conduct engineering quality and acceptance inspections.
* Document and present your work as appropriate.
* Reviewer responsibility in the Mechanical Engineering discipline, drawings, and engineering packages.
* Review 2D drawing according to mechanical standardization norms and codes for but not limited to GPS tolerancing, ISO, etc.

**Required education background and professional experience**

**Technical & Engineering skills & background**

* Higher Technical or University engineering degree in mechanical engineering or other closely equivalent engineering degree
* Knowledge of basic mechanical engineering
* Minimum 5 years of CAD mechanical design engineering experience
* Minimum 3 years of working experience in CATIA design
* Experience with design maturity, versioning and release
* Previous work experience in scientific facility is a bonus.
* Experience with Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing and its application to production drawings
* Experience and knowledge of maintenance drawings and installation drawings (also industrial) will be an asset.
* Experience and knowledge of technical documentation and configuration management will be an asset.
* Relevant experience in designing mechanical apparatuses fulfilling specific needs for accelerator and detector environments will be an asset.
* Engineering experience on any of the following technologies: radiation background, vacuum, pressure, gas flow, magnetic field, low-frequency radiofrequency, high temperature, cryogenic, or electrical and electronics will be considered an asset.

**Behavioral**

* Showing initiative: Demonstrate self-motivation is essential.
* Managing self: working well autonomously; taking on activities and tasks without prompting; projecting self-confidence when presenting ideas, proposals, and opinions.
* Following orders: Communicating effectively with the goal to understand and follow orders, propose technical solutions at the direction set from management.
* Demonstrating flexibility: adapting quickly and resourcefully to shifting priorities and requirements.
* Demonstrates an understanding of how one issue may be a part of a much larger system. Produces pragmatic and workable solutions to a range of problems.
* Achieving results: having a structured and organized approach towards work; being able to set priorities and plan tasks with results in mind; delivering high quality work on time and fulfilling expectations; producing comprehensive work / project plans considering resources and contingencies.
* Adaptability, good communication skills and the ability to identify issues and proactively work to solve them are necessary to perform well in this position.
* Adaptability to the continuously updating and changing project needs and flexibility to manage work according to project needs.
* Excellent oral and written English skills are prerequisites; knowledge of other European language(s) would be an advantage.

title: QA Automation Engineer
description:
We are looking for an experienced QA Automation Engineer who is passionate about quality, automation, and modern engineering practices. This role requires strong technical expertise in automated testing, API validation, and QA methodologies, combined with hands-on experience using AI tools or building solutions that enhance testing efficiency, accuracy, and scalability.


You are detail-oriented, proactive, and able to work across teams to ensure consistent, stable, and high-performing software releases. You stay current with emerging technologies—including advancements in automation and AI—and enjoy applying them to real engineering workflows.

**Responsibilities**

* Design, develop, and maintain automated testing frameworks for backend services, APIs, and UI workflows.
* Use or create AI-powered tools to improve the QA lifecycle (e.g., automated test generation, log-anomaly detection, AI-assisted debugging, intelligent regression selection).
* Participate in planning discussions and contribute QA and automation insights early in the development process.
* Execute manual and automated regression testing for scheduled release cycles.
* Ensure test coverage, reliability, and performance across multiple systems and environments.
* Review product features to identify edge cases, automation opportunities, and risks.
* Collaborate with engineering teams (local and offshore) to define quality standards and maintain test execution pipelines.
* Troubleshoot issues, analyze root causes, and support engineering teams in resolving defects efficiently.

**Requirements**

**Requirements**

* 8+ years of QA Engineering experience, including strong hands-on automation.
* 2–3+ years of experience in backend and API testing workflows.
* Proficiency with automation frameworks such as Cypress, Playwright, or similar.
* Strong understanding of QA methodologies, test architecture, and CI/CD integration.
* Curiosity and willingness to leverage AI-driven tools and techniques to enhance QA automation, validation, and overall software quality.
* Experience with browser dev tools, API tools, and automated UI testing.
* Ability to design complex test data using Excel or Google Sheets.
* Familiarity with Atlassian Jira and Confluence.
* Highly detail-oriented with strong communication and analytical skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively across distributed engineering teams.
* Self-starter who thrives in fast-paced engineering environments.
* Knowledge of digital media or ad-tech is a plus.
* Ability to travel

title: Energy Monitoring System Engineer for Buildings
description:
*With technology, software, and services for smart buildings, we transform the everyday for everyone. By combining the real and digital worlds, we empower our customers to reach their decarbonization goals, lower their operating* *costs* *and create world-class occupant experiences for their people.* *It’s* *not just about improving buildings -* *it’s* *about creating efficient, safe, adaptable, and sustainable environments, which improve the way the world lives and works.*  

*The digital transformation of buildings is a fast-changing, dynamic sector, and it needs more than* *just great* *technology - it needs great people, too. We know a business only thrives if its people are thriving, so at Siemens we put our people first.*  

*Within our* *buildings* *business, our diverse global team will support you through your career and challenge you to grow in new and exciting ways, as we transform the world’s infrastructure.*
  

*Our shared journey could take you anywhere…where would you like to go?*  

Energy Monitoring System Engineer for Smart Infrastructure Buildings

  

In the role of Energy Monitoring System Engineer you have a significant role in our energy projects and ensure that we achieve guaranteed energy savings in our customers' properties. You could say that you are the bank in our energy projects, where you set the right indoor climate in the properties, ensure that we reach calculated and agreed-upon savings, and implement the right measures in cases where we need to make adjustments.


Your days are varied; one day might start with going to the office (or logging in from home), having your morning coffee, and then connecting remotely via our superior systems to patrol, analyze, and optimize energy in our customers' connected facilities. After that, a fault report or alarm might come in that you need to act on to solve the problem. Other days, you'll have scheduled meetings with customers and then review work orders, reports, and update customer and internal documentation for the projects. You also participate in sales and marketing projects, ensuring effective follow-up and providing improvement suggestions to your sales colleagues.

 **Who are you?**  

This position suits you if you have post-secondary education in energy, HVAC, control and regulation, and several years of practical experience in a role where you've worked with control and regulation within building automation, preferably as a technician. We would like you to have been involved in energy efficiency projects and have an understanding of how temperature changes affect the climate in properties. You are also accustomed to documenting your work and have experience writing reports.


You have an interest in energy and environmental issues and want to come to a place where you both want to contribute and develop your knowledge. As a person, you have a service-minded attitude and thrive in a role with many contact surfaces, both internally and externally. Since the role involves many contacts, communication is also an important quality for you. Your working style is characterized by being proactive, structured, responsible, and you find it easy to collaborate with your team and customers.

  

You are fluent in a Nordic language as well as in English, both spoken and written, and have a B driver's license as travel may occur in this position.


Location may be in any of our Siemens’ offices throughout the Nordics.

 **Join us!**  

We need you to reach our goals. So, if you find this position interesting, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible, and latest by 28 February. We will be assessing candidates on an ongoing basis, so make sure that we receive your application! For questions about the role, please contact Joakim Sellgren at Joakim.sellgren@siemens.com or +46 (0)8-5784 105.

  

  

We look forward to hearing from you!

 **About us**

*Siemens is a global technology powerhouse, dedicated to industry, infrastructure, transport, and healthcare. Our mission is to transform the everyday, creating intelligent and sustainable solutions that shape the future.*  

  

*With more than 300,000 employees in over 200 countries, we combine the power of digitalization and engineering to help customers increase efficiency, cut emissions, and drive innovation. Through our acquisition of Danfoss Fire Safety A/S,* *we're* *expanding our capabilities* *in* *fire safety innovation to deliver cleaner, smarter, and more effective solutions.*
company_description: We are a leading technology company - focused on industry, infrastructure, transport, and healthcare - that transforms the everyday of billions of people.

title: Design Engineer
description:
Design Engineer


Position: Design Engineer
Location: Danderyd
Department: Vacuum Conveying Division
Type: Employee - Permanent**About Piab Group:**  

At Piab Group we improve our customers' productivity, sustainability, and safety through evolving industrial automation and have done so since 1951. We believe in an automated world where no resources are wasted, and no humans are injured. With annual sales of ~3 billion SEK and more than 1400 employees, Piab is a global organization, serving customers in more than 100 countries from a vast network of subsidiaries and channel partners. Since 2018, Piab Group has been owned by Patricia Industries, part of Investor AB  

The Vacuum Conveying Division strengthens Piab Group’s position as a world-leading automation company. We offer cutting-edge solutions for moving powders, granules, and small parts, ensuring efficient and hygienic material handling across various industries.  

  

**You can expect the following with us:**  

**Innovative Culture:** *Be part of a team that thrives on creativity and innovation.*  

**Global Impact:** *Work with a company that is a world leader in vacuum transport solutions.*  

**Global Presence:** *Piab has 25+ sales offices and over 900 partners worldwide, ensuring a vast network and global reach*  

**Sustainable Vision:** *Contribute to an automated world, promoting safety and efficiency.*  

**Professional Growth:** *Access opportunities for continuous learning and career advancement.*  

**Diverse and Inclusive:** *Join a workplace that values diversity and fosters an inclusive environment.*  

**Stable employer:** *As part of Patricia Industries and connected to the Wallenberg family, Piab benefits from strong support and a commitment to long-term growth and sustainability.*  

  

**Job Mission**  

As a Design Engineer**,** you take end‑to‑end technical ownership of mechanical solutions for our vacuum conveying products and related industrial automation equipment. From early requirements and concepts, through detailed design and verification, to handover to production, you ensure that our solutions are robust, safe, cost‑efficient and manufacturable.  

You will work hands‑on in 3D CAD and PDM/PLM systems to develop frames, sheet metal parts, weldments, piping/tubing, enclosures and fixtures, contributing directly to Piab’s mission of creating safe, sustainable and efficient material handling solutions for our customers.  

  

**Key Responsibilities**  

**In this role you will:**  

* Take technical ownership of mechanical solutions from requirements and concept to released product in production.
* Work hands‑on in 3D CAD (preferably SolidWorks and/or Solid Edge) and PDM/PLM systems (ideally Teamcenter) with models, drawings, BOMs and change requests.
* Design industrial/machinery/automation components and assemblies (frames, sheet metal, weldments, piping/tubing, enclosures, fixtures, etc.) with a strong focus on function, safety and reliability.
* Apply good engineering practice in dimensioning, strength calculations, and material selection (steel, stainless steel, aluminium, plastics).
* Take designs from concept prototype industrialisation/production, securing a smooth transition to manufacturing.
* Create clear 2D drawings with appropriate tolerances, fits, surface finishes and ISO/GD&T according to relevant standards.
* Ensure quality, cost‑efficiency and manufacturability of designs, applying DFM/DFA principles.
* Troubleshoot and solve mechanical issues in design, testing/prototyping and from field/customer feedback.
* Collaborate closely with R&D colleagues (mechanical, mechatronics, software), Operations/Production, Product Management, Sales and Service to translate needs into clear design requirements.
* Contribute to improving design methods, standards, platforms/modules and technical documentation.
* Act as a technical reference and mentor for more junior mechanical designers in the team.


documentation.  

* Act as a technical reference and mentor for more junior mechanical designers in the team.

  

**Preferred Competencies**  

**Technical skills**  

* Strong, hands‑on mechanical engineer with excellent 3D CAD skills, preferably SolidWorks and/or Solid Edge.
* Used to working in PDM/PLM systems, ideally Teamcenter, with structured handling of revisions, BOMs and change management.
* Solid experience in industrial / machinery / automation design (e.g. frames, sheet metal, weldments, piping/tubing, enclosures, fixtures).
* Good understanding of dimensioning, strength, and material selection for metals and plastics.
* Strong 2D drawing skills including tolerances, fits, surface finishes and ISO/GD&T.
* Familiar with DFM/DFA and designing for cost‑efficient manufacturing and assembly.
* Knowledge of relevant standards and directives for industrial machinery (e.g. safety, CE) is a plus.
* Ability to think in terms of systems and modules, not just single parts; experience with modular/product platforms and variants is valuable.
* Experience with product configurators such as Tacton is an advantage.


  

**Experience & Education**  

* BSc or MSc in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent technical education.
* Several years of relevant experience as a mechanical designer/engineer in industrial products, machinery, automation or related fields.
* Professional experience with 3D CAD and PDM/PLM tools in a product development environment.
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written; Swedish is an advantage.

  

**Employee Insights**  

“Working in a collaborative environment where everyone’s voice is valued—that’s the #PiabDifference. #Inclusivity #Teamwork”  

  

**How to Apply:**  

If you are passionate about innovation and want to make a difference in the world of automation, we would love to hear from you! Click “apply” to upload your CV.  

Please be advised that a valid work permit for the country we offer the open vacancy in is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit cannot be considered.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer
description:
To one of our important customers in Lund we are now looking for a Mechanical Engineer with CATIA V6 competence.
  
  

**Scope of the assignment:**  

Integrate components designed in our partner facilities and manage their integration into the ESS Master CAD model
  
  

Participate directly in the system assembly, machine installation and relevant operations: Activities and work can take place on surface assembly halls (laboratories).
  
  

Generate, maintain and update 2D drawings in CATIA environment and interact/archive them in CHESS (the ESS in-house CAD management software tool).
  
  

Generate 2D design from 3D input.
  
  

Generate 3D model from 2D input.
  
  

Generate 2D and 3D from Requirements input.
  
  

Generation and updates of conceptual, draft, detailed and manufacturing 2D drawings (and 3D models) in CATIA V6.
  
  

Produce, update and review technical documentation.
  
  

Provide installation coordination on site, Generate 2D installation drawings and documentation.
  
  

Follow-up manufacturing of components, monitor production performance and conduct engineering quality and acceptance inspections.
  
  

Document and present your work as appropriate.
  
  

Reviewer responsibility in the Mechanical Engineering discipline, drawings, and engineering packages.
  
  

Review 2D drawing according to mechanical standardization norms and codes for but not limited to GPS tolerancing, ISO, etc.
  
  

Required education background and professional experience
  
Technical & Engineering skills & background
  
  

Higher Technical or University engineering degree in mechanical engineering or other closely equivalent engineering degree
  
  

Knowledge of basic mechanical engineering
  
  

Minimum 5 years of CAD mechanical design engineering experience
  
  

Minimum 3 years of working experience in CATIA design
  
  

Experience with design maturity, versioning and release
  
  

Previous work experience in scientific facility is a bonus.
  
  

Experience with Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing and its application to production drawings
  
  

Experience and knowledge of maintenance drawings and installation drawings (also industrial) will be an asset.
  
  

Experience and knowledge of technical documentation and configuration management will be an asset.
  
  

Relevant experience in designing mechanical apparatuses fulfilling specific needs for accelerator and detector environments will be an asset.
  
  

**Engineering experience on any of the following technologies:** radiation background, vacuum, pressure, gas flow, magnetic field, low-frequency radiofrequency, high temperature, cryogenic, or electrical and electronics will be considered an asset.
  
  

Behavioral
  
  

**Showing initiative:** Demonstrate self-motivation is essential.
  
  

**Managing self:** working well autonomously; taking on activities and tasks without prompting; projecting self-confidence when presenting ideas, proposals, and opinions.
  
  

**Following orders:** Communicating effectively with the goal to understand and follow orders, propose technical solutions at the direction set from management.
  
  

**Demonstrating flexibility:** adapting quickly and resourcefully to shifting priorities and requirements.
  
  

Demonstrates an understanding of how one issue may be a part of a much larger system. Produces pragmatic and workable solutions to a range of problems.
  
  

**Achieving results:** having a structured and organized approach towards work; being able to set priorities and plan tasks with results in mind; delivering high quality work on time and fulfilling expectations; producing comprehensive work / project plans considering resources and contingencies.
  
  

Adaptability, good communication skills and the ability to identify issues and proactively work to solve them are necessary to perform well in this position.
  
  

Adaptability to the continuously updating and changing project needs and flexibility to manage work according to project needs.
  
  

Excellent oral and written English skills are prerequisites; knowledge of other European language(s) would be an advantage.

title: Test Engineer
description:
ALTEN is expanding its presence in the automotive industry and we are now looking for a Test Engineer to join our team. If you have a passion for quality, technology, and innovative vehicles, this is a great opportunity to work at the forefront of automotive R&D.

  

Your role


As a Test Engineer at ALTEN, you will play a key role in ensuring the functionality, performance, and quality of complex automotive systems. You will work in close collaboration with cross-functional teams to test and verify electronic, software, and mechatronic systems in modern vehicles.


Your main responsibilities will include:

* Planning, designing, and executing manual and automated test cases
* Performing regression, system, and functional testing in HIL, SIL, and/or vehicle environments
* Troubleshooting and analyzing test results, reporting issues to development teams
* Collaborating with developers, system engineers, and project managers to ensure high-quality deliveries
* Developing and improving test methods and automation frameworks
* Conducting in-vehicle testing with precision and attention to detail



Your profile


You have a relevant technical education (e.g. B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electronics, Mechatronics, Computer Science, or similar) and a few years of experience working with testing or verification of complex systems, preferably in the automotive field.

  

You bring:

* Experience in manual and automated testing
* Knowledge of regression and system testing
* Ability to design and maintain test cases independently
* Hands-on experience with tools such as Jenkins and Python (or similar)
* Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills in HIL/SIL/vehicle environments
* Excellent English communication skills, written and spoken
* A valid Swedish or EU driver’s license (vehicle testing may be part of the job)
* Previous experience within the automotive industry

  

Meritorious Experience

* Background in test automation and scripting
* Knowledge of automotive communication protocols (CAN, LIN, FlexRay, Ethernet)
* Experience with requirement management tools (SystemWeaver, DOORS, Polarion, or similar)



**About ALTEN**


ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest consulting companies within Engineering, IT and Life Sciences with over 54,000 employees in more than 30 countries. We’re a global actor with a local presence with 1400 committed colleagues in offices from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the product development chain of the most prestigious companies in sectors such as Automotive, Aerospace & Defense, Energy, Manufacturing, Public Sector and Life Sciences.

  

For four years in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden’s most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.


  
JOBB DETALJER


 09/02/2026


Göteborg
REKRYTERING KONTAKT


 ALTEN Sweden

title: ASIC Design Engineer, Lund
description:
Job Title
ASIC Design Engineer, Lund
Job Description*Are you a talented engineer looking to kick-start or continue your career in ASIC design? Do you have a passion for technology and innovation? We're excited to hear from you!**Our team is looking for motivated and enthusiastic individuals who are eager to learn, grow, and contribute to the development of cutting-edge technology. We're committed to providing a supportive and collaborative environment that will help you develop your skills and reach your full potential. Whether you're just starting your career or looking to take the next step, we offer a dynamic and challenging work environment that will help you achieve your goals.*
Who is your future team?
We design hardware blocks used in Axis’s integrated circuits as well as in some of our FPGA platforms. Our team takes pride in delivering top-quality work using the latest techniques. The team is senior, and you will have the possibility to work with a wide variety of different tasks depending on your interest. As a member of our team, you will have ample opportunities to learn and grow in a creative environment  

What will you do?
Your team within ASIC Design is responsible for developing Axis's own ASICs, the ARTPEC, with hardware acceleration of essential functions in a surveillance camera. We design, develop, and implement the hardware modules that are integrated into a circuit (ASIC), giving us the competitive edge in Axis technology leadership. You will work in a skilled team with tasks such as specification, modeling, defining architectures, design and integration (RTL), analysis (performance, area, power, quality), and user documentation. For the next exciting project you will work with I/O and accelerator design as well as external IP integration.
Our hardware blocks often implement functionality such as image processing, video compression and computer vision. The tasks and roles may differ through the project depending on your interest, project needs, and experience, allowing for your personal development as well as the development of your team.
Most likely, you would have several personal interfaces that you would cooperate with both internally and outside our team with people responsible for software, algorithms, vendors, electronics, and products.
At the start, you will be provided with a mentor that will help you during the onboarding program and accelerate your ramp-up, personal development, and guide you through Axis, giving you a foundation for a great network within the company.
What do we look for in an entry level engineer?* You see yourself as a top talent engineer with a genuine interest in advanced ASIC development.
* You have a passion for computer architectures and accelerators, eager to make your design the best possible in all aspects, covering power efficiency, area utilization and performance.
* You are highly motivated and are eager to continuously improve, learn more and to contribute to the team and Axis success.
* You just got your master’s degree in electrical engineering, computer science, physics, mathematics, or similar and are keen to use that as a base in a professional journey working with cutting edge chip development in Axis.
* Axis values teamwork very high and we welcome your contribution to a great team spirit in our working teams.


What do we look for in a senior engineer?* You see yourself as a top talent engineer with a genuine interest in advanced ASIC development and experience in the field of digital ASIC.
* Working knowledge within areas such as ASIC Design, System Architecture, Modelling and Subsystem Verification lies within the role as a senior ASIC Design Engineer.
* You enjoy sharing your knowledge and ideas with both senior and junior team members. Knowledge sharing is a key in both the team development as well as in the innovation process.
* You want to constantly improve yourself as well as the team and are willing to drive technical ideas as well as methodology improvements.


What Axis has to offer  

We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide. As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.
To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?  

Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.
We go through applications continuously so don’t wait – send in your application today!
In case of questions, please reach out to recruiting manager Patrik Lislén at +46 46 272 1800.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2026-03-09*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast

title: Project Engineers
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This Position reports to:


Engineering Manager  

**Your role and responsibilities**


In this role you will develop software for automatic crane systems and have the possibility to learn product development. We also see strong potential for this position to grow into a more leading role, with increased direct communication with customers, customer demands, and project responsibilities. You will create and modify the standard designs of equipment, systems, or installations, including standard specifications for manufacturing, fabrication or construction for assignments classified as low to medium complexity by applying standard design concepts.

  

You will be mainly accountable for:

* Design, develop, and maintain PLC software solutions for crane automation systems.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of software components.
* Optimize code for performance, reliability, and safety.
* Analyze system specifications and hardware schematics to ensure alignment with project requirements.
* Identify potential issues and propose improvements to enhance system functionality.
* Conduct thorough testing and validation of PLC code to verify correctness and adherence to standards.
* Debug and troubleshoot any issues during the testing phase.
* Communicate progress and potential delays to stakeholders.

 **Qualifications for the role**

* You hold an engineering degree in computer science or an equivalent field.
* You have practical experience in Codesys and/or C programming. Your proficiency in these languages enables you to develop efficient and reliable PLC software.
* Your skills extend to algorithm development. You can design and optimize algorithms to enhance system performance and responsiveness.
* Being self-organized and structured is essential for success in this role. You excel at managing tasks, meeting deadlines, and maintaining clear documentation.
* Your familiarity with ABB PLC Development Tools positions you well for this position. Additionally, your understanding of ABB automatic crane functionality gives you an edge.
* Previous experience in product development is considered a merit.
* Your insights into the product lifecycle and iterative development processes contribute to successful outcomes.
* You are proficient in both English and Swedish at a professional level.

 **What’s in it for you?**


We empower you to take initiative, challenge ideas, and lead with confidence. You’ll grow through meaningful work, continuous learning, and support that’s tailored to your goals. Every idea you share and every action you take contributes to something bigger.

 **More about us**


You will be part of the Ports business line within the Marine and Ports division that is specialized in advanced automation and information systems for all types of container and bulk cargo handling cranes, as well as OCR and electrical systems for container terminals. We offer an international and dynamic working environment where our business delivers advanced technology on large projects across the world in a customer oriented and highly globalized industry.

  

Recruiting Manager: Henrik Nordin, +46 73 448 14 58, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Johan Halling, +46 72-461 25 17, Unionen: Pär Ångbäck, +46 70-636 07 04, Ledarna: Olof Kvensler, +46 70-588 91 52. Talent Partner: Anna Nordlund

  

We look forward to reading your application in PDF format. Last day to apply is March 8. Please note that the interview process is ongoing, apply now to secure your spot in the recruitment process!


We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: Lead Engineer Hardware - Mechatronic systems
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Vi söker en Lead Engineer för mekatroniska system med cirka 5 års erfarenhet av produktutveckling inom mekatroniska system där hårdvaruutveckling, kravnedbrytning, systemdesign (topologi), kontrollstrategi, förståelse för mjukvaruutveckling och mycket mer ingår i uppgifterna. I den här rollen är du spindeln i nätet och koordinerar, planerar och genomför utvecklingen av systemet, synkar status krossfunktionellt och med projekt samt leder mindre team av ingenjörer för att lyckas med systemleveransen hos våra kunder.



**Om rollen**


Som Lead Engineer HW kommer du att:
  

- Ha ett helhetsansvar för systemdesign och funktionalitet i projekt där hårdvara och mjukvara samverkar.
  

- Koordinera kravställning, uppföljning och samarbete med leverantörer och interna utvecklingsteam.



- Säkerställa kvalitet genom analys av simulerings-, testnings- och verifieringsresultat i labb och fält.


* Koordinera och leda ingenjörsteam för att säkra kvalité och leverans av systemlösningen.

- Dokumentera och driva utvecklingsprocessen så att systemen blir robusta, driftsäkra och redo för produktion.
**Din profil**


Vi ser att du har:
  

- Civilingenjörsexamen inom mekatronik, maskinteknik eller liknande.
  

- Cirka 5 års erfarenhet av systemdesign och utveckling av mekatroniska system som kombinerar hårdvara och mjukvara.



- God förståelse och erfarenhet av skriptning med Python som programsspråk  

- God förmåga att koordinera och kommunicera mellan olika teknikområden och intressenter.
  

- Bekvämlighet i att arbeta nära både leverantörer och interna utvecklingsteam.



- Flytande svenska och engelska, både skriftligt och muntligt



**Meriterande**


- Erfarenhet av programmering.
  

- Erfarenhet från fordonsindustrin eller annan bransch med höga krav på systemintegration.
  

- Tidigare roller som systemägare eller tekniskt koordinerande ingenjör.



* Erfarenhet av kravnedbrytning och balansering


* Erfarenhet av digital och fysisk verifiering av mjukvara och hårdvara


* Erfarenhet av eller god förståelse för 1D, CFD, FEM och liknande simuleringar



**Rollen innebär**


En möjlighet att arbeta i en tekniskt avancerad miljö där du får ta ett centralt ansvar i utvecklingen av nästa generations produkter. Du blir en del av ett engagerat team som arbetar för att kombinera hårdvara och mjukvara i lösningar som gör skillnad.


**Vi erbjuder**



Vi är stora nog för att kunna erbjuda en bred kundbas och vi har ett gott rykte i branschen, samtidigt som vi är små nog att se dig som individ. För oss är gemenskap viktigt – här ska alla känna sig sedda och välkomna. Som en följd av detta har vi bland annat gemensamma sektionsaktiviteter, ett nätverk för kvinnor och icke-binära, ett mentorskapsprogam och utbildningar inom olika kompetensområden. Vi strävar efter att skapa en miljö där alla kan växa och utvecklas tillsammans.


Vår ambition är att tillgodose konsultens önskemål gällande uppdragslängd, sektor och arbetsuppgifter. För oss är en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv en självklarhet och vi är stolta över att vara en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare. Givetvis har vi också kollektivavtal.


Nyfiken på hur det känns att vara en del av vårt gäng? I den här filmen delar några av våra medarbetare med sig av sina tankar om vardagen, gemenskapen och varför de valt just oss: **https://vimeo.com/1058313176?share=copy#t=0**  



  

**OM SID**


Sigma Industry Development är ett teknik- och konsultbolag inom Sigmagruppen som hjälper både ledande svenska och internationella teknikföretag och innovativa och nytänkande start-ups och scale-ups. Vi verkar inom sektorer så som den gröna energisektorn, fordonsindustrin, transportindustrin, medtech, försvarsbranchen och hållbarhet.


Vår vision är att vara det ledande teknikkonsultbolaget och vår kultur präglas av familjär samhörighet där människan är i centrum. Med över 100 engagerade medarbetare är vi i en stark tillväxtfas. Vår kärnverksamhet ligger i konsultuppdrag ute hos kund, men vi har även ett in-house-team som arbetar uteslutande från kontoret. Precis som vårt namn antyder, är utveckling kärnan i allt vi gör och våra medarbetare engageras av att ta Sigma Industry Development till nästa nivå.  



  

**OM SIGMA GROUP**


Sigma Industry Development AB (SID) är ett av sex dotterbolag som ingår i koncernen Sigma Industry East/North Group, vilka i sin tur ingår i Sigma Group (som ägs av familjekoncernen Danir AB). Läs mer om Sigma Industry Development **HÄR**och om Sigma Group på **HÄR**.


Utöver att vara del av ett företag som värnar om teknologisk utveckling, arbetar för en bättre miljö och som främjar jämställdhet, så är en viktig del av vår verksamhet socialt ansvarstagande. Mer information om detta hittar du **HÄR**.


Start: Så snart som möjligt.



Vi rekryterar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!



Plats: Stockholm, Marievik


### **MORE INFORMATION**

  



Magdalena Hildan,  

Magdalena.Hildan@sigma.se
